original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pra t'i tya sa mutpa da sya a'a di bi bhangga yo ni rde sha /
analyzed: pra t'i tya sa mutpa da sya a'a di bi bhangga yo ni rde sha /
translated: Pratītyasamutpādasyādhivibhāga-yo nirdeśa

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po'i rnam par dbye ba bshad pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po'i rnam par dbye ba bshad pa /
translated: The first chapter, the analysis of dependent origination.🔽🔽

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.🔽

original: gang la blo mnga' rtogs par bya ba ma rtogs med //
analyzed: gang la blo mnga' rtogs par bya ba ma rtogs med //
translated: There is nothing that is not known to the one who has realized the mind.🔽

original: gang la dag mnga' phyi nas rnam par sbyang bya med //
analyzed: gang la dag mnga' phyi nas rnam par sbyang bya med //
translated: There is nothing to be purified later on for those who have this mastery.🔽

original: de ni 'jig rten mgon te 'jig rten mthar 'byin pa //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten mgon te 'jig rten mthar 'byin pa //
translated: He is the protector of the world, the one who ends the world.🔽

original: skye dgu rnams kyi gtso la spyi bos phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: skye dgu rnams kyi gtso la spyi bos phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage with my head to the chief of all beings.

original: chos kyang de dag nyid kyis ji bzhin bstan pa ni //
analyzed: chos kyang de dag nyid kyis ji bzhin bstan pa ni //
translated: And the Dharma is taught by them just as it is.

original: zhi ba gnas dang lam dang lam gyi ched du byas //
analyzed: zhi ba gnas dang lam dang lam gyi ched du byas //
translated: Peace is the basis, the path, and the goal.🔽

original: gang zhig rab tu rtogs pas sa gsum 'di dag tu //
analyzed: gang zhig rab tu rtogs pas sa gsum 'di dag tu //
translated: Whoever realizes this, for them these three worlds🔽

original: 'khor lo bzhin du 'gro ba 'di dag 'khor ba med //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhin du 'gro ba 'di dag 'khor ba med //
translated: These beings revolve like a wheel, but there is no revolving.

original: chos de dag la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i dge 'dun ni //
analyzed: chos de dag la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i dge 'dun ni //
translated: The noble community of those who abide in those teachings.

original: chags dang tshogs dag las ni shin tu 'das gyur nas //
analyzed: chags dang tshogs dag las ni shin tu 'das gyur nas //
translated: Having completely transcended attachment and the assemblies,

original: yan lag bcu dang yan lag brgyad dang dbye ba brgyad //
analyzed: yan lag bcu dang yan lag brgyad dang dbye ba brgyad //
translated: With ten and eight branches, divided into eight,

original: lam gyi 'bras bus 'bras bus kyang ni de dag rnams //
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bus 'bras bus kyang ni de dag rnams //
translated: By the result of the path, by the result, those

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon @2a * //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon @2a * //
translated: Dependent origination,

original: par brjod pa'i mdo //
analyzed: par brjod pa'i mdo //
translated: The sutra of clear expression.

original: cung zad nges par bshad pa bdag ni brjod par 'dod //
analyzed: cung zad nges par bshad pa bdag ni brjod par 'dod //
translated: I wish to explain a little bit.

original: bla ma las thos gzhan dag 'dod pa mthong nas kyang //
analyzed: bla ma las thos gzhan dag 'dod pa mthong nas kyang //
translated: Having seen others' desires heard from the guru,

original: de la brten te cung zad rab tu brtag par bya //
analyzed: de la brten te cung zad rab tu brtag par bya //
translated: Relying on that, I will analyze a little bit.

original: mdo sde gang zhe na ;
analyzed: mdo sde gang zhe na ;
translated: What is a sutra?

original: dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bstan gyis zhes bya ba'i mdo sde'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bstan gyis zhes bya ba'i mdo sde'o //
translated: Monks, I will teach you dependent origination, the first and its divisions. This is the sutra.

original: ci'i phyir 'di bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is this taught?

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, this great mass of suffering comes to be.

original: bstan pa de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this taught?

original: kha cig ni bdag med na ji ltar 'khor bar 'gyur zhes mi shes pa dang the tshom dang log par shes pa dang ldan pa de dag bsal ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag med na ji ltar 'khor bar 'gyur zhes mi shes pa dang the tshom dang log par shes pa dang ldan pa de dag bsal ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Some, not knowing, doubting, or misunderstanding how there is cyclic existence without a self, this is taught to eliminate their doubts.

original: bdag ni bdag tu lta ba dang sred pa'i gnyen po'i phyir yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: bdag ni bdag tu lta ba dang sred pa'i gnyen po'i phyir yin par mthong ngo //
translated: The self is seen as the antidote to the view of self and craving.

original: de ltar na bdag med par sdug bsngal 'byung bar bstan pas stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang rjes su mthun par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag med par sdug bsngal 'byung bar bstan pas stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang rjes su mthun par byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by teaching that suffering arises without a self, he makes it accord with emptiness and wishlessness.

original: gdul bya ci 'dra ba zhig la yin zhe na /
analyzed: gdul bya ci 'dra ba zhig la yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of disciples is this for?

original: bdag tu lta ba can dang 'khor ba'i nyes pa ma shes pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba can dang 'khor ba'i nyes pa ma shes pa rnams la'o //
translated: It is for those who have the view of self and do not understand the faults of cyclic existence.

original: ji ltar bdag med pa yin pa ston pa ni 'ba' zhig ces gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag med pa yin pa ston pa ni 'ba' zhig ces gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: How is it taught that there is no self? It is taught by the statement “alone.”

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that it is free from “I” and “mine.”

original: @2b 'dir dgos pa 'di yang yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod //
analyzed: @2b 'dir dgos pa 'di yang yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod //
translated: Why not accept that this is the purpose here?

original: ji skad du mdo gzhan las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo gzhan las /
translated: As it is said in another sutra:🔽Thus, a learned noble disciple sees dependent origination and the phenomena that arise dependently just as they are with correct wisdom.🔽Having elaborated on this, it is said:

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis legs par mthong ba yin zhes rgyas par byas nas de sngon gyi mtha'i rjes su 'brangs pa ma yin pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis legs par mthong ba yin zhes rgyas par byas nas de sngon gyi mtha'i rjes su 'brangs pa ma yin pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: “It is not the case that he follows the past, etc.

original: de bzhin du k'a ty'a'i bu 'jig rten kun 'byung ba dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag ba'i shes rab kyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten la med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar
analyzed: de bzhin du k'a ty'a'i bu 'jig rten kun 'byung ba dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag ba'i shes rab kyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten la med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar
translated: Similarly, it is not the case that what is the origin of the world and is seen by the correct wisdom that sees things as they are does not exist in the world.”

original: du gsungs so //
analyzed: du gsungs so //
translated: Up to this point, it is said.

original: bdag tu lta ba spangs pa kho nas de dag thams cad mi 'byung bas de nyid 'dir dgos pa'i rtsa ba yin la /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba spangs pa kho nas de dag thams cad mi 'byung bas de nyid 'dir dgos pa'i rtsa ba yin la /
translated: Since all of these are eliminated by the mere abandonment of the view of self, that is the root of the necessity here.

original: gang yin de nyid mdo sde 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
analyzed: gang yin de nyid mdo sde 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One taught just that in this sūtra.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni yan lag snga ma la brten nas 'brel par phyi ma 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni yan lag snga ma la brten nas 'brel par phyi ma 'byung ba'o //
translated: Dependent origination is the arising of the later members in dependence on the earlier members.

original: de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas 'chad pa'i yi ge yang don bzhin du gdags te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas 'chad pa'i yi ge yang don bzhin du gdags te /
translated: The letters that explain that very thing are designated according to meaning,

original: ji ltar don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi chos kyi rnam grangs bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi chos kyi rnam grangs bzhin no //
translated: just like the enumeration of dharmas of emptiness in the ultimate.

original: 'jig rten na yang khar ba bsad pa dang rin po che phrogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang khar ba bsad pa dang rin po che phrogs pa bzhin no //
translated: In the world, it is like killing a snake and taking its jewels.

original: rten cing zhes bya ba ni rkyen de las zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rten cing zhes bya ba ni rkyen de las zhes bya ste /
translated: The dependent is the condition, as it is said.

original: ji ltar bud shing la brten nas me 'byung ngo zhes bya ba rten de las zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: ji ltar bud shing la brten nas me 'byung ngo zhes bya ba rten de las zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: Just as it is said, Fire arises in dependence on fuel, it is clear that it is from that basis.

original: sprin la brten nas 'char 'bab po zhes bya ba sprin 'dus pa las zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: sprin la brten nas 'char 'bab po zhes bya ba sprin 'dus pa las zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: The expression arising and falling in dependence on clouds is equivalent to arising and falling in dependence on the gathering of clouds.

original: gangs ri la brten nas sman skye'o zhes bya ba gzhi 'di las zhes bya bar mngon pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gangs ri la brten nas sman skye'o zhes bya ba gzhi 'di las zhes bya bar mngon pa yin gyi /
translated: The expression medicinal herbs grow in dependence on the snow mountains is equivalent to medicinal herbs grow in this place.

original: ji ltar khrus byas nas zas za ba lta bur dus snga phyi nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar khrus byas nas zas za ba lta bur dus snga phyi nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not like the expression having bathed, one eats, which indicates a temporal sequence.

original: don de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan las /
analyzed: don de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan las /
translated: The Blessed One has expressed this same idea in another sutra:

original: ston pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: ston pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is dependent origination?

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba yin no //🔽rgyu'i don yin te /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba yin no // rgyu'i don yin te /
translated: It is this: when this exists, that comes to be; from the arising of this, that arises.🔽This is the meaning of cause, not the meaning of prior and posterior.

original: dus sngar bya ba byed pa'i don ma yin na ji ltar 'di la brten nas zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa shes par byed ce na /
analyzed: dus sngar bya ba byed pa'i don ma yin na ji ltar 'di la brten nas zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa shes par byed ce na /
translated: But how can the expression in dependence on this be understood as having the meaning of cause?

original: 'di phyis nges par gtan la dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di phyis nges par gtan la dbab par bya'o //
translated: This will be determined later.

original: khyed la zhes bya ba ni khyed cag la ste khyed cag gi don du zhes bstan to //
analyzed: khyed la zhes bya ba ni khyed cag la ste khyed cag gi don du zhes bstan to //
translated: The expression for you indicates that this is taught for you, for your sake.

original: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni bod pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni bod pa ste /
translated: “Bhikṣus” means those who are called bhikṣus.

original: @3a * // sems gzhan du song ba'i dge slong rnams de mngon du bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽ci'i phyir dge slong rnams kho na la yin gyi /
analyzed: @3a * // sems gzhan du song ba'i dge slong rnams de mngon du bya ba'i phyir ro // ci'i phyir dge slong rnams kho na la yin gyi /
translated: The bhikṣus are those whose minds have gone elsewhere, because they are directed toward that.

original: 'khor gzhan la ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor gzhan la ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it for the bhikṣus and not for the other assemblies?🔽Because they are the best,

original: mchog yin pa'i phyir dang / gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / nye ba yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu 'dug pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog yin pa'i phyir dang / gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / nye ba yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu 'dug pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the most important, because they are the closest, because they are always present, and because they are capable of retaining the teaching.

original: der bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba ni btsun pa sgra gcan 'dzin bzang po la'o //
analyzed: der bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba ni btsun pa sgra gcan 'dzin bzang po la'o //
translated: The Blessed One said to the bhikṣus means to the venerable Rāhulabhadra.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni bstan pa ste /
translated: The first means the teaching.

original: rnam par 'chad pa bas de snga ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par 'chad pa bas de snga ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is called the first because it precedes the exposition.

original: de'i sgo nas gzhi ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sdud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas gzhi ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sdud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis for the dependent origination that is summarized in that sūtra.

original: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni nges par 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni nges par 'chad pa ste /
translated: The exposition means the definitive explanation.

original: nges par 'chad pa ni bstan pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'chad pa ni bstan pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The words of the teaching are the explanation,

original: bstan pa'i don bde blag tu khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang / nges par 'chad pa tshegs chur dus bde blag tu 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir dang ; 'grel pa dang mdo lta bu yin pa'i phyir dang / spyi'i tshig dang bye brag gi tshig yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: bstan pa'i don bde blag tu khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang / nges par 'chad pa tshegs chur dus bde blag tu 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir dang ; 'grel pa dang mdo lta bu yin pa'i phyir dang / spyi'i tshig dang bye brag gi tshig yin par 'dod do //
translated: because the meaning of the teaching is easily understood, because the explanation is easily grasped without difficulty, because it is like a commentary or a sūtra, and because it is held to be the general words and the specific words.

original: de lta na legs par bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na legs par bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it becomes well-spoken,

original: mdo dang rgyas par yang bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo dang rgyas par yang bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is explained in brief and in detail.

original: bstan gyis zhes bya ba ni dang po dang rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba 'chad par 'jug pa la bya bar mngon te /
analyzed: bstan gyis zhes bya ba ni dang po dang rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba 'chad par 'jug pa la bya bar mngon te /
translated: As for teaching, it is evident that it refers to the initial engagement in explanation with the words distinguishing and so on.

original: ji ltar gzhan du chos bshad par bya'o zhes smras nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos las de 'chad pa gzhan ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten na yang tshig gcig brjod do zhes byas na tshig la gzhan yod pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du chos bshad par bya'o zhes smras nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos las de 'chad pa gzhan ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten na yang tshig gcig brjod do zhes byas na tshig la gzhan yod pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as it is said, The Dharma should be explained, and then the explanation is not different from the Dharma such as the sūtras, and in the world, when it is said, Speak one word, there is no other word.

original: de zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig 'god pa'am /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig 'god pa'am /
translated: This he refers to the one who is setting forth the words,

original: de bas na zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: or it has the meaning of therefore.

original: legs par nyon la zhes bya ba ni rna ba gtod par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: legs par nyon la zhes bya ba ni rna ba gtod par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: Listen well means to apply the ear.

original: shin tu rab tu yid la zung shig dang zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par gus par 'dzin cing 'khor rnams bshad pa'i snod nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rab tu yid la zung shig dang zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par gus par 'dzin cing 'khor rnams bshad pa'i snod nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Hold it in mind well and thoroughly means to hold it without error, with respect, and to make the assembly a vessel for the explanation.

original: de ltar ma yin na skyon rnam pa gsum gyis bshad pa don yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na skyon rnam pa gsum gyis bshad pa don yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, the explanation would not be meaningful because of three faults.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon gyis ni yi ge mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon gyis ni yi ge mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the fault of distraction, one does not hear the words.

original: shes rab kyi skyon gyis ni yi ge dang don phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i phyir sva ti dang aa rishta la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi skyon gyis ni yi ge dang don phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i phyir sva ti dang aa rishta la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because of the fault of wisdom, one holds the words and meanings in the opposite way, like satya and arishta.

original: 'dun pa zhan pa'i skyon gyis @3b ni ma gus pas bzung ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa zhan pa'i skyon gyis @3b ni ma gus pas bzung ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the fault of weak aspiration, one does not hold what is respectfully received.

original: snod kha sbub pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / zhabs rdol gyi nang du char babs pa don med pa bzhin te /
analyzed: snod kha sbub pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / zhabs rdol gyi nang du char babs pa don med pa bzhin te /
translated: It is like rain falling in a vessel that is overturned, that is impure, or that has a hole in it.

original: de'i nang du mi 'jug pa dang / rnam par 'gyur ba dang / mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nang du mi 'jug pa dang / rnam par 'gyur ba dang / mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the rain does not enter it, it changes and does not remain.

original: rnam par dbye ba bstan gyis zhes gsungs nas yang yid la zung shig dang bshad do zhes gsungs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba bstan gyis zhes gsungs nas yang yid la zung shig dang bshad do zhes gsungs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: After saying, “I will teach the analysis,” he said, “Hold it in your mind and I will explain.” Why?

original: de lta na ni bshad kyi gzhan du na mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang / nga yang legs par shin tu 'chad do zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni bshad kyi gzhan du na mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang / nga yang legs par shin tu 'chad do zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that he will explain if they are like that, but not otherwise, and in order to show that he will explain well and thoroughly.

original: nga ni 'chad par zad kyi khyed rnams kyis ni nan tan gyis sgrubs shig ces bstan pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: nga ni 'chad par zad kyi khyed rnams kyis ni nan tan gyis sgrubs shig ces bstan pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that he will explain, but that they must practice with perseverance.

original: gzhan gnas ji skad du /
analyzed: gzhan gnas ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in another scripture:

original: khyed rnams kyis ni de bzhin du bya ba yin gyi 'chad pa po ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyed rnams kyis ni de bzhin du bya ba yin gyi 'chad pa po ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “You should do it that way. The one who explains is the Tathagata.”

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the first of dependent origination?

original: gzhan gyis dri bar bya ba'i skabs su tshig de rang nyid kyi yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dri bar bya ba'i skabs su tshig de rang nyid kyi yin te /
translated: In the context of being questioned by others, that statement is one’s own,

original: de ma thag tu gtam 'phro 'chad pa'i nyes pa yongs su spang pa'i phyir dang / 'jigs nas zhu mi nus pa dang ldan pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / sems rtse gcig tu byas pa rnams tshig dang spyod lam tha dad pas rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ma thag tu gtam 'phro 'chad pa'i nyes pa yongs su spang pa'i phyir dang / 'jigs nas zhu mi nus pa dang ldan pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / sems rtse gcig tu byas pa rnams tshig dang spyod lam tha dad pas rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: in order to completely avoid the fault of interrupting the conversation, in order to benefit those who are unable to ask out of fear, and in order to completely avoid the fault of distracting those who have one-pointed minds with different words and conduct.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni dang po'i bshad pa rtsom par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni dang po'i bshad pa rtsom par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus is the explanation of the first, in order to demonstrate the beginning of the explanation.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po dbye ba med par 'chad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po dbye ba med par 'chad pa yin te /
translated: When this exists, this occurs; from the arising of this, this arises, explains the first of dependent origination without division,

original: yan lag rnams mi sgrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag rnams mi sgrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the members are not proclaimed.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba ni yan lag rnams phye nas sgrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba ni yan lag rnams phye nas sgrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The condition of ignorance is the formation of volitions is the proclamation of the members after they have been distinguished.

original: 'dir ni 'di yod na zhes bya ba ni yod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di yod na zhes bya ba ni yod par gyur na'o //
translated: Here, if this exists means if it has come into existence.

original: 'di 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: The arising of that is birth.

original: de ltar na bdun pa rgyu'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bdun pa rgyu'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the seventh is to be known as the meaning of cause.

original: dper na char babs na lo tog skye'o //
analyzed: dper na char babs na lo tog skye'o //
translated: For example, if it rains, the crops grow.

original: sad ba pas na lo tog 'jig go zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: sad ba pas na lo tog 'jig go zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: If it does not rain, the crops fail.

original: 'dir char babs pa ni lo tog skye ba'i rgyu yin par mngon zhing /🔽sad babs pa ni lo thog 'jig pa de bzhin du 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyu yin par mngon pa yin no //🔽'di skyes pas zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir char babs pa ni lo tog skye ba'i rgyu yin par mngon zhing / sad babs pa ni lo thog 'jig pa de bzhin du 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyu yin par mngon pa yin no // 'di skyes pas zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, it is evident that the rain is the cause of the growth of the crops.🔽And it is evident that the lack of rain is the cause of the failure of the crops.🔽In the same way, if this exists, that arises shows that the arising of one thing is the cause of the arising of another.🔽The arising of this is the arising of that shows that the occurrence of one thing is the cause of the occurrence of another.

original: 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni 'byung @4a * //🔽ba ste zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni 'byung @4a * //🔽ba ste zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The arising of this is the arising of that shows that the occurrence of one thing is the cause of the occurrence of another.

original: de ltar na lnga pa rgyu'i don ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na lnga pa rgyu'i don ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the fifth is to be understood as not having the meaning of cause.

original: dper na me dang 'brel ba las chos par 'gyur ba dang / lag pa la sogs pa brdabs pa las sgra 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me dang 'brel ba las chos par 'gyur ba dang / lag pa la sogs pa brdabs pa las sgra 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the fact that a pot becomes pure through contact with fire, and a sound arises from the striking of a hand and so on.

original: ci'i phyir dang po ni ma phye bar bstan gyi che ba kho nas ma yin zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir dang po ni ma phye bar bstan gyi che ba kho nas ma yin zhe na ;
translated: Why is the first taught without distinction, and not just by its greatness?

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of the conditions such as ignorance is taught.

original: de dag gi rkyen gyis don yang 'di yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rkyen gyis don yang 'di yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: And this is the meaning of those conditions:

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
translated: It is like this: When this exists, that comes to be;

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: from the arising of this, that arises.

original: rkyen gyis don bstan pa 'dis phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang bstan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rkyen gyis don bstan pa 'dis phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang bstan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: By this teaching of the meaning of conditions, the external dependent origination should also be understood as taught,

original: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristics of conditions are not different.

original: tshig 'di gnyis las don gyi bya brag tha dad pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: tshig 'di gnyis las don gyi bya brag tha dad pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference in meaning between these two phrases?

original: ci yang med do //
analyzed: ci yang med do //
translated: There is none at all.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir gnyis brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir gnyis brjod ce na /
translated: Why are two terms used?

original: gcig la gcig 'chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually explanatory.

original: gang yang rung ba zhig brjod na ni grangs can pa'i don yod pa'am /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig brjod na ni grangs can pa'i don yod pa'am /
translated: If only one term were used, the meaning of the Sāṃkhya would be understood,

original: skye bar rtog par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye bar rtog par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: or else the idea of arising would be understood.

original: de dag ni skye ba med pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu yod par mi 'dod kyi ma byung ba las byung ba skye ba yin par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni skye ba med pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu yod par mi 'dod kyi ma byung ba las byung ba skye ba yin par ni ma yin no //
translated: The Sāṃkhyas do not assert that a cause and effect exist without arising, but that arising is the coming into existence of what did not previously exist.

original: gzhan yang 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ma brjod na ni rgyu rtag pa dgag pa ma byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ma brjod na ni rgyu rtag pa dgag pa ma byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the statement “because this arises, that arises” were not made, the refutation of a permanent cause would not be made.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ma brjod na ni nges par gtan la phab pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ma brjod na ni nges par gtan la phab pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the statement “when this exists, that exists” were not made, the ascertainment would not be made.

original: gang skyes pas gang skye ba ni de kho na yod na de yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang skyes pas gang skye ba ni de kho na yod na de yod pa yin gyi /
translated: When this arises, that arises means that only when this exists, that exists.

original: bdag la sogs pa rtag pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa rtag pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: It does not arise from a permanent self, etc.,

original: de lta na ni rgyu rtag pa dgag pa ma byas par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de lta na ni rgyu rtag pa dgag pa ma byas par 'gyur ro ;
translated: because if it did, the refutation of a permanent cause would not be made.

original: / de bas na gnyis ka dgos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: / de bas na gnyis ka dgos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, both are meaningful.

original: gzhan na re yan lag gzhan dang gzhan ston pa yin no zhe'o /
analyzed: gzhan na re yan lag gzhan dang gzhan ston pa yin no zhe'o /
translated: Others say that it shows the other members.

original: gzhan na re dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan na re dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Others say that it establishes the three sections.

original: de ni ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag rkyen yin pa'i tshig kho nas gnyis ka 'grub pas don yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de ni ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag rkyen yin pa'i tshig kho nas gnyis ka 'grub pas don yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: But since both are established by the statement that ignorance, etc. are conditions, it is not meaningful.

original: / spre'u lta bu'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: / spre'u lta bu'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Moreover, the Simile of the Monkey Sūtra says:

original: de la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid la legs par shin tu tshul bzhin so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid la legs par shin tu tshul bzhin so sor rtog ste /
translated: Herein, the learned noble disciples properly and thoroughly discern dependent origination itself,

original: 'di lta ste 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste /
translated: as follows: “When this exists, that comes to be; from the arising of this, that arises.🔽For example, based on contact that is conducive to pleasant experience, the feeling of pleasure arises.”

original: 'di lta ste bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg @4b pa la brten nas bde ba'i tshor ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa der yang yan lag gzhan dang gzhan nam /
analyzed: 'di lta ste bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg @4b pa la brten nas bde ba'i tshor ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa der yang yan lag gzhan dang gzhan nam /
translated: Here, too, it is not the case that the other members are not mentioned.

original: dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa med pas gnyis mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa med pas gnyis mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no third part, the two parts are not mentioned.

original: gzhan dag na re don la bye brag yod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re don la bye brag yod de /
translated: Others say that there is a difference in meaning,

original: mngon sum dang brgyud ba'i rkyen gyi dngos po ston pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang brgyud ba'i rkyen gyi dngos po ston pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: that the first part shows the condition of direct perception and the second part shows the condition of indirect perception.

original: de dag dgag pa yang de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag dgag pa yang de dag nyid yin no //
translated: These two explanations are refuted by the two parts.

original: gzhan dag na re tshig dang pos ni rgyun gyis rgyu gnas pa sngon du song ba'i 'bras bu gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re tshig dang pos ni rgyun gyis rgyu gnas pa sngon du song ba'i 'bras bu gnas pa yin no //
translated: Others say that the first part shows that the effect endures when the cause endures through a continuum.

original: gnyis pas ni rgyu skyes pas 'bras bu skyes pa yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni rgyu skyes pas 'bras bu skyes pa yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: The second part shows that the effect arises when the cause arises.

original: der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba brtsams pa la gnas pa 'chad pa 'brel pa ci yod /
analyzed: der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba brtsams pa la gnas pa 'chad pa 'brel pa ci yod /
translated: What is the connection between the explanation of endurance and the beginning of the teaching on dependent origination?

original: 'on te de yang skye ba kho na yin na ni don la bye brag ci yod /
analyzed: 'on te de yang skye ba kho na yin na ni don la bye brag ci yod /
translated: If endurance is just arising, what is the difference in meaning?

original: gal te rgyun skyes pa dang gnas pa yin na snga ma skyes pa skye ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te rgyun skyes pa dang gnas pa yin na snga ma skyes pa skye ba yin te /
translated: If the continuum arises and endures, then the former arising is arising.

original: sngar skye la phyis gnas pa yin pas skye ba ma bshad par gnas pa'i dus ci'i phyir bshad /
analyzed: sngar skye la phyis gnas pa yin pas skye ba ma bshad par gnas pa'i dus ci'i phyir bshad /
translated: Since it arises first and endures later, why is the time of endurance explained without explaining arising?

original: nur nur po dang nar nar po la sogs pa dang / zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa yang skye ste gnas pa yin na rgyu gang zhig gnas pa yod na yod do zhes 'dir brjod par bya /
analyzed: nur nur po dang nar nar po la sogs pa dang / zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa yang skye ste gnas pa yin na rgyu gang zhig gnas pa yod na yod do zhes 'dir brjod par bya /
translated: The embryo in the mother’s womb develops through the stages of kalala, arbuda, and so on, and through the stages of milk, curd, and so on, and it is born and lives.

original: pha rol po dag na re 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that when this exists, that arises means that when the effect exists, the cause ceases,

original: 'o na ni 'bras bu skye ba rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'bras bu skye ba rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the arising of the effect would be causeless.

original: 'di ltar 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba de'i phyir rgyu med pa can du mi 'gyur zhes smra ba ni gzhan du bstan pa med pa la gzhan du ston pa ni rang dga'i tshig tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba de'i phyir rgyu med pa can du mi 'gyur zhes smra ba ni gzhan du bstan pa med pa la gzhan du ston pa ni rang dga'i tshig tsam du zad de /
translated: If you say that it is not causeless because when this arises, that arises, then you are teaching something else as something else, and such words are mere sophistry.

original: mdo ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'chad par rtsom pa la rnam par 'jig pa 'chad pa 'brel pa ci yod /
analyzed: mdo ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'chad par rtsom pa la rnam par 'jig pa 'chad pa 'brel pa ci yod /
translated: Because it is not a sutra, and what relevance does the teaching of destruction have in the context of the teaching of dependent origination?

original: rgyu zhig pa skye ba ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu zhig pa skye ba ma yin la /
translated: The cause that has ceased does not arise.

original: 'bras bu la brten pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la brten pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they depend on the effect.🔽

original: skad cig ma'i chos 'jig pa la rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i chos 'jig pa la rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it based on the effect, because the destruction of a momentary phenomenon has no condition.

original: gal te don 'di yin par gyur na ni 'di yod na 'di mi 'byung zhes de skad gsungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te don 'di yin par gyur na ni 'di yod na 'di mi 'byung zhes de skad gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the meaning, the Buddha would have said, “When this exists, that does not occur.”

original: de ltar byas na shin tu don gsal bar khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na shin tu don gsal bar khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the meaning would be very clear.

original: de bas na 'di'i don de ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di'i don de ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is not the meaning of this passage.

original: gzhan dag na re tshig dang pos ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re tshig dang pos ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen bstan te /
translated: Others say that the first phrase teaches the co-originating condition,

original: ji ltar reg pa dang tshor ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar reg pa dang tshor ba'am /
translated: like contact and feeling,

original: myu gu dang gri ba ma lta bu'o //🔽gnyis @5a * //
analyzed: myu gu dang gri ba ma lta bu'o // gnyis @5a * //
translated: like a sprout and its sheath.

original: pas ni sngar skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: pas ni sngar skyes pa yin te /
translated: The second phrase teaches the prior condition,

original: ji ltar srid pa las skyes pa lta bu dang / sa bon las myu gu lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa las skyes pa lta bu dang / sa bon las myu gu lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: like birth from existence, like a sprout from a seed.

original: 'dir ni de dag 'grub par 'gyur na spre'u lta bu'i mdo las ni 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de dag 'grub par 'gyur na spre'u lta bu'i mdo las ni 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But that is not the meaning of this passage, because it is not the meaning of the Simile of the Monkey Sutra,

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen kho na bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen kho na bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since it teaches only the co-originating condition.

original: gzhan dag na re rgyu med pa dang rgyu rtag pa dgag pa'i phyir tshig gnyis yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rgyu med pa dang rgyu rtag pa dgag pa'i phyir tshig gnyis yin te /
translated: Others say: The two phrases are for the purpose of refuting causeless arising and arising from a permanent cause.

original: rgyu med na ni ci yang 'byung pa med la rgyu rtag pa rang bzhin dang / dbang phyug dang / rdul phra rab la sogs pa las kyang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu med na ni ci yang 'byung pa med la rgyu rtag pa rang bzhin dang / dbang phyug dang / rdul phra rab la sogs pa las kyang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If there is no cause, nothing arises and it is not that things arise from a permanent cause such as God, prakriti, or atoms.

original: de dag ni tshig dang po med par yang smra ba gnyis ka dgag par 'grub pas de dag ni don ma yin no//
analyzed: de dag ni tshig dang po med par yang smra ba gnyis ka dgag par 'grub pas de dag ni don ma yin no//
translated: But since both are established without the first phrase, those phrases are meaningless.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa pa dag na re ma spangs pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las skye ba'i don gyis tshig gnyis smos te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa pa dag na re ma spangs pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las skye ba'i don gyis tshig gnyis smos te /
translated: Yogacaras say: The two phrases are stated for the purpose of refuting arising from nonabandonment and arising from impermanent conditions.

original: yod na zhes pa ni ma spangs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yod na zhes pa ni ma spangs pa la bya ste /
translated: The phrase if it exists refers to nonabandonment.

original: ji skad du mdo gzhan las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo gzhan las /
translated: As another sutra declares:

original: ci 'dod pa dang 'dun pa yod bzhin du nang gi 'dod pa rnams la so sor mi myong ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'dod pa dang 'dun pa yod bzhin du nang gi 'dod pa rnams la so sor mi myong ba yin nam /
translated: Do you experience inner desires while possessing desire and longing?

original: 'on te med pa yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te med pa yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: Or do you not possess them?

original: yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs las lhug par gsungs te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs las lhug par gsungs te /
translated: The Buddha spoke of this in the Dharma instruction called Distinguishing the Particular Qualities of Existence and so on.

original: der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: There, the characteristics of dependent origination are asked about and the Bhagavān said:

original: dge slong dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: “Monks, the characteristics of dependent origination are threefold.

original: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs te /
translated: The characteristics of arising from conditions that do not move, the characteristics of arising from impermanent conditions, and the characteristics of arising from capable conditions.”

original: de dag nyid dang po bstan pa 'dir rab tu bstan pa yin no zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de dag nyid dang po bstan pa 'dir rab tu bstan pa yin no zhes brjod de /
translated: It is said that these are taught in this first teaching.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The statement “When this exists, that arises” is the characteristic of arising from conditions that do not move.

original: yod pa tsam rkyen nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa tsam rkyen nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it teaches that mere existence is a condition.

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The phrase because this exists, that comes to be indicates the characteristic of arising from impermanent conditions.

original: skyes pa rkyen nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa rkyen nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the condition is taught to be the arising of the effect.

original: 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pas ni nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pas ni nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The phrase for example, due to the condition of ignorance, there are the karmic predispositions indicates the characteristic of arising from capable conditions.

original: snga phyi'i yan lag nges pas rkyen nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga phyi'i yan lag nges pas rkyen nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the condition is taught to be the sequence of earlier and later parts.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba ni ma rig pa de rkyen yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba ni ma rig pa de rkyen yin no //
translated: The phrase due to the condition of ignorance, there are the karmic predispositions means that ignorance is the condition.

original: lhag ma @5b rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma @5b rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining phrases should be understood in the same way.

original: rkyen gyis don ni sngar bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rkyen gyis don ni sngar bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: The meaning of condition has already been explained.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni rkyen de las yin pas rkyen yin pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni rkyen de las yin pas rkyen yin pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The verbal root pac means to be in control, and the verbal root i means to go. The verbal root pac is used figuratively to mean to go, and the term pratyaya is formed from that figurative sense. Thus, a condition is that which is in control of an effect's going into existence.

original: rkyen gang yin zhe na bdag po'i rkyen te /
analyzed: rkyen gang yin zhe na bdag po'i rkyen te /
translated: What is a condition? It is a dominant condition.

original: ci'i phyir rkyen zhes bstan /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rkyen zhes bstan /
translated: Why is it called a condition?

original: rgyu dang byed rgyu dang gzhi ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang byed rgyu dang gzhi ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are not causes, co-existent causes, or homogeneous causes?

original: gang yang rung ba smos na yang phyir rgol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba smos na yang phyir rgol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one of them is mentioned, the other two are also understood.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su ni gang la brten nas gang 'byung ba de'i rkyen ni 'di yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su ni gang la brten nas gang 'byung ba de'i rkyen ni 'di yin par bstan to //
translated: In the context of dependent origination, it is shown that whatever arises in dependence on something is a condition of that.

original: gzhan dag na re rgyu smos na ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rgyu smos na ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If a cause is mentioned, the other three conditions are not excluded.

original: gzhi dang byed rgyu smos na nyes pa ci yod /
analyzed: gzhi dang byed rgyu smos na nyes pa ci yod /
translated: What is wrong with mentioning a basis or an instrument?

original: rgyu'i sgra gzhan la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i sgra gzhan la yang mthong ste /
translated: The word cause is also seen in other contexts.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rgyu gnyis rkyen gnyis yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rgyu gnyis rkyen gnyis yin la /
translated: For the sake of generating right view, two causes and two conditions are mentioned.

original: tshangs pa bdag ni rgyur smra ba ste rgyu ston par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa bdag ni rgyur smra ba ste rgyu ston par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Brahma, I am a teacher of causes, I am a teacher of conditions.

original: de bas na de dag ni len du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni len du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, these are not acceptable.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: What is the classification of dependent origination?

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ston pa yin no //
translated: The present verse shows the analysis of ignorance, etc.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Ignorance, etc. are not dependent origination.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rten cing 'brel te byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te byung ba yin no //
translated: They are dependent origination.

original: de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan las gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan las gsungs te /
translated: The Lord has said in another sutra:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is dependent origination?

original: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes rgyas par yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes rgyas par yin no //
translated: It is this: when this exists, that comes to be;

original: rten cing 'brel te byung ba'i chos gang zhe na ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te byung ba'i chos gang zhe na ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: What are the dharmas that arise dependently? They are ignorance, the formative forces, and so on, up to

original: skye ba dang / rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: birth, and old age and death.

original: 'di la dgongs pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di la dgongs pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the intention here?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i chos rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i chos rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Dependent origination is the general characteristic of all dharmas that arise.

original: ma byung ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba'o //
translated: It is the arising of what did not previously exist.

original: de rnam par dbye ba gzhan du ji ltar bstan par nus /
analyzed: de rnam par dbye ba gzhan du ji ltar bstan par nus /
translated: How can it be taught as a different analysis?

original: ji ltar rgas par gyur pa las gzhan du rga bar gyur pa ji ltar bstan par nus /
analyzed: ji ltar rgas par gyur pa las gzhan du rga bar gyur pa ji ltar bstan par nus /
translated: How can you show that aging is other than the aged?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po yin par gsungs so //
translated: Because the dependent origination that is taught there is the first dependent origination here.

original: der rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: der rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The dependent origination that is taught there is the dependent origination here.

original: 'o na de lta na rten cing @6a * //
analyzed: 'o na de lta na rten cing @6a * //
translated: If that is so, then you should explain the classification of dependent origination and the dependently arisen.

original: 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba yang khyed la bshad par bya'o zhes ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba yang khyed la bshad par bya'o zhes ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
translated: Why did he not say, “I will explain the classification of dependent origination and the dependently arisen”?

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dgongs pa yin pas /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dgongs pa yin pas /
translated: This Dharma teaching is intended for those who are confused about dependent origination.

original: de'i mdo dang rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bstan gyis zhes gsungs pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i mdo dang rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bstan gyis zhes gsungs pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: In order to teach the sutra and its extensive explanation, the Buddha said, “Monks, I will teach you the first and the divisions of dependent origination.”

original: byung ba dang 'byung ba dag kyang don tha dad par kha cig rtog pa de dag kyang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: byung ba dang 'byung ba dag kyang don tha dad par kha cig rtog pa de dag kyang bsal ba yin te /
translated: Some think that dependent origination and its arising are different things, but this is also refuted.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las gzhan du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las gzhan du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Dependent origination is not different from dependent origination,

original: brtags pa'i chos yin pa nyid ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i chos yin pa nyid ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught that it is a fabricated phenomenon.

original: tshig las tshig 'byung ba ni gal te ma rig pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin na de'i rkyen gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshig las tshig 'byung ba ni gal te ma rig pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin na de'i rkyen gang yin zhe na /
translated: If ignorance is dependent origination, what is its condition?

original: rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa yang ma rig pa'i rkyen yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa yang ma rig pa'i rkyen yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has said that the categories of dharmas with causes, with conditions, and with bases are the conditions of ignorance.

original: gsus po che'i mdo las sgrib pa lnga yang yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: gsus po che'i mdo las sgrib pa lnga yang yin par gsungs te /
translated: The Mahākauṣṭhila Sūtra says that the five hindrances are also ignorance.

original: ma rig pa gnas par byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa gnas par byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the support of ignorance?

original: sgrib pa lnga yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The five hindrances should be said.

original: log par lta ba yang yin te /
analyzed: log par lta ba yang yin te /
translated: Also, wrong views are ignorance.

original: log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgom lan mang du byas pas lus zhi gnas sems can dmyal ba'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par lta ba kun tu bsten cing bsgom lan mang du byas pas lus zhi gnas sems can dmyal ba'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said: “One who cultivates and increases wrong views will be reborn in the hells.

original: brgya la mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par 'ongs na yang rmongs pa chen por 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: brgya la mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par 'ongs na yang rmongs pa chen por 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If one comes to the human realm, one will be greatly confused.”🔽Also, desire and so on are ignorance. Three verses on this:

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang yin par tshigs su bcad pa gsum las chags pa pos ni mi shes /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang yin par tshigs su bcad pa gsum las chags pa pos ni mi shes /
translated: Desire and so on are ignorance.

original: chags pa pos ni chos mi mthong zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chags pa pos ni chos mi mthong zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: One who is attached does not see the Dharma.

original: reg pa yang ci'i rkyen yin par bstan te /
analyzed: reg pa yang ci'i rkyen yin par bstan te /
translated: The condition of contact is also taught:

original: 'du byed kyi phung po gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad reg pa la brten nas de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad reg pa la brten nas de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: Whatever the aggregates of formations are, all of them arise in dependence on contact.

original: gsus po che'i mdo las ma rig pa yang ma rig pa'i rkyen yin par bstan te /
analyzed: gsus po che'i mdo las ma rig pa yang ma rig pa'i rkyen yin par bstan te /
translated: In the Mahānāma Sūtra, ignorance is taught to be the condition of ignorance:

original: ci zag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci zag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin nam /
translated: “Is the defilement of the world due to the world being defiled by desire?

original: zag pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: zag pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three defilements:

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: the defilement of desire, the defilement of existence, and the defilement of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las zag @6b pa kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las zag @6b pa kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The origin of the defilement of ignorance is called the origin of the defilement of the world.

original: ma rig pa kho na la brten nas ma rig pa 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa kho na la brten nas ma rig pa 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Ignorance arises in dependence on ignorance alone.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not arise from incorrect mental activity, etc.

original: rmongs pa kho na las de skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa kho na las de skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from delusion alone.

original: rang gi rigs gcig las /
analyzed: rang gi rigs gcig las /
translated: From one’s own type.

original: gcig 'byung pa na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pas lhag par rgyas par 'byung bar byed de /
analyzed: gcig 'byung pa na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pas lhag par rgyas par 'byung bar byed de /
translated: When one of them occurs, it is developed by improper mental attention, etc.

original: sa bon rgyas pa ni lhag par spang dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon rgyas pa ni lhag par spang dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the development of the seed is difficult to eliminate.

original: de lta bas na de yang de'i rkyen yin bar gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na de yang de'i rkyen yin bar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that that is a condition of this.

original: 'o na mdo sde 'dir de'i rkyen ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na mdo sde 'dir de'i rkyen ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
translated: But why is that not stated as a condition in this sutra?

original: de la yang gzhan brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la yang gzhan brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur la /
translated: Because it would be necessary to state something else about that.

original: gang nas brten te skye ba'i rim pa bstan pa brtsam par bya /
analyzed: gang nas brten te skye ba'i rim pa bstan pa brtsam par bya /
translated: And from what is the order of arising to be stated?

original: gang gi don du yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pa de la ni ma rig pa'i rkyen bstan pa dgos pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi don du yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pa de la ni ma rig pa'i rkyen bstan pa dgos pa med de /
translated: For whom the twelve members are taught, there is no need to teach the condition of ignorance.

original: de yang phyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang phyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: That will be taught later.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen rang gi rigs yin yang 'dir yan lag rnams kyi rkyen rang gi rigs brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen rang gi rigs yin yang 'dir yan lag rnams kyi rkyen rang gi rigs brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Although the condition of ignorance is of the same type, here the condition of the members is not stated to be of the same type, because it is not desired to be stated.

original: 'dir ni de'i rkyen brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni de'i rkyen brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be stated here as a condition of that.

original: 'dir kha cig rgol ba ma rig pa'i rkyen ma smos pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma yod par 'gyur ba dang / yan lag lhag pa dang de dag la thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes de skad brgal nas /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig rgol ba ma rig pa'i rkyen ma smos pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma yod par 'gyur ba dang / yan lag lhag pa dang de dag la thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes de skad brgal nas /
translated: Here, someone objects, “Since the condition of ignorance is not mentioned, cyclic existence would have a beginning, and there would be an extra link and an infinite regress.

original: lan ni tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ma rig pa'i rkyen yin no zhes mdo sde gzhan las 'byung ba sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: lan ni tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ma rig pa'i rkyen yin no zhes mdo sde gzhan las 'byung ba sngar bstan zin to //
translated: ” The response is that it has already been explained that another sutra states that incorrect mental activity is the condition of ignorance.

original: yan lag lhag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag lhag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: There is no extra link,

original: len pa'i nang du de 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len pa'i nang du de 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is included in grasping.

original: thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: There is no infinite regress,

original: de gnyis gcig la gcig rkyen byed pa'i phyir bya dang sgo nga bzhin no //
analyzed: de gnyis gcig la gcig rkyen byed pa'i phyir bya dang sgo nga bzhin no //
translated: because they are like a bird and its nest.

original: 'di lta ste bsgos pa yid la byed pa ni rmongs pa las skyes pa yin no zhes de nyid nas gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bsgos pa yid la byed pa ni rmongs pa las skyes pa yin no zhes de nyid nas gsungs so //
translated: For example, the sutra states that the mental activity of the afflicted mind arises from delusion.

original: 'o na ni yan lag kun gzhan las rkyen nyid yin par gsungs pa'i phyir 'dir rkyen mi brjod par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / sred pa dang ma rig pa gnyis kyang chos mngon pa'i lugs kyis len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni yan lag kun gzhan las rkyen nyid yin par gsungs pa'i phyir 'dir rkyen mi brjod par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / sred pa dang ma rig pa gnyis kyang chos mngon pa'i lugs kyis len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then it would follow that the conditions would not be stated here because all the parts are stated to be conditions of other parts, and craving and ignorance are included in grasping in the Abhidharma system.

original: dper na autpa la'i rkyen rtsa ba yin par bstan du zin kyang /
analyzed: dper na autpa la'i rkyen rtsa ba yin par bstan du zin kyang /
translated: For example, although the root is taught to be the condition of an utpala flower,

original: rtsa ba rkyen yin par brjod pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rtsa ba rkyen yin par brjod pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: it is not that the root becomes causeless because it is called a condition.

original: 'dir ma rig pa'i rkyen ma brjod pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can @7a * //
analyzed: 'dir ma rig pa'i rkyen ma brjod pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can @7a * //
translated: In the same way, although ignorance is not stated as a condition here,

original: du 'gyur pa nyid na gang gi phyir 'khor ba la thog ma yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: du 'gyur pa nyid na gang gi phyir 'khor ba la thog ma yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur /
translated: samsara would not become causeless and it would not follow that samsara would have a beginning.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir ma rig pa'i rkyen brjod par mi bya ba de ni bdag gis rtogs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir ma rig pa'i rkyen brjod par mi bya ba de ni bdag gis rtogs te /
translated: I understand that ignorance is not stated as a condition here

original: de nyid kyis kyang 'di la rgol ba'i skabs med pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang 'di la rgol ba'i skabs med pa yin no //
translated: and therefore there is no opportunity for debate.

original: de nyid kyis kyang rga shi'i 'og tu yan lag gzhan ma brjod la /
analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang rga shi'i 'og tu yan lag gzhan ma brjod la /
translated: and it does not mention any other links after aging and death.

original: 'khor ba la tha ma yod par thal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba la tha ma yod par thal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And it would follow, absurdly, that cyclic existence would have an end.

original: gzhan dag na re reg pa bstan pas tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re reg pa bstan pas tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: Others say that the statement of contact teaches the misapprehension of the mind,🔽because in other sūtras it is taught that it arises at the time of contact.

original: 'di ltar mdo sde gzhan las de reg ba'i tshe bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo sde gzhan las de reg ba'i tshe bstan te /
translated: In other sūtras it says:🔽From the eye and form arises the mental activity of the mind that arises from delusion.

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas rmongs pa las byung ba'i bsgos pa'i yid la byed pa skye'o zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba bstan pas kyang ma rig pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas rmongs pa las byung ba'i bsgos pa'i yid la byed pa skye'o zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba bstan pas kyang ma rig pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: And the statement of feeling teaches ignorance,🔽because in other sūtras it says:

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa la skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa la skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas /
translated: Craving arises in dependence on the feeling that arises from contact that is accompanied by ignorance.

original: sred pa skye'o zhes mdo sde gzhan las gsungs bas mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa de dag thams cad kyang 'dir mi brjod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred pa skye'o zhes mdo sde gzhan las gsungs bas mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa de dag thams cad kyang 'dir mi brjod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: So it would follow, absurdly, that all of the statements in other sūtras would have to be stated here.

original: ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di ni rig pa ma yin pa 'di ni ma rig pa yin no zhes 'gog pa'i rnam pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di ni rig pa ma yin pa 'di ni ma rig pa yin no zhes 'gog pa'i rnam pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: This is a synonym for the cessation of the aspect of non-knowledge, which is ignorance.

original: 'di yang don bdun la mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di yang don bdun la mthong ste /
translated: This is seen in seven meanings:

original: yod pa 'gog pa la ni 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang ; dngos po ma yin pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: yod pa 'gog pa la ni 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang ; dngos po ma yin pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the negation of existence, as in “not grasping” and “not a thing.”

original: gzhan nyid la ni rigs srog chags ma yin zhes byas na srog chags las gzhan phyogs na mi gnas pa gzugs can ma yin pa gang yin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan nyid la ni rigs srog chags ma yin zhes byas na srog chags las gzhan phyogs na mi gnas pa gzugs can ma yin pa gang yin pa la bya ste /
translated: In difference, as in “not a living being,” where it refers to what is not a living being, which is not a living being, and is not a physical object.

original: gzugs can las gzhan gang yin pa zhes bya bar mngon pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs can las gzhan gang yin pa zhes bya bar mngon pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is as if it were said, “What is different from a physical object.”

original: 'dra ba gzhan nyid la ni bram ze ma yin gzhon nu ma yin zhes byas na bram ze dang gzhon nu ma dang 'dra ba gzhan mi'i bye brag gcig la bya bar mngon pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan nyid la ni bram ze ma yin gzhon nu ma yin zhes byas na bram ze dang gzhon nu ma dang 'dra ba gzhan mi'i bye brag gcig la bya bar mngon pa yin gyi /
translated: In the difference of similarity, as in “not a brahmin” and “not a youth,” it is evident that it refers to one class of humans who are similar to a brahmin or a youth,

original: gzhan thams cad ma yin ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ma yin ba lta bu'o //
translated: but not to all others.

original: smad pa'i don la ni chung ma ma yin pa dang / bu ma yin pa zhes byas na chung ma ngan pa dang / bu ngan pa la bya bar mngon pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: smad pa'i don la ni chung ma ma yin pa dang / bu ma yin pa zhes byas na chung ma ngan pa dang / bu ngan pa la bya bar mngon pa lta bu'o //
translated: In the sense of contempt, it is like the expressions “a bad wife” and “a bad son,” which are used when a wife or son is not a real wife or son.

original: nyung ba'i don la ni tshod ma lan tshva med pa dang / gzhon nu ma lto med pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyung ba'i don la ni tshod ma lan tshva med pa dang / gzhon nu ma lto med pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the sense of smallness, it is like the expressions “a dish without salt” and “a young girl without a womb.”

original: bral ba'i don la ni dge slong med pa'i gnas dang / chu med pa'i dgon pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i don la ni dge slong med pa'i gnas dang / chu med pa'i dgon pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the sense of separation, it is like the expressions “a place without monks” and “a desert without water.”

original: gnyen po'i don la ni bsod @7b nams med pa dang / grags pa med pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i don la ni bsod @7b nams med pa dang / grags pa med pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the sense of antidote, it is like the expressions “without merit” and “without fame.”

original: sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa ni //
analyzed: sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa ni //
translated: The verse summarizes:🔽It exists in cessation,🔽in difference, in similarity,🔽in contempt, in smallness, in separation,

original: yod pa dag ni 'gag pa dang // gzhan pa nyid dang 'dra ba dang // smad dang nyung dang bral don dang // gnyen po dag la 'di yod do //
analyzed: yod pa dag ni 'gag pa dang // gzhan pa nyid dang 'dra ba dang // smad dang nyung dang bral don dang // gnyen po dag la 'di yod do //
translated: and in antidotes.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the verse.

original: de ni 'dir don kha cig par yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dir don kha cig par yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that this is the meaning in some cases.

original: re zhig rig pa'i dngos po med pa tsam ni ma rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rig pa'i dngos po med pa tsam ni ma rig pa ma yin te /
translated: Ignorance is not just the non-existence of knowledge.

original: 'di ltar dngos po med pa ni 'du byed skye ba'i bdag po'i rkyen nyid du rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med pa ni 'du byed skye ba'i bdag po'i rkyen nyid du rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, the non-existence of knowledge is recognized as the dominant condition for the arising of the formative forces.

original: gal te ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag go zhes brjod pa'i 'gags pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag go zhes brjod pa'i 'gags pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If you say that the formative forces cease through the cessation of ignorance, then cessation is not tenable.

original: mdo sde gzhan las kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba la sogs pa nyid yin par gsungs pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba la sogs pa nyid yin par gsungs pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: And it is not tenable that ignorance is a fetter, a bond, etc.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa rgyu yin pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa rgyu yin pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that incorrect mental activity is a cause.

original: re zhig 'dod ma chags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig 'dod ma chags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: To begin with, how can non-attachment to the sense-desires be a condition for the defilement of mundane things?

original: de ni chags pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: de ni chags pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin no //
translated: For, it is just the non-existence of attachment.

original: dmigs pa tsam de ni rnam par rtog pa de'i bdag po'i rkyen du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa tsam de ni rnam par rtog pa de'i bdag po'i rkyen du mi rung ngo //
translated: That mere object is not tenable as the dominant condition for that conceptual differentiation.

original: rnam par rtog pa de las rnyed par 'dod pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de las rnyed par 'dod pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who desire to attain it through conceptualization become defiled.

original: ma rig pa yang rmongs pa zhes bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang rmongs pa zhes bstan pa yin la /
translated: Ignorance is also taught as delusion.

original: gal te rig pa med pa'i dngos po tsam yin na ci rmongs pa med rmongs pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin nam /🔽'on te gnyen po yin na de gnyis ka yang dngos po med pa la rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rig pa med pa'i dngos po tsam yin na ci rmongs pa med rmongs pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin nam / 'on te gnyen po yin na de gnyis ka yang dngos po med pa la rig pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is the mere nonexistence of knowledge, is delusion the mere nonexistence of nondelusion?

original: skye ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or is it the antidote? Neither of those two is knowledge in the absence of an object because they are nonarisen.

original: rig pa las gzhan pa gang yin pa de yang ma rig pa yin te mig la sogs pa la'ang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽rig pa dang 'dra ba'i chos gzhan yang ma rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa las gzhan pa gang yin pa de yang ma rig pa yin te mig la sogs pa la'ang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // rig pa dang 'dra ba'i chos gzhan yang ma rig pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is other than knowledge is also ignorance because it would follow that eyes and so on are ignorance.

original: de med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab kyi rdzas kyang ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab kyi rdzas kyang ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: A phenomenon that is similar to knowledge is also not ignorance because it does not exist and because the substance of nonafflicted neutral wisdom would be ignorance.

original: smad pa'i rig pa yang ma rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smad pa'i rig pa yang ma rig pa ma yin te /
translated: Reprehensible knowledge is also not ignorance because it is not the opposite of knowledge.
