original: de med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can gyis shes rab kyi rdzas kyang ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can gyis shes rab kyi rdzas kyang ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it does not exist, and because the substance of the wisdom that is defiled would be ignorance.

original: ci nyes she na /
analyzed: ci nyes she na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The view that is defiled would be ignorance.

original: ci nyes she na /
analyzed: ci nyes she na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: so sor mi brjod par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par @8a * //
analyzed: so sor mi brjod par 'gyur ro // gal te de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par @8a * //
translated: It would not be mentioned separately.

original: ldan pa'i shes rab ma rig pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ldan pa'i shes rab ma rig pa yin par 'gyur /
translated: If the wisdom that is concomitant with the defilements other than that were ignorance,

original: ci nyes she na ;
analyzed: ci nyes she na ;
translated: what would be wrong with that?

original: ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Undifferentiated ignorance would not exist.

original: mi dge ba'i lta ba yang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i lta ba yang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the view that is nonvirtuous would not be concomitant with the root of nonvirtue.

original: rig pa chung ba yang ma rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa chung ba yang ma rig pa ma yin te /
translated: And the small awareness would not be ignorance.

original: brgyad pa la sogs pa'i rig pa ma rdzogs pa'i rig pa yang ma rig pa yin par gyur ta re /
analyzed: brgyad pa la sogs pa'i rig pa ma rdzogs pa'i rig pa yang ma rig pa yin par gyur ta re /
translated: And the awareness that is incomplete, such as the awareness of the eighth stage, would be ignorance.

original: rig pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de yang ma rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de yang ma rig pa ma yin te /
translated: And that which is free from awareness would not be ignorance.

original: rig pa ma skyes pa'i rgyud kyis mig la sogs pa thams cad kyang ma rig pa yin par gyur ta re /
analyzed: rig pa ma skyes pa'i rgyud kyis mig la sogs pa thams cad kyang ma rig pa yin par gyur ta re /
translated: If you say that ignorance is a mental factor that is not associated with a mind, then all the faculties such as the eyes, etc., would be ignorance, because they are not associated with a mind.

original: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gzhan ni ma rig pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gzhan ni ma rig pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: You should understand that ignorance is a factor that is adverse to knowledge.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa dang grags pa ma yin pa lta bu dang / chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa dang grags pa ma yin pa lta bu dang / chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like demerit and disrepute, and like nonattachment and nonhatred.

original: de'i ngo bo yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is its intrinsic nature?

original: re zhig byams pa'i rnam pa'i sems la chags pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang gang zhig yin ;
analyzed: re zhig byams pa'i rnam pa'i sems la chags pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang gang zhig yin ;
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of nonattachment in a mind that has the aspect of love?

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam pa la zhe sdang med pa yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam pa la zhe sdang med pa yang gang zhig yin /
translated: What is nonhatred in the aspect of impurity?

original: de gnyis la ni de gnyis te /
analyzed: de gnyis la ni de gnyis te /
translated: They have those two,

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: but they are not characterized by the absence of attachment and hatred.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi gzugs dang ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang nges bar bya ba su zhig nus ;
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi gzugs dang ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang nges bar bya ba su zhig nus ;
translated: Who can determine the intrinsic nature of the clarity of the faculties such as the eyes, etc.?

original: gnyid kyis log pa'i yang mthong ba'i bya ba byed pa las na de yod par nges par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa'i yang mthong ba'i bya ba byed pa las na de yod par nges par bya'o //
translated: Since the activity of seeing exists even in sleep, it is certain that it exists.

original: de bzhin du rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mtshan nyid kyis ma rig pa yod pa nyid du nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mtshan nyid kyis ma rig pa yod pa nyid du nges par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it is certain that ignorance exists because of the characteristic of being the opposite of knowledge.

original: rig pa 'di gang zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa 'di gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge?

original: gang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of ignorance.

original: gtsor ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dang de dang rjes su mthun pa dang de'i rjes la thob pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gtsor ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dang de dang rjes su mthun pa dang de'i rjes la thob pa yang yin no //
translated: It is primarily supramundane wisdom, that which is in harmony with it, and that which is attained subsequently.

original: de'i ched du byed pa dang de yongs su sbyong bar byed pa mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ched du byed pa dang de yongs su sbyong bar byed pa mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that is produced for that purpose, and that which is produced by the purification of that, is called knowledge.

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gsungs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gsungs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: It is said in the Sūtra Spoken by the Elder Śāriputra:🔽“What is knowledge?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag la ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang mthong ba na shes rab dang snang ba dang mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'i bar 'di ni rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag la ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang mthong ba na shes rab dang snang ba dang mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'i bar 'di ni rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one knows and sees the five appropriative aggregates as they are in reality, this is called understanding, vision, realization, and also knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir de rig pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rig pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called knowledge?

original: gang gi phyir de ji lta ba bzhin du rig pa yin @8b pa dang / des rnam par grol bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ji lta ba bzhin du rig pa yin @8b pa dang / des rnam par grol bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: Because it is knowledge of reality, and because it leads to liberation,

original: rig par 'gro ba des na rig pa zhes ji ltar rigs par nges tshig bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rig par 'gro ba des na rig pa zhes ji ltar rigs par nges tshig bshad par bya'o //
translated: or because it leads to knowledge, it is called knowledge.

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gsungs pa'i mdo sde las kyang /
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gsungs pa'i mdo sde las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra of the Elder Śāriputra says:

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che rab tu shes la de bas na rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che rab tu shes la de bas na rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Venerable Mahākoṣṭhila has knowledge, and therefore he is called one who has knowledge.

original: ci rab tu shes she na ;🔽gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ci rab tu shes she na ; gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: What does he know?🔽He knows form as it really is.

original: gzugs kun 'byung ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kun 'byung ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: He knows the origin of form, and so on.

original: de ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir rig pa dang rtog pa yin pa de bas na nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis rig pa zhes rnam grangs kyis ston bar byed de /
analyzed: de ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir rig pa dang rtog pa yin pa de bas na nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis rig pa zhes rnam grangs kyis ston bar byed de /
translated: Because it is the meaning of consciousness, it is knowledge and thought. Therefore, it is taught by the method of etymology as knowledge.

original: shin tu grags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽shes rab kyang rig pa zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: shin tu grags pa yin pa'i phyir ro // shes rab kyang rig pa zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: Because it is very well known.🔽Wisdom is also called knowledge.

original: rab tu shes par byed pa yang rig pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu shes par byed pa yang rig pa yin no //
translated: And that which causes thorough understanding is knowledge.

original: bya ba byed pa gzhan med par byed pa po ston pa ji ltar rigs te /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa gzhan med par byed pa po ston pa ji ltar rigs te /
translated: How is it correct to teach the agent without another action that is the object of the verb?

original: 'di ltar lhag ma'i sbyor bar mthong ba ni med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhag ma'i sbyor bar mthong ba ni med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Because it is seen that the remaining terms are not like that.

original: 'di nyid gtsug lag las sgras shi chad gnyis kyis rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes rab tu sbyor ba 'di mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di nyid gtsug lag las sgras shi chad gnyis kyis rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes rab tu sbyor ba 'di mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t it seen in the scriptures that this is applied as “The meaning of the root and the two verbal terminations are to be established”?

original: 'on te gtsug lag de yang tshad ma ma yin na ni sgra'i bstan bcos ci'i phyir tshad ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te gtsug lag de yang tshad ma ma yin na ni sgra'i bstan bcos ci'i phyir tshad ma yin /
translated: But if that scripture is not valid cognition, why is a treatise on grammar valid cognition?

original: 'jig rten na yang bya ba byed pa gzhan med par yang byed pa po ston pa mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang bya ba byed pa gzhan med par yang byed pa po ston pa mthong ste /
translated: In the world, the agent is seen to be taught without another action that is the object of the verb.

original: sa bon las myu gu 'byung bar byed pa yin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa bon las myu gu 'byung bar byed pa yin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it causes the sprout to arise from the seed.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir las ston zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir las ston zhe na /
translated: But why is karma taught?

original: shes rab kyi yul bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi yul bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach the object of wisdom.

original: yul gang la shes rab skyes pa yul du rab tu shes par byed do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul gang la shes rab skyes pa yul du rab tu shes par byed do zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said, One should know the object where wisdom arises as the object.

original: yang na gang du mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa de 'joms par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na gang du mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa de 'joms par byed pa yin no //
translated: Or, where there is an opposing factor, that is destroyed.

original: gang de zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang de zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa yin te /
translated: That which is called that is what was previously taught.

original: mdo sde de dang de las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde de dang de las gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is what is stated in this and that sūtra.

original: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Not knowing the prior limit, etc.

original: ma rig pa'i rnam par dbye ba dag dmigs pa dang / rnam grangs kyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rnam par dbye ba dag dmigs pa dang / rnam grangs kyis ston par byed do //
translated: This shows the divisions of ignorance by means of object and enumeration.

original: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The prior limit, etc. are the objects.

original: mi shes pa la sogs pa ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: mi shes pa la sogs pa ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Not knowing, etc. are the enumerations.

original: de la sngon gyi tshe'i cha ni sngon gyi mtha'o //

translated: Therein, the prior part of life is the prior limit.

original: phyi ma ni phyi ma'i mtha'o //

analyzed: gang de sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa ni ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam bya ba la sogs par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Ignorance of the past is doubt as to whether or not one existed in the past, and so on.

original: phyi ma'i mi shes pa ni ci bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram @9a * //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa ni dbye ba med par rmongs pa 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa ni dbye ba med par rmongs pa 'jug pa'am /
translated: Ignorance of the past and future is confusion without distinction as to whether or not one existed in the past, and whether or not one will exist in the future.

original: sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin phyi ma'i mtha' yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin phyi ma'i mtha' yod pa ma yin gyi /

translated: and that there are only these beings who are the objects of the senses.🔽Ignorance of the internal is the idea that the sentient beings in one’s own continuum do not exist.

original: phyi mi shes pa ni gzhan gyi rgyud la sems can du lta bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: phyi mi shes pa ni gzhan gyi rgyud la sems can du lta bar bsams pa'o //

original: bsod nams la yang bsod nams ma yin par 'du shes pa rnams phyugs gsod pa dang mer 'jug pa la sogs pa dang ldog pa'o //🔽bsod nams ma yin pa la yang bsod nams su 'du shes nas phyugs gsod pa dang mer 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //

original: rnam par smin ba la yang lha rnams ni rang byung ba yin no zhes rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'du shes pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin ba la yang lha rnams ni rang byung ba yin no zhes rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'du shes pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The idea that the gods are self-originated is the idea that they are not the result of evolution.

original: gnyis ka mi shes pa ni dbang phyug la sogs pa 'gro ba rnams kyi byed pa po yin par 'du shes pa'am rgyu med par smra ba rnams kyi'o //🔽sangs rgyas la sogs pa mi shes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub dang / chos legs par gsungs pa dang / dge 'dun legs par zhugs pa yin par thos nas de khong du mi chud pa'am /
analyzed: gnyis ka mi shes pa ni dbang phyug la sogs pa 'gro ba rnams kyi byed pa po yin par 'du shes pa'am rgyu med par smra ba rnams kyi'o // sangs rgyas la sogs pa mi shes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub dang / chos legs par gsungs pa dang / dge 'dun legs par zhugs pa yin par thos nas de khong du mi chud pa'am /
translated: The idea that the world is created by God, etc., or that the world is without a cause, is the idea that the world is created by something other than itself.🔽The idea that the Buddhas, etc., do not exist is the idea that the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the well-spoken Dharma, and the good practice of the Sangha do not exist, or the idea that one does not understand, or doubts, or denies, having heard that they exist.🔽The idea that suffering, etc., do not exist is the idea that suffering, origination, cessation, and the path do not exist, or the idea that one does not understand, or doubts, or denies, having heard that they exist.

original: the tshom za ba'am /🔽skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'am / skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: The idea that the truths are not truths is the idea that the truths of suffering, etc., are not truths, or the idea that one does not understand, or doubts, or denies, having heard that they are truths.🔽The idea that the truths are not seen is the idea that the truths of suffering, etc., are not seen, or the idea that one does not understand, or doubts, or denies, having heard that they are seen.🔽The idea that the truths are not realized is the idea that the truths of suffering, etc., are not realized, or the idea that one does not understand, or doubts, or denies, having heard that they are realized.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thos na snga ma bzhin no ;
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thos na snga ma bzhin no ;
translated: The idea that the truths are not fully understood is the idea that the truths of suffering, etc., are not fully understood, or the idea that one does not understand, or doubts, or denies, having heard that they are fully understood.🔽The idea that the truths are not abandoned is the idea that the truths of suffering, etc., are not abandoned, or the idea that one does not understand, or doubts, or denies, having heard that they are abandoned.🔽The idea that the truths are not cultivated is the idea that the truths of suffering, etc., are not cultivated, or the idea that one does not understand, or doubts, or denies, having heard that they are cultivated.

original: / rgyu dang rgyu las yang dag par byung ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: / rgyu dang rgyu las yang dag par byung ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The idea that the truths are not manifested is the idea that the truths of suffering, etc., are not manifested, or the idea

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bar du yin te /🔽byang chub kyi phyogs mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang @9b bcas pa rgyu dang bcas pa de dag ni dge ba yin te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bar du yin te / byang chub kyi phyogs mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang @9b bcas pa rgyu dang bcas pa de dag ni dge ba yin te /
translated: Virtue and nonvirtue are the dependent origination with its divisions up to.

original: bde ba'i don gyi phyir dang / 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir dang / ma rig pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i don gyi phyir dang / 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir dang / ma rig pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The factors of enlightenment and their opposites, together with their causes, are virtue because they are the cause of happiness, because they are the result of what is pleasing, and because they are the antidote to nescience.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni mkhas pas bsngags pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni mkhas pas bsngags pa'i don gyis so //
translated: They are blameless because they are praised by the wise.

original: bsten par bya ba ni yang nas yang du mngon du byung ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: bsten par bya ba ni yang nas yang du mngon du byung ba'i don gyis so //
translated: They are to be practiced because they are to be realized again and again.

original: tshim par byed pa ni lus dang sems tshim par byed pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: tshim par byed pa ni lus dang sems tshim par byed pa'i don gyis te /
translated: They are satisfying because they satisfy body and mind.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are endowed with the special quality of fitness.

original: dkar ba ni dri ma med pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: dkar ba ni dri ma med pa'i don gyis te /
translated: They are bright because they are stainless.

original: zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are uncontaminated.

original: de las bzlog pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams te /
translated: Their opposites are the qualities that are adverse to them.

original: mi dge ba la sogs pa yin no //🔽rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs de dag nyid yongs su ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de dag nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba la sogs pa yin no // rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs de dag nyid yongs su ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de dag nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: They are nonvirtue, etc.

original: skyes bu dam pa dang skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa la sogs pa dang / tshe rabs snga ma'i rgyu la brten te byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dang skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa la sogs pa dang / tshe rabs snga ma'i rgyu la brten te byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When the factors of enlightenment are in an impure stage, they are associated with adverse elements, because they arise in dependence on a resemblance to the adverse elements, and because they arise in dependence on the support of a holy person or an unholy person, etc., and because they arise in dependence on the causes of former lives.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ni de la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis ni de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ni de la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis ni de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: The correct understanding of the six sense bases of contact is the correct understanding of them by the supramundane knowledge of selflessness that has them as its object.

original: de dag mi shes pa ni gang gis khong du ma chud par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag mi shes pa ni gang gis khong du ma chud par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa yin no //
translated: Those who do not understand this are arrogant.

original: lam mi shes pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa mi shes pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: lam mi shes pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa mi shes pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between not knowing the path and not knowing the correct understanding?

original: des ni ji ltar mu stegs can bzhin du lam la lam yin par mi mos so //
analyzed: des ni ji ltar mu stegs can bzhin du lam la lam yin par mi mos so //
translated: The former does not believe that the path is the path, like the tīrthikas.

original: 'dis ni bstan pa 'di nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni bstan pa 'di nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The latter becomes arrogant in this teaching.

original: ma rig pa'i dmigs pa rab tu dbye ba de dag ni 'jug pa'i phyogs dang ldog pa'i phyogs 'di las brtsam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dmigs pa rab tu dbye ba de dag ni 'jug pa'i phyogs dang ldog pa'i phyogs 'di las brtsam pa yin par rig par bya'o //

original: 'di ni 'jug pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jug pa'i phyogs yin no //

original: gang de dang der zhes bya ba yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang de dang der zhes bya ba yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why does the verse say “in this and that”?

analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa re rer yang ma rig pa'i rnam grangs kyi bye brag brjod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to state the various synonyms of ignorance in each of the three times.

original: rnam grangs kyi bye brag brjod pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi bye brag brjod pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why does it state the various synonyms?

original: 'ga' zhig ji ltar yang de'i don khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang / de'i tshe rnam par g-yengs pa rnams de'i don thos par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ji ltar yang de'i don khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang / de'i tshe rnam par g-yengs pa rnams de'i don thos par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to make the meaning of ignorance understood in any way possible, and in order to make the meaning of ignorance understood by those whose minds wander at that time.

original: de nyid brjod na ni gzhan dag gis dpyad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid brjod na ni gzhan dag gis dpyad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were stated in its essential nature, others would have to analyze it.

original: yid rtul po dag kyang nas yang du de'i don rtogs pas mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir dang / sgra gcig la don du ma yod pas don tha dad par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir dang / ming de dag gis gsung rab las byung ba'i don de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yid rtul po dag kyang nas yang du de'i don rtogs pas mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir dang / sgra gcig la don du ma yod pas don tha dad par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir dang / ming de dag gis gsung rab las byung ba'i don de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to make the meaning of ignorance understood by those of dull faculties who would not forget it by repeatedly understanding it, in order to eliminate the understanding that a single term has many meanings, and in order to understand the meaning that occurs in the scriptures by those terms.

original: sman gyi rnam grangs kyi ming bzhin no //
analyzed: sman gyi rnam grangs kyi ming bzhin no //
translated: It is like the names of medicinal ingredients.

original: chos smra ba rnams kyis de'i don thob par bya ba dang tshig nye bar sbyar ba gnyis dang rjes su mthun bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid chos so so yang dag par rig pa yin par brjod par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la de'i sa bon gzhag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos smra ba rnams kyis de'i don thob par bya ba dang tshig nye bar sbyar ba gnyis dang rjes su mthun bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid chos so so yang dag par rig pa yin par brjod par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la de'i sa bon gzhag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to conform to the two, the acquisition of the meaning and the application of the words by the expounders of the Dharma, and in order to proclaim oneself to be one who has the analytical knowledge of the Dharma, and in order to plant the seed of that in others.

original: ci'i phyir ma rig pa kho na la ma rig pa'i rnam grangs bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma rig pa kho na la ma rig pa'i rnam grangs bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is only ignorance taught as a synonym for nescience?

original: rnam grangs so so rnams de bzhin du don gyi bye brag med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs so so rnams de bzhin du don gyi bye brag med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the synonyms are taught without any distinction of meaning.

original: gzhan yang gang dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, nescience is the counteragent of those.

original: ji ltar yin pa de ni rnam grangs rnam pa gsum dang bzhis bstan to //
analyzed: ji ltar yin pa de ni rnam grangs rnam pa gsum dang bzhis bstan to //
translated: How is that? It is taught by three and four kinds of synonyms.

original: gang dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig ba yin zhe na /
translated: What are the counteragents of nescience?

original: thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i rig pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i rig pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The obscurations to the three knowledges, i.e., the knowledge derived from hearing, reflection, and meditation, to the three insights, i.e., the insight of seeing, the insight of understanding, and the insight of realization,

original: ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin zhe na /
translated: How are they adverse?

original: de'i yul @10b bkab pa'i don gyis mun par gyur pa'i phyir dang / log par mthong bar byed pa'i don gyis yid gnyis dang / blo ngan pa dang / blo med pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul @10b bkab pa'i don gyis mun par gyur pa'i phyir dang / log par mthong bar byed pa'i don gyis yid gnyis dang / blo ngan pa dang / blo med pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are darkness in the sense of covering over the object-field of the three knowledges, and because they are doubt, bad thought, and absence of thought in the sense of causing wrong insight.

original: re zhig kun du rmongs pa dang yid gnyis kyi nyon mongs par rab tu sbyor bar ston pa gang yin pa dang / mun pa'i rnam pa dang blo med pa'i nyon mongs par rab tu sbyor ba ston pa ni rig na ma rig pa dang blo ngan pa'i nyon mongs par rab tu sbyor bar ji ltar bstan du rung zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig kun du rmongs pa dang yid gnyis kyi nyon mongs par rab tu sbyor bar ston pa gang yin pa dang / mun pa'i rnam pa dang blo med pa'i nyon mongs par rab tu sbyor ba ston pa ni rig na ma rig pa dang blo ngan pa'i nyon mongs par rab tu sbyor bar ji ltar bstan du rung zhe na /
translated: How can it be said that ignorance and bad thought are applied to the defilement of doubt and darkness, and that absence of thought is applied to the defilement of bad thought, when it is said that ignorance and bad thought are applied to the defilement of confusion and doubt, and darkness and absence of thought are applied to the defilement of bad thought?

original: tshor ba dang / rig pa dang / shes rab cis bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / rig pa dang / shes rab cis bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Feeling, perception, and consciousness are not different things.

original: ma'i rnam pa ni smad pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: ma'i rnam pa ni smad pa'i don yin te /
translated: The prefix avi means “inferior.”

original: smad pa'i rig pa 'di la yod pas ma rig pa zhes bya'o //🔽slob dpon 'chad pa ni sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa ni gtan tshigs rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smad pa'i rig pa 'di la yod pas ma rig pa zhes bya'o // slob dpon 'chad pa ni sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa ni gtan tshigs rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Since this inferior cognition exists, it is called ignorance.🔽The Master explains: Ignorance should be known as twofold:

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / de las grol ba'i bgegs byed pa gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / de las grol ba'i bgegs byed pa gnyis kyis so //
translated: ignorance of the prior limit, etc., and that which is favorable to the apprehension of self and that which obstructs liberation.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The apprehension of self is threefold:

original: rtag par 'dzin pa dang / dngos por 'dzin pa dang / byed pa po dang za ba por 'dzin pa'o /
analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa dang / dngos por 'dzin pa dang / byed pa po dang za ba por 'dzin pa'o /
translated: the apprehension of permanence, the apprehension of substantiality, and the apprehension of an agent.

original: de las grol ba'i bgegs byed pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de las grol ba'i bgegs byed pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That which obstructs liberation is fourfold:

original: skyabs su 'gro ba mi shes pa dang / mthong bar bya ba'i don mi shes pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po spangs pa dang bskyed pa mi shes pa dang / gnyen po la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba mi shes pa dang / mthong bar bya ba'i don mi shes pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po spangs pa dang bskyed pa mi shes pa dang / gnyen po la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: not knowing the refuge, not knowing the object to be seen, not knowing the abandonment and production of the adverse and the counteragent, and not knowing the absence of pride in the counteragent.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa /
translated: It is taught in the Yogācārabhūmi:

original: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is not knowing the prior limit?

original: 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog rtog ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog rtog ste /
translated: It is not knowing the past formative forces, due to incorrect reflection,

original: ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: such as: did I exist in the past? and so on.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is not knowing the later limit?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog cing /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog cing /
translated: It is not knowing the future formative forces, due to incorrect reflection,

original: ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: such as: will I exist in the future? and so on.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance of the past and future?🔽What is ignorance of the internal?🔽What is ignorance of the external?

original: nang la tshul bzhin ma yin pa ji ltar yin /🔽ji lta bur yod pa yin /
analyzed: nang la tshul bzhin ma yin pa ji ltar yin / ji lta bur yod pa yin /
translated: What is ignorance of the internal and external?🔽What is ignorance of the origin?

original: 'dug pa su yin /
analyzed: 'dug pa su yin /
translated: What is ignorance of the cessation?🔽What is ignorance of the path?🔽What is ignorance of the extent?

original: su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur /🔽sems 'di dag gang nas 'ongs /
analyzed: su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur / sems 'di dag gang nas 'ongs /
translated: What is ignorance of the past and future?

original: 'di nas shi nas gar 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nas shi nas gar 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is ignorance of the past and future in regard to the internal and external bases of cognition.

original: nang mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance of the internal?

original: @11a * // nang gi 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par bdag tu yid la byed pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: @11a * // nang gi 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par bdag tu yid la byed pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is ignorance of the internal formations through the mental attention to the self.

original: phyi mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance of the external?

original: sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa phyi'i 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par bdag gir yid la byed pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa phyi'i 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par bdag gir yid la byed pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is ignorance of the external formations through the mental attention to what is not the self as the self.

original: phyi dang nang mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi dang nang mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance of the internal and external?🔽It is ignorance of the internal and external formations through the mental attention to the self and to what is not the self.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par mdza' pa dang mi mdza' ba dang tha mal par rtog pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par mdza' pa dang mi mdza' ba dang tha mal par rtog pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is ignorance with regard to the formations of another's stream of consciousness, which consists in the false imagination of affection, antipathy and indifference.

original: las mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: las mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance with regard to action?

original: las dang de'i 'bras bu la yang phyin ci log tu tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: las dang de'i 'bras bu la yang phyin ci log tu tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is ignorance with regard to action and its results, which consists in the false imagination of the perversion of action and its results.

original: sangs rgyas mi shes pa gang zhe na /🔽sangs rgyas rnams ni byang chub yin par yid la mi byed pa'am /🔽phyin ci log tu yid la byed pa'am /🔽bag med pa'am /🔽the tshom za ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi shes pa gang zhe na / sangs rgyas rnams ni byang chub yin par yid la mi byed pa'am / phyin ci log tu yid la byed pa'am / bag med pa'am / the tshom za ba'am /
translated: What is ignorance with regard to the Buddha?

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is ignorance with regard to the Buddha, which consists in not attending to the fact that the Buddhas are Enlightened Ones, or in attending to them in a perverted way, or in being heedless, or in doubting, or in denying.

original: chos mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance with regard to the Teaching?

original: chos ni legs par gsungs pa yin par yid la mi byed pa'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chos ni legs par gsungs pa yin par yid la mi byed pa'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is ignorance with regard to the Teaching, which consists in not attending to the fact that the Teaching is well proclaimed, and so on as before.

original: dge 'dun mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge 'dun mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance with regard to the Community?

original: dge 'dun ni legs par sgrub pa yin par yid la mi byed pa'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni legs par sgrub pa yin par yid la mi byed pa'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The community is the good practice.🔽What is ignorance of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal mi shes pa gang zhe na /🔽sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du yid la mi byed pa zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi shes pa gang zhe na / sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du yid la mi byed pa zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is the non-attention to suffering as suffering.

original: de bzhin du lam gyi bar du ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lam gyi bar du ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the path as appropriate.

original: rgyu mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance of the cause?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the cause of suffering as cause, and the non-comprehension of the cause of the cessation of suffering as cause.🔽What is ignorance of the cause as cause?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the cause of the cause of suffering as cause.🔽What is ignorance of the origin?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the origin of the origin of suffering as origin.🔽What is ignorance of the path?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the path of the path of the cessation of suffering as path.🔽What is ignorance of the possible?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the possible as possible.🔽What is ignorance of the impossible?

original: rgyu med pa'ang mi mthun pa dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu yin par tshul bzhin ma yin par rtogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'ang mi mthun pa dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu yin par tshul bzhin ma yin par rtogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the non-comprehension of the impossible as impossible.🔽What is ignorance of action?🔽It is the non-comprehension of action as action.🔽What is ignorance of the result of action?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the result of action as the result of action.🔽What is ignorance of the effect?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the effect as effect.🔽What is ignorance of the cause of the effect?

original: rgyu ji lta bar rgyu las yang dag par byung ba'i chos la yang de bzhin no ;
analyzed: rgyu ji lta bar rgyu las yang dag par byung ba'i chos la yang de bzhin no ;
translated: It is the non-comprehension of the cause of the effect as the cause of the effect.🔽What is ignorance of the past?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the past as past.🔽What is ignorance of the future?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the future as future.🔽What is ignorance of the present?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the present as present.🔽What is ignorance of the wholesome?

original: / de dag kyang dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de dag kyang dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the non-comprehension of the wholesome as wholesome.🔽What is ignorance of the unwholesome?

original: mi dge ba ni kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the non-comprehension of the unwholesome as unwholesome.🔽What is ignorance of the neutral?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the neutral as neutral.🔽What is ignorance of the past?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the past as past.🔽What is ignorance of the future?

original: bsten par bya ba ni phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsten par bya ba ni phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the non-comprehension of the future as future.🔽What is ignorance of the present?🔽It is the non-comprehension of the present

original: bsten par bya ba ma yin pa ni phan pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsten par bya ba ma yin pa ni phan pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unwholesome is so called because it is not beneficial.

original: kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa ni nag po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa ni nag po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reprehensible is so called because it is black.

original: kha na mtho ba med pa ni dkar po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba med pa ni dkar po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The irreprehensible is so called because it is white.

original: rnam par dbye ba'i cha dang bcas pa ni 'dren pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i cha dang bcas pa ni 'dren pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The variable is so called because it is mixed.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ma shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ma shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the non-understanding of the six sense-fields of contact as they really are?

original: rtogs pa la sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal @11b can mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa la sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal @11b can mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the non-understanding of those who are conceited with a false sense of their own achievement.

original: mi shes pa de dag thams cad mdor bsdus na kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa bdun yin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa de dag thams cad mdor bsdus na kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa bdun yin te /
translated: All these non-understandings are in brief sevenfold:

original: dus la kun tu rmongs pa dang / dngos po la kun tu rmongs pa dang / 'pho ba la kun tu rmongs pa dang / mchog la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de kho na nyid la kun tu rmongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: dus la kun tu rmongs pa dang / dngos po la kun tu rmongs pa dang / 'pho ba la kun tu rmongs pa dang / mchog la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de kho na nyid la kun tu rmongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: Confusion about time, confusion about things, confusion about transition, confusion about the supreme, confusion about reality, affliction and purification.

original: rnam par byang ba la kun tu rmongs pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can la kun tu rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba la kun tu rmongs pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can la kun tu rmongs pa'o //
translated: 1. confusion about time, 2. confusion about things, 3. confusion about transmigration, 4. confusion about the highest, 5. confusion about reality, 6. confusion about defilement and purification, 7. confusion about the conceited.

original: mi shes pa nas ma rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam pa'i bar gyi ma rig pa'i rnam grangs drug po de dag ni kun nas rmongs pa'i dngos po bdun yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa nas ma rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam pa'i bar gyi ma rig pa'i rnam grangs drug po de dag ni kun nas rmongs pa'i dngos po bdun yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These six synonyms for nescience, from ignorance to the form of darkness, should be understood as the seven things that are confused.

original: kun tu rmongs pa'i dngos po tha ma gnyis gcig tu bya ste /
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa'i dngos po tha ma gnyis gcig tu bya ste /
translated: The last two things that are confused should be taken as one.

original: der rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam grangs gnyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: der rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam grangs gnyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: The two synonyms for nescience, knowledge and darkness, should be understood as that one thing.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam grangs gsum go rims bzhin du yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam grangs gsum go rims bzhin du yin no //
translated: There are also other categories: the categories of the three wisdoms, which arise from listening, reflection, and meditative concentration, are the three obstacles in order.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa de dag ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen po yin pa'i phyir gzhan yang gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa de dag ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen po yin pa'i phyir gzhan yang gsum mo //
translated: These three obstacles are also three, because they are weak, middling, and strong.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu dbye ba dang / ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye bas kyang rnam grangs drug yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu dbye ba dang / ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye bas kyang rnam grangs drug yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be known as six categories, by the division of the obstacles and the division of their intrinsic natures.

original: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las kyang /
analyzed: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las kyang /
translated: In the Dharmasamuccaya, the first chapter, the one on the analysis of the factors, it says,

original: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa nas brtsams te gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa nas brtsams te gsungs pa /
translated: beginning with the ignorance of the prior limit:

original: dge slong dag mdor na ma rig pa'i las ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag mdor na ma rig pa'i las ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, in brief, the action of ignorance should be understood as twofold:

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'jug pa'i rten sbyin pa'i las can gyi ma rig pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du ldog pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'jug pa'i rten sbyin pa'i las can gyi ma rig pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du ldog pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: It is the ignorance that has the function of causing entry into all the aspects, and it is the obstacle to the cessation of all the aspects.

original: btsun pa rnam pa thams cad du 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: btsun pa rnam pa thams cad du 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: “Reverend, what is entry into all the aspects?”

original: dge slong dag gang la 'jug pa dang / gang 'jug pa dang ji ltar 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang la 'jug pa dang / gang 'jug pa dang ji ltar 'jug pa ste /
translated: “Monks, it is entry into what is to be entered, entry into the way of entry, and entry into the nature of entry.

original: 'di ni rnam par thams cad du 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par thams cad du 'jug pa yin no //
translated: This is entry into all the aspects.

original: btsun pa gang la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: btsun pa gang la 'jug ce na /
translated: “Reverend, what is to be entered?”

original: dge slong dag bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dus la 'jug go //
analyzed: dge slong dag bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dus la 'jug go //
translated: “Monks, it is the entry into the time of the discrimination of self.

original: btsun pa gang 'jug ce na /
analyzed: btsun pa gang 'jug ce na /
translated: “Reverend, what is the entry?”

original: dge slong dag bdag tu 'dzin pas nang dang phyi'i skye mched la'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag bdag tu 'dzin pas nang dang phyi'i skye mched la'o //
translated: “Monks, it is the entry into the internal and external sense media by the grasping of self.

original: btsun pa ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: btsun pa ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: “Reverend, what is the nature of entry?”

original: dge slong dag bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang log par yongs su rtogs pa las dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyun 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag bdag tu rnam par rtog pa dang log par yongs su rtogs pa las dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyun 'jug pa'o //
translated: “Monks, it is the entry into the stream of the results of evolution of the discrimination of self and of false views.

original: btsun pa rnam pa thams cad du ldog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: btsun pa rnam pa thams cad du ldog pa gang zhe na /
translated: “Reverend, what is the cessation of all the aspects?”

original: dge slong dag mdor na rnam pa thams cad du @12a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag mdor na rnam pa thams cad du @12a * //
translated: Monks, in brief, in every way,🔽

original: ldog pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ldog pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, monks, there are four kinds of complete separation:

original: ldog pa'i rten dang / ldog pa'i dmigs pa dang / ldog pa'i yid la byed pa dang / ldog pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pas kyang yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rten dang / ldog pa'i dmigs pa dang / ldog pa'i yid la byed pa dang / ldog pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pas kyang yin no //
translated: complete separation by basis, complete separation by object, complete separation by mental attention, and complete separation by accomplishment of the result.

original: de la yang 'chad par byed pa dag ji ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las byung ba bzhin du dus mi shes pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la yang 'chad par byed pa dag ji ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las byung ba bzhin du dus mi shes pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Here, the commentators say that the time is not known, as in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: nang la sogs pa la ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched kyi dbye ba dang / nang gi skye mched kyi gnas kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: nang la sogs pa la ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched kyi dbye ba dang / nang gi skye mched kyi gnas kyi dbye bas so //
translated: In the case of internal, etc., it is by the division of internal and external sense bases, and by the division of the location of the internal sense bases.

original: ldog pa'i yid la byed pa ni rgyu dang rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams la'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i yid la byed pa ni rgyu dang rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams la'o //
translated: Complete separation by mental attention is in regard to dharmas that are causes and results.

original: de la yang dge ba ni ma rig pa'i gnyen po'i don gyis so //
analyzed: de la yang dge ba ni ma rig pa'i gnyen po'i don gyis so //
translated: Here, the wholesome is in the sense of being the antidote to ignorance.

original: mi dge ba ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi don gyis so //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi don gyis so //
translated: The unwholesome is in the sense of being its counteragent.

original: dge ba de dag kyang 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi ni kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba de dag kyang 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi ni kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: And these virtues are accompanied by reprehensible actions for those outside this teaching.

original: chos 'di pa rnams kyi ni kha na mtho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams kyi ni kha na mtho ba med pa yin no //
translated: But for those who belong to this teaching, they are not accompanied by reprehensible actions.

original: kha na mtho ba med pa ni yang bsten par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba med pa ni yang bsten par bya ba yin no //
translated: Those which are not accompanied by reprehensible actions are to be cultivated.

original: kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa ni bsten par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa ni bsten par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Those which are accompanied by reprehensible actions are not to be cultivated.

original: dge ba 'di dag nyid zag pa dang bcas pa ni ngan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba 'di dag nyid zag pa dang bcas pa ni ngan pa'o //
translated: These very virtues are bad when they are accompanied by impurities.

original: zag pa med pa ni gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni gya nom pa'o //
translated: They are excellent when they are without impurities.

original: de dag nyid mi dge ba ni nag po'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid mi dge ba ni nag po'o //
translated: They are black when they are non-virtuous.

original: dge ba zag pa med pa ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa med pa ni dkar po'o //
translated: They are white when they are virtuous and without impurities.

original: de las gzhan pa ni 'dren ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni 'dren ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The others are mixed because they are a combination of the former.

original: thams cad kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: All of them are called dependent origination because they originate in dependence.

original: de nyid las kyang mi shes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don bstan par brtsams te gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid las kyang mi shes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don bstan par brtsams te gsungs pa /
translated: And in that very text, the meaning of the words ignorance, etc. is explained. It says:

original: btsun pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa'i bye brag gang zhe na /
analyzed: btsun pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa'i bye brag gang zhe na /
translated: Venerable Sir, what is the specific ignorance that is the counteragent to the supreme dharmas?

original: dge slong dag ma rig pa ni mchog gi chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa dang / rgya chen po'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag ma rig pa ni mchog gi chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa dang / rgya chen po'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Monks, ignorance should be seen as the counteragent to the supreme dharmas and as the counteragent to the extensive dharmas.

original: btsun pa ma rig pa ni mchog gi chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji ltar lags /🔽dge slong dag dbang po lnga rnams kyi nan gnas 'di ni bslang bar bya ba 'di ni bstan par bya ba ste /
analyzed: btsun pa ma rig pa ni mchog gi chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji ltar lags / dge slong dag dbang po lnga rnams kyi nan gnas 'di ni bslang bar bya ba 'di ni bstan par bya ba ste /
translated: Venerable Sir, how is ignorance the counteragent to the supreme dharmas?

original: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: Monks, this is the basis of the five faculties, this is what is to be aroused, this is what is to be manifested, namely, the faculty of wisdom.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ma rig pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ma rig pa yin te /
translated: Its counteragent is ignorance.

original: des na mchog gi chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na mchog gi chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the counteragent to the supreme dharmas.

original: btsun pa ji ltar rgya chen po'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa lags /
analyzed: btsun pa ji ltar rgya chen po'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa lags /
translated: Venerable Sir, how is ignorance the counteragent to the extensive dharmas?

original: dge slong dag thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i mi @12b mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i mi @12b mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa yin te /
translated: “Monks, ignorance is the counteragent to the knowledge that arises from hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: des na rgya chen po'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na rgya chen po'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the counteragent to the extensive Dharma.

original: btsun pa ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i bye brag lags /
analyzed: btsun pa ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i bye brag lags /
translated: “Reverend, what is the difference between ignorance and the latent afflictions?”

original: dge slong dag srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi khams gsum pa'i sems can rnams la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi khams gsum pa'i sems can rnams la 'di lta ste /
translated: “Monks, in the three realms of sentient beings, from the peak of existence down to the Avīci hell,

original: sems can rnams la mi shes pa yod pa de ni dum bur ma byas pa /
analyzed: sems can rnams la mi shes pa yod pa de ni dum bur ma byas pa /
translated: there is ignorance that is not divided into parts,

original: gsod ldong du ma byas pa /
analyzed: gsod ldong du ma byas pa /
translated: not distinguished,

original: bag la nyal ba dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
translated: but is associated with the latent afflictions.

original: des na sems can de dag ni mtha' dag gis bcings pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sems can de dag ni mtha' dag gis bcings pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all sentient beings are bound by it.

original: gang yang bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par dbye ba mi shes pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gang yang bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par dbye ba mi shes pa yang yin te /
translated: They do not know the causes and effects of good and bad destinies.

original: de yang shin du chung ba ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de yang shin du chung ba ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi'o //
translated: The smallest is that of sentient beings in the formless realm.

original: bar ma ni gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bar ma ni gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The medium is that of sentient beings in the form realm.

original: chen po ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chen po ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The largest is that of sentient beings in the desire realm.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las ma rig pa'i rnam par 'byed pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las ma rig pa'i rnam par 'byed pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the analysis of ignorance.

original: // / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba'i 'du byed gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba'i 'du byed gang zhe na /
translated: What are the formations that are conditioned by ignorance?

original: 'du byed rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of formations:

original: zhes bya ba de la /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams ni lus la sogs pa'i dbye bas rab tu dbye ba bstan gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams ni lus la sogs pa'i dbye bas rab tu dbye ba bstan gyi /
translated: This is explained in the following.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin na //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin na //
translated: The Blessed One taught the classification of formations by way of the body and so on, but not by way of their intrinsic reality.

original: mdo sde gzhan las kyang dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba ni las kyi 'du byed do //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las kyang dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba ni las kyi 'du byed do //
translated: In other sūtras, he also said, “Inhaling and exhaling are bodily formations.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa ni dag gi 'du byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa ni dag gi 'du byed do //
translated: Conceptualization and analysis are verbal formations.

original: 'du shes dang sems pa ni yid kyi 'du byed do zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: 'du shes dang sems pa ni yid kyi 'du byed do zhes gsungs na /
translated: Perception and intention are mental formations.”

original: de dag ci 'dir de kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'am ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ci 'dir de kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'am ma yin zhe na /
translated: Should one understand the term “formations” in the same way here?

original: smras pa / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi bye brag la 'dir lus la sogs pa'i 'du byed du bzhed do //
analyzed: smras pa / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi bye brag la 'dir lus la sogs pa'i 'du byed du bzhed do //
translated: No. Here, the term “formations” refers to the formations of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'di ji ltar mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar mngon zhe na /
translated: How do we know that?

original: mdo sde dang rig pas so //🔽re zhig bum pa lta bu'i mdo sde las bcom ldan 'das kyis de ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis bsod nams kyi 'du byed kyang mngon par 'du byed /
analyzed: mdo sde dang rig pas so // re zhig bum pa lta bu'i mdo sde las bcom ldan 'das kyis de ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis bsod nams kyi 'du byed kyang mngon par 'du byed /
translated: From the scriptures and from reasoning.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyang mngon par 'du byed ces gsungs so ;
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyang mngon par 'du byed ces gsungs so ;
translated: In the sūtra on the aggregates, the Blessed One said: “Due to the condition of ignorance, meritorious formations, nonmeritorious formations, and unshakable formations are formed.”

original: / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba yin par bzhed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba yin par bzhed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One did not say that the in-breaths and out-breaths are meritorious, nonmeritorious, or unshakable.

original: yang de gal te bsod nams kyi 'du byed mngon par 'du byed na /
analyzed: yang de gal te bsod nams kyi 'du byed mngon par 'du byed na /
translated: Moreover, if the in-breaths and out-breaths were formations, then the Blessed One would not have said: “If you form meritorious formations, you will obtain a meritorious destiny.”

original: bsod nams kyis nye bar 'gro ba ni rnam par shes pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyis nye bar 'gro ba ni rnam par shes pa 'di yin no //
translated: The consciousness that goes to the place of merit is the consciousness that goes to the place of non-merit.

original: de bzhin du mi g-yo ba'i bar du nye bar @13a * //🔽'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi g-yo ba'i bar du nye bar @13a * // 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, up to the consciousness that goes to the place of the imperturbable.

original: 'dir 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin par yang gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin par yang gsungs te /
translated: Here, the condition of the formations is consciousness.

original: de bas na gang 'du byed kyis nye bar 'gro ba ni der rnam par shes pa yin par gsungs la /
analyzed: de bas na gang 'du byed kyis nye bar 'gro ba ni der rnam par shes pa yin par gsungs la /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the consciousness that goes to the place of the formations is the consciousness that goes to the place of the formations.

original: de ni 'dir 'du byed kyi rkyen can yin no zhes nges pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'dir 'du byed kyi rkyen can yin no zhes nges pa bzung ngo //
translated: It is said that this is the condition of the formations.🔽Moreover, it is said that the formations of the body with pain are conditioned by the formations of the body with pain.🔽As long as there is pain, one is born in a world with pain.

original: yang gnod pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyi 'du byed 'dus byas pas ji tsam gnod pa dang bcas pa'i bar gyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba ni skye ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gnod pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyi 'du byed 'dus byas pas ji tsam gnod pa dang bcas pa'i bar gyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba ni skye ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the in-and-out breathing is not the cause of birth.

original: re zhig mdo sde las ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig mdo sde las ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the case according to the sutras.

original: rig pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rig pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What about according to reasoning?

original: gal te ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la sogs par 'gyur ba ni dgra bcom pa la yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la sogs par 'gyur ba ni dgra bcom pa la yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the in-and-out breathing, etc. were conditioned by ignorance, they would not exist for the Arhat.

original: gal te yang de'i rkyen gyis yang srid pa pa'i rnam par shes pa yin par 'gyur na ni dgra bcom pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang de'i rkyen gyis yang srid pa pa'i rnam par shes pa yin par 'gyur na ni dgra bcom pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if they were the consciousness that is conditioned by that, the Arhat would have existence.

original: re zhig ji ltar lus la sogs pa'i las rnams ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis yin par 'dod /
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar lus la sogs pa'i las rnams ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis yin par 'dod /
translated: How do you accept that the actions of body, etc. are conditioned by ignorance?

original: de dag ni dgra bcom pa la yang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dgra bcom pa la yang med pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not not exist for the Arhat.

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: The in-and-out breathing, etc. are the same.

original: dgra bcom pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las gang yin pa 'dod na ni de dag ni lus la sogs pa'i las ma yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las gang yin pa 'dod na ni de dag ni lus la sogs pa'i las ma yin te /
translated: If you accept that the actions of body, etc. are for the Arhat, they are not the actions of body, etc.

original: yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not form a new existence.

original: de lta bu dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The in-and-out breathing, etc. are not like that.

original: de bas na rig pas kyang nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rig pas kyang nges pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that they are conditioned by consciousness.

original: bsod nams la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dir lus la sogs pa'i las kyi bye brag lus la sogs pa'i 'du byed du bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dir lus la sogs pa'i las kyi bye brag lus la sogs pa'i 'du byed du bzhed pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of merit, etc., are considered here to be the specific activities of the body, etc., i.e., the formative forces of the body, etc.🔽What is merit?

original: bsod nams kyang ci yin /🔽bsod nams ma yin pa yang ci yin /
analyzed: bsod nams kyang ci yin / bsod nams ma yin pa yang ci yin /
translated: What is demerit?

original: mi g-yo ba yang ci yin /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba yang ci yin /
translated: What is imperturbable?

original: de dag gi tshig ni bstan par mi mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi tshig ni bstan par mi mngon zhe na /
translated: The words of these are not evident in the exposition.

original: 'di skad du brjod de /
analyzed: 'di skad du brjod de /
translated: This is said:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i las ni bsod nams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i las ni bsod nams so //
translated: Merit is wholesome action in the realm of desire.

original: mi dge ba ni bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
translated: Demerit is unwholesome action.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa ni spyod pa'i dge ba ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa ni spyod pa'i dge ba ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The wholesome action in the realms of form and the formless is called imperturbable.

original: ci'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called imperturbable?

original: g-yo ba ni 'gul ba ste rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni 'gul ba ste rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Perturbation is to be understood as the alteration of the essential nature through movement.

original: de mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo yin pas mi g-yo ba can te /
analyzed: de mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo yin pas mi g-yo ba can te /
translated: It is imperturbable because it has the nature of being imperturbable.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag na ni 'dis g-yos par mi nus pas mi g-yo ba yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag na ni 'dis g-yos par mi nus pas mi g-yo ba yin te /
translated: In the meditative development of the absorptions and the formless attainments, it is not possible to perturb this through the perturbation of the essential nature.

original: sa 'og ma'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs des mi bsgul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs des mi bsgul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not shaken by the adverse elements of the lower stage.

original: der 'byung @13b ba'i las ni mi g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: der 'byung @13b ba'i las ni mi g-yo ba yin no //
translated: The action that occurs there is unshakable.

original: gzhan dag na re sa de las gang gi phyir las kyi rnam par smin pa mi g-yo ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sa de las gang gi phyir las kyi rnam par smin pa mi g-yo ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: According to another opinion, the action is unshakable because its retribution is unshakable.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las gang ci yang rung ba'i nang du smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de smon lam la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan gyis yongs su zin pas lha'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las gang ci yang rung ba'i nang du smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de smon lam la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan gyis yongs su zin pas lha'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Any action whatsoever, of the realm of desire, which should be retributed in hell, can be retributed in the heavenly world of the gods, by the efficacy of a powerful mind.

original: yi dags kyi nang du'am /
analyzed: yi dags kyi nang du'am /
translated: The same for the pretas and animals.

original: dmyal ba'i nang du smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i nang du smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The action should be retributed in the hells is retributed in the heavenly world of the gods.

original: lha'i ris dang por rnam par smin par 'gyur pa gang yin pa de ni drug pa'i bar du smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i ris dang por rnam par smin par 'gyur pa gang yin pa de ni drug pa'i bar du smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The action should be retributed in the first stage of the gods is retributed in the sixth stage of the gods.

original: lha'i nang du smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mi'i nang du smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha'i nang du smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mi'i nang du smin par 'gyur te /
translated: The action should be retributed in the heavenly world of the gods is retributed in the human world.

original: ji skad du skal ba chung ba'i mi la sogs pa dang / lan tshva srang gcig lta bu dang / rna rigs kyi mdo las gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du skal ba chung ba'i mi la sogs pa dang / lan tshva srang gcig lta bu dang / rna rigs kyi mdo las gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and as in the sutra of the Ksatriya caste.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i sa las gzhan gang yin pa des gzhan du lan 'ga' yang smin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i sa las gzhan gang yin pa des gzhan du lan 'ga' yang smin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not the case that the karma to be experienced in the form and formless realms, other than the levels of the absorptions and formless states, will ever ripen elsewhere.

original: de bas na rnam par smin pa mi g-yo zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de bas na rnam par smin pa mi g-yo zhes bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, it is called immutable.

original: / gal te bsam gtan gyis pa'i dge ba bsod nams yin par mi 'dod na ni ji skad du gnas 'dug pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: / gal te bsam gtan gyis pa'i dge ba bsod nams yin par mi 'dod na ni ji skad du gnas 'dug pa'i mdo las /
translated: If you do not accept that virtue of the absorptions is merit, then you would contradict the Sutra of the Abode of the Fortunate, where it says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten 'chags pa'i tshe sems can kha cig tshe zad las zad bsod nams zad nas 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos te 'dir mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba de dag 'gal bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten 'chags pa'i tshe sems can kha cig tshe zad las zad bsod nams zad nas 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos te 'dir mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba de dag 'gal bar 'gyur ro
translated: When the world is forming, some sentient beings, their life span and karma exhausted, and their merit exhausted, die in the Abode of the Clear Light and are born here, equal in fortune to humans.

original: // bsod nams de ni yod de /
analyzed: // bsod nams de ni yod de /
translated: That merit exists.

original: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las gsum bstan pa'i tshe de mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par brjod par bya ba'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba la sogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las gsum bstan pa'i tshe de mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par brjod par bya ba'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba la sogs pa bzhin te /
translated: When the three karmas of merit and so on are taught, the term “non-wavering” is used to distinguish it from once-returners and so on.

original: de dag rgyun tu zhugs pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag rgyun tu zhugs pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not non-stream-enterers,

original: khyad par gyi ming gis bstan to //
analyzed: khyad par gyi ming gis bstan to //
translated: but are taught by the name of their distinction.

original: gzhan dag na re bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bsod nams so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bsod nams so //
translated: Others say: Karma to be experienced as pleasure is merit.

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
translated: Karma to be experienced as pain is non-merit.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba ni mi g-yo ba ste bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong ma'i 'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba ni mi g-yo ba ste bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong ma'i 'o //
translated: Karma to be experienced as neither pleasure nor pain is unwavering, above the third absorption.

original: de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan gsum po 'di na ni 'phags pa 'di dag g-yo ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan gsum po 'di na ni 'phags pa 'di dag g-yo ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “In these three absorptions, these āryas are wavering.”

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa 'dir ni 'phags pa 'di dag mi g-yo ba yin no zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa 'dir ni 'phags pa 'di dag mi g-yo ba yin no zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: In this fourth absorption, these āryas are unwavering.”

original: de ltar na 'og ma rnams kyi bde ba yang ma @14a * //
analyzed: de ltar na 'og ma rnams kyi bde ba yang ma @14a * //
translated: In the same way, the bliss of the lower ones is also not the bliss of the higher ones.🔽
