original: yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain would not be karmic maturation for those beings.

original: mdo sde dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur te ji skad du /
analyzed: mdo sde dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur te ji skad du /
translated: And it would contradict the sutra, for it is said:

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can rnams kyi dbang du byas nas sems can kha cig ni tsho zad las zad bsod nams zad nas de nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can rnams kyi dbang du byas nas sems can kha cig ni tsho zad las zad bsod nams zad nas de nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: With reference to the beings of the base of neither perception nor non-perception, some beings exhaust their life span, exhaust their karma and exhaust their merit and then die.

original: kha cig ni de nyid du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni de nyid du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some attain nirvana there.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni rang gi ba'i g-yo ba med pas mi g-yo ba yin par bstan to //🔽bsam gtan gzhan dag kyang mi g-yo ba med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni rang gi ba'i g-yo ba med pas mi g-yo ba yin par bstan to // bsam gtan gzhan dag kyang mi g-yo ba med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The fourth absorption is called immovable because it is free of the movement of its own affliction.

original: sa 'og ma'i g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other absorptions are not immovable because they are not free of the movement of lower affliction.

original: rnam grangs kyi mi g-yo ba yin par brjod par rigs te /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi mi g-yo ba yin par brjod par rigs te /
translated: It is logical to say that it is immovable in the sense of a category.

original: de'i yan lag gi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i yan lag gi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the expression “the nirvana of its parts.”

original: de gal te de dag de lta bu yin na ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams re zhig bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed ma yin par mdo sde 'di las bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa yin par grub🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: de gal te de dag de lta bu yin na ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams re zhig bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed ma yin par mdo sde 'di las bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa yin par grub pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the sutra’s statement that the actions of body, speech, and mind are not meritorious, demeritorious, and immovable volitions is established as the intention of the Lord.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis las zhes ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis las zhes ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not say that the volitions are conditioned by ignorance.

original: ji ste las kyi ngo bo nyid de dag las kyi bye brag gis 'du byed yin na las gang yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa de dag ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste las kyi ngo bo nyid de dag las kyi bye brag gis 'du byed yin na las gang yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa de dag ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: If the volitions are the nature of action, and action is distinguished as volition, then how should one understand the action that is the manifestor of the new existence?

original: ji skad du mdo sde gzhan las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo sde gzhan las /
translated: As it is said in another sutra:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed pa de bas na 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po bstan to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed pa de bas na 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po bstan to zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The Lord has taught the manifestor of the conditioned as the appropriator of the aggregates.”

original: 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po yang gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis sems pa'i tshogs drug yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po yang gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis sems pa'i tshogs drug yin par bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One has also taught that the appropriating aggregates are the six collections of consciousness.

original: ji ltar na las kyi yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na las kyi yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed ce na /
translated: How does action project a new existence?

original: ma btab pa de 'debs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma btab pa de 'debs par byed pa'o //
translated: It projects by planting a seed in consciousness.

original: ji ltar 'debs she na rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la thog ma nyid du de'i sa bon 'jog pa'i phyir ro //🔽sa bon zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na nus pa'i bye brag yin no //🔽nus pa zhes bya ba de chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'debs she na rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la thog ma nyid du de'i sa bon 'jog pa'i phyir ro // sa bon zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na nus pa'i bye brag yin no // nus pa zhes bya ba de chos gang zhe na /
translated: How does it plant a seed? By causing the seed already existing in consciousness to grow.🔽What is called a seed is a special power.🔽What is this power called a seed? It is the cause.

original: rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
translated: What is this cause? It is the seed.

original: dper na 'bru'i 'bras bu ni rkyen gyi bye brag sa gzhi dang thal ba dang chu la sogs pa la ltos nas myu gu'i rnam par skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i dngos po ni sa bon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bru'i 'bras bu ni rkyen gyi bye brag sa gzhi dang thal ba dang chu la sogs pa la ltos nas myu gu'i rnam par skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i dngos po ni sa bon zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, the fruit of the rice plant, in dependence on a special condition, such as a field, ashes, water, etc., is the cause of the arising of the sprout in the form of a rice plant. This is called a seed.

original: ma du lung ga'i 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi me tog rgya skyegs kyi khu bas bskus pa de ni ge sar dmar por 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: ma du lung ga'i 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi me tog rgya skyegs kyi khu bas bskus pa de ni ge sar dmar por 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
translated: The flower of the mango tree, anointed with lac juice, is the cause of the red color of the kernel.

original: zangs la sogs pa la @14b yang bu ba 'ju ba dang mkhrang ba ni gser la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yod de de dag ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: zangs la sogs pa la @14b yang bu ba 'ju ba dang mkhrang ba ni gser la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yod de de dag ni dpe yin no //
translated: And in the case of copper, etc., the cause of the transformation into gold, etc., is the presence of mercury, etc. These are the examples.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang ji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang ji skad du /
translated: And the noble Śāriputra said:

original: dge slong bsam gtan pa rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa sems la dbang thob pas shing gi sdong po 'di la khams dang gang mos par byas pa de dag kyang de bzhin du 'gyur te gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong bsam gtan pa rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa sems la dbang thob pas shing gi sdong po 'di la khams dang gang mos par byas pa de dag kyang de bzhin du 'gyur te gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: “The monk who is an ascetic, who has attained the superknowledges, who has attained mastery of mind, has made this tree trunk his element and his delight, and it is just as he has made it, not otherwise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: shing gi sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod pas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shing gi sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod pas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because this tree trunk has various elements.”

original: de la khams dang gang mos pa zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la khams zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la khams dang gang mos pa zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la khams zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: There, “element” means the characteristics of earth, etc.

original: shing gi sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang nus pa dang rgyu'i dngos po la khams zhes dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shing gi sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang nus pa dang rgyu'i dngos po la khams zhes dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of the statement “In this tree trunk there are various elements” is that the seeds, the potentialities, and the causal entities are called elements.

original: sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag ni ma yin te /
translated: The parts that have the characteristics of earth, etc., are not.

original: shing gi sdong po gcig la bsam gtan pa'i mos pa'i bye brag tha dad pas yan lag rnam pa mtha' med par 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir yan lag mtha' med par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: shing gi sdong po gcig la bsam gtan pa'i mos pa'i bye brag tha dad pas yan lag rnam pa mtha' med par 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir yan lag mtha' med par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: This is because it is possible that the parts of a single tree trunk would be infinite in number, since they would be different according to the different intentions of the contemplatives.

original: de bas na rgyu'i dngos po de la khams zhes dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu'i dngos po de la khams zhes dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement “In this tree trunk there are various elements” is that the causal entities are called elements.

original: chos gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other entity.

original: 'di ni dpe gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dpe gzhan yin no //
translated: This is another example.

original: sems kyi rgyud la sa bon brtas pa de yang yun ji srid cig tu 'dug ce na /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud la sa bon brtas pa de yang yun ji srid cig tu 'dug ce na /
translated: For how long does the seed that is developed in the mental continuum remain?

original: 'bras bu ji srid ma byung ba'i bar du yin te lus kyi las sogs pa'i ngo bo 'di ni lus kyi 'du byed la sogs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ji srid ma byung ba'i bar du yin te lus kyi las sogs pa'i ngo bo 'di ni lus kyi 'du byed la sogs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: Until the effect arises, this entity of the action of body, etc. is the formative force of body, etc.

original: lus gang yin las ci yin /
analyzed: lus gang yin las ci yin /
translated: What is the body? What is action?

original: ci'i phyir lus zhes bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lus zhes bya /
translated: Why is it called body?

original: las zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: las zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Why is it called action?

original: lus kyi las zhes bya ba yang brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: lus kyi las zhes bya ba yang brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Why is it called action of body?

original: de bzhin du yid kyi las kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi las kyi bar du'o //
translated: The same applies up to the action of mind.

original: de ltar brjod na ni brjod pa mangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar brjod na ni brjod pa mangs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one were to explain it in this way, there would be too many words.

original: de bas na de dag ni las grub pa las gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni las grub pa las gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be understood from the established action.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba 'dir rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba 'dir rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod pa yin te /
translated: Here, in the statement, “Conditioned by ignorance, there are volitions,” there is a fault in the determination of the conditioned and the conditioning in terms of both the definite and the indefinite.

original: gal te ma rig pa kho na 'du byed kyi rkyen yin na ni de dag gi rkyen ma rig pa kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa kho na 'du byed kyi rkyen yin na ni de dag gi rkyen ma rig pa kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin pas /
translated: If ignorance alone is the condition of the volitions, then ignorance alone is the condition of those, not something else.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang 'dun pa dang rtsol ba la sogs pa med par yang ma rig pa tsam las bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams rgyun du 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang 'dun pa dang rtsol ba la sogs pa med par yang ma rig pa tsam las bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams rgyun du 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and that merit, demerit, and unmoving action would occur in a stream without the intention and effort of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: gang yang mdo sde gzhan las /
analyzed: gang yang mdo sde gzhan las /
translated: It would also contradict other sūtras,🔽which say:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang gsum mo //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang gsum mo //
translated: There are three roots of virtue.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang gsum ste /🔽gsum ni las kyi gzhi dang kun @15a * //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang gsum ste / gsum ni las kyi gzhi dang kun @15a * //
translated: There are three roots of nonvirtue.

original: 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Three are the basis and origin of action.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis chor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa dang / rnam par brtags rnam par dpyad nas dag rjod par byed kyi /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis chor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa dang / rnam par brtags rnam par dpyad nas dag rjod par byed kyi /
translated: Feeling, discernment, intention, and contact are conditions for each other.

original: ma brtag ma dpyad par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma brtag ma dpyad par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One speaks after investigating and analyzing, not without investigating and analyzing.

original: 'on te 'du byed kho na'i rkyen ma rig pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'du byed kho na'i rkyen ma rig pa yin te /
translated: Or, if ignorance is the condition of only formation,

original: de dag kho na'i rkyen ma rig pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin na ni ma rig pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang gzhan rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang mdo sde las /
analyzed: de dag kho na'i rkyen ma rig pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin na ni ma rig pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang gzhan rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang mdo sde las /
translated: Moreover, this would contradict the sutra that states:🔽Ignorance is for the sake of thoroughly arousing attachment, thoroughly arousing aversion and thoroughly arousing delusion,

original: ma rig pa ni kun tu 'dod chags par bya ba'i phyir dang / kun tu zhe sdang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / kun tu gti mug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / ma rig pa kun tu 'byung ba las zag pa kun tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni kun tu 'dod chags par bya ba'i phyir dang / kun tu zhe sdang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / kun tu gti mug par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / ma rig pa kun tu 'byung ba las zag pa kun tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba dang /
translated: and that which states: Contaminations arise from the occurrence of ignorance,

original: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma kun tu 'byung ba de dag thams cad ni ma rig pa'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma kun tu 'byung ba de dag thams cad ni ma rig pa'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and that which states: All those many types of negative nonvirtuous phenomena that occur are caused by ignorance.

original: 'on te gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni /
translated: If both are determined,

original: des na gnyis ka'i phyogs kyi skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gnyis ka'i phyogs kyi skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the consequence is that both positions are erroneous.

original: 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces ston pa don med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces ston pa don med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is not certain, then it is pointless to teach that formations have ignorance as their condition.

original: 'dir nges pa dang ma nges pa gnyis ka yin na yang bshad pa don med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir nges pa dang ma nges pa gnyis ka yin na yang bshad pa don med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Here, even if it is both certain and uncertain, the teaching is not pointless.

original: de bzhin du bstan pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyi gtso bo bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyi gtso bo bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the teaching is to show the principal condition of formations.

original: ji ltar ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi gtso bo'i rkyen yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi gtso bo'i rkyen yin zhe na /
translated: How is ignorance the principal condition of formations?

original: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las rnams 'du byed nyid yin par de'i dbang gis yin pa'i phyir dang / kun nas 'byung ba na yang spyi'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di lta ste rig pa de ma skyes na ni yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las rnams 'du byed nyid yin par de'i dbang gis yin pa'i phyir dang / kun nas 'byung ba na yang spyi'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro // 'di lta ste rig pa de ma skyes na ni yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Because karma, meritorious and so on, is a formation due to its power, and because it is the general condition of origination.🔽For example, if that ignorance does not arise, one does not form the new existence.

original: rig pa de skyes na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa de skyes na ni ma yin no //
translated: But if that ignorance arises, one does form the new existence.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kun nas 'byung ba na nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir spyi'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kun nas 'byung ba na nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir spyi'i rkyen yin no //
translated: When non-meritorious formative forces arise, it is a general condition because it is associated with all the defilements.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis kun nas bslang pa de bzhin du de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa rnams kyi yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis kun nas bslang pa de bzhin du de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa rnams kyi yang yin no //
translated: Just as all the defilements are aroused by the condition of nescience, so too are the volitions that are associated with it.

original: bsod nams kyi 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen yang yin te /🔽srid pa dang longs spyod tha dad pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa kun nas 'byung ba na yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ma rig @15b pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen yang yin te / srid pa dang longs spyod tha dad pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa kun nas 'byung ba na yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ma rig @15b pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin no //
translated: It is also a condition for meritorious formative forces.🔽When they arise in conformity with the attainment of different kinds of existence and enjoyments, the nescience that is associated with them is a general condition.

original: sa der nges par 'byung bar lta bas kun nas bslang ba mi g-yo ba rnams kyi yang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ma rig pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: sa der nges par 'byung bar lta bas kun nas bslang ba mi g-yo ba rnams kyi yang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ma rig pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin no //
translated: It is also a general condition for the unmoving formative forces that are aroused by the view of release in regard to that stage.

original: don de dag nyid tshigs su bcad de brjod pa /🔽'du byed rnams kyi rkyen nyid du //
analyzed: don de dag nyid tshigs su bcad de brjod pa / 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen nyid du //
translated: The meaning of these points is expressed in verse:🔽Conditioned by ignorance,

original: ma rig bstan pa rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: ma rig bstan pa rnam gnyis te //
translated: the two kinds of actions are taught.

original: nyon mongs gzhan ldan spyi yi rkyen //
analyzed: nyon mongs gzhan ldan spyi yi rkyen //
translated: The other afflictions are general conditions.

original: de med pa ni gtso bo'i rkyen //
analyzed: de med pa ni gtso bo'i rkyen //
translated: The absence of ignorance is the primary condition.

original: yan lag gi grangs rnam par gzhag pa rnam par nges par byed pa na /
analyzed: yan lag gi grangs rnam par gzhag pa rnam par nges par byed pa na /
translated: When the number of members is being determined,

original: don de dag nyid yang dgrol bar bya ste /
analyzed: don de dag nyid yang dgrol bar bya ste /
translated: these points should be explained.🔽Thus, the primary condition has been taught.

original: de ltar gtso bo'i rkyen bstan pa dang / gang kha cig 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ltar gtso bo'i rkyen bstan pa dang / gang kha cig 'di skad du /
translated: Some argue as follows:

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen nyon mongs pa gzhan yang yin bzhin du ci'i phyir ma rig pa kho na rkyen yin par bstan /🔽gal te de dag gi rkyen yang ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen nyon mongs pa gzhan yang yin bzhin du ci'i phyir ma rig pa kho na rkyen yin par bstan / gal te de dag gi rkyen yang ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since other afflictions are also conditions of the formations, why are only ignorance taught as a condition?🔽If they are conditions of those formations, why doesn’t the number of members increase?

original: yan lag lhag par ji ltar thal bar mi 'gyur zhes rgol ba 'di'i glags mi thod pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag lhag par ji ltar thal bar mi 'gyur zhes rgol ba 'di'i glags mi thod pa yin no //
translated: This is an unanswerable objection.

original: 'du byed kyi rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
translated: The analysis of the formations is complete.

original: // / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bshad pa //
analyzed: // / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bshad pa //
translated: 1. Dependent Origination and Its Analysis

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Chapter Two

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is consciousness, which has formations as its condition?🔽There are six collections of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs ni drug ste zhes bya ba 'di'i sgra ji bzhin gyi don gyi tshul gang yin pa'i don bshad na de ni re zhig rnam par nges pa dang bcas pa rgyas par bshad pa byas na shugs kyis phyis dgongs pa'i don de kho na
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs ni drug ste zhes bya ba 'di'i sgra ji bzhin gyi don gyi tshul gang yin pa'i don bshad na de ni re zhig rnam par nges pa dang bcas pa rgyas par bshad pa byas na shugs kyis phyis dgongs pa'i don de kho na
translated: If the meaning of this statement is explained according to the literal sense, then that meaning is first ascertained and explained in detail.

original: nyid legs par khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid legs par khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, the intended meaning is understood implicitly.

original: de la yang dbang po'i dbye bas rnam par shes pa'i rab tu dbye ba bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyis /
analyzed: de la yang dbang po'i dbye bas rnam par shes pa'i rab tu dbye ba bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan gyis /
translated: Therein, the Blessed One taught the analysis of consciousness according to the analysis of the sense faculties,

original: gdul bya gnas pa'i bye brag la ltos na ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gdul bya gnas pa'i bye brag la ltos na ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but not according to its intrinsic nature, considering the distinctions in the disciples' abodes.

original: 'di lta ste kha cig tu ni rnam par dbye ba yang mi ston no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste kha cig tu ni rnam par dbye ba yang mi ston no //
translated: For example, in some places the analysis is not taught.

original: tshogs kyi sgras ni dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i dbye ba yang bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgras ni dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i dbye ba yang bstan pa yin te /
translated: The term “aggregate” also indicates the division of the entry into the object.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa re re yang rnam pa mang bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa re re yang rnam pa mang bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is taught that each of the eye consciousnesses, etc., has many aspects.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par shes ba drug ces de tsam zhig gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par shes ba drug ces de tsam zhig gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, he would have said simply “the six consciousnesses.”

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs zhes rnam par bshad pa ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs zhes rnam par bshad pa ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
translated: Why is it not said that the eye consciousness aggregate, etc., are the eye consciousness collection, etc.?

original: tshogs kyi sgra'i don byas zin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa las gzhan tshogs zhes bya ba med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽mig gi rnam par shes pa yang @16a * //
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgra'i don byas zin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa las gzhan tshogs zhes bya ba med par bstan pa'i phyir ro // mig gi rnam par shes pa yang @16a * //
translated: Because the meaning of the term “collection” is already fulfilled, and because it is taught that there is nothing called a “collection” apart from consciousness.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is eye consciousness?

original: mig la brten cing gzugs so sor rnam par rig pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig la brten cing gzugs so sor rnam par rig pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is that which, based on the eye, discerns visible form.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the other consciousnesses up to the mental consciousness, as is appropriate.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa so sor rnam par rig pa rnam par shes pa yin na ci'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bstan gyi /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa so sor rnam par rig pa rnam par shes pa yin na ci'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bstan gyi /
translated: If consciousness is the individual perception of form and so on, why is it taught as eye consciousness?🔽

original: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin /
translated: If consciousness is the individual perception of form, etc., why is it called eye consciousness and not form consciousness?

original: de bzhin du chos kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du ma yin zhe na /
translated: And why is it called up to and including mind consciousness and not dharma consciousness?

original: mig la sogs ba ni gcig kho nar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir dang / thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽thun mong gi rgyu zhes bya ba ni mig ni sngon po la sogs pa gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs ba ni gcig kho nar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir dang / thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // thun mong gi rgyu zhes bya ba ni mig ni sngon po la sogs pa gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye, etc., are called the dominant condition because they are counted as one of the sentient beings, and because they are the specific and general causes.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ni rgyud gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ni rgyud gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The specific cause is the cause of the consciousness of a single continuum.🔽The general cause is the cause of all consciousnesses of form, such as blue, etc.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi bar du ci rigs par brjod bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi bar du ci rigs par brjod bar bya'o //
translated: The same is true of the mental faculty up to and including the object.

original: mdo gzhan las /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las /
translated: Another sūtra says:

original: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Consciousness arises in dependence on two.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: mig dang gzugs nas yid dang chos zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs nas yid dang chos zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: The eye and forms, up to the mind and mental objects.

original: yang gzhan las ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: yang gzhan las ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: Again, in another sutra it is said: “Conditioned by name-and-form is consciousness.

original: gang cung zad rnam par shes pa'i phung po de thams cad ni ming dang gzugs la brten nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang cung zad rnam par shes pa'i phung po de thams cad ni ming dang gzugs la brten nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: Whatever is the aggregate of consciousness, all that is based on name-and-form.

original: yang gzhan las 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa gang gi phyir mig nang gi skye mched yongs su ma nyams shing gzugs phyi'i skye mched snang bar gyur /
analyzed: yang gzhan las 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa gang gi phyir mig nang gi skye mched yongs su ma nyams shing gzugs phyi'i skye mched snang bar gyur /
translated: ” Again, in another sutra it is said: “Venerable Śāriputra, when the internal sense base of the eye is undamaged and external forms appear,

original: de bskyed pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas na de las skyes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bskyed pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas na de las skyes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: if the attention that produces them is present, then the visual consciousness that arises from them will arise.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: ” In the same way, the other consciousnesses should be explained as appropriate.

original: mdo sde 'di las ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs na snga phyi 'gal bar ji lta mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs na snga phyi 'gal bar ji lta mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If this sutra states that the condition of formation is the cause of consciousness, how could it not contradict the former statement?

original: dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because their intentions are different.

original: dbang po dang don nges pas rnam par shes pa drug skye ba nges pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po dang don nges pas rnam par shes pa drug skye ba nges pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the six consciousnesses definitely arise due to the certainty of the sense faculties and objects, it is said that consciousness arises in dependence on two.

original: de lta bu'i don de dag nyid tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i don de dag nyid tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
translated: These meanings are stated in verse:

original: lnga po gnyis ni dbang po rnams //🔽gang gi don @16b ni de dag nyid //
analyzed: lnga po gnyis ni dbang po rnams // gang gi don @16b ni de dag nyid //
translated: The five pairs are the sense faculties.🔽Their objects are just those.

original: gang de nyid ni don de nyid //
analyzed: gang de nyid ni don de nyid //
translated: Just that is the object itself.

original: drug pa'i skye mched gnyis yin no //
analyzed: drug pa'i skye mched gnyis yin no //
translated: The sixth is the two bases.

original: yid la byed pa ni rigs mi dbye bar thams cad kyi spyi'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni rigs mi dbye bar thams cad kyi spyi'i rkyen yin te /
translated: Attention is the general condition of all, without differentiating types.

original: dbang po dang don yod du zin kyang de skyed 'di brtag pa yin la byed pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bstan pa'i ched du yid la byed pa'i rkyen kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po dang don yod du zin kyang de skyed 'di brtag pa yin la byed pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bstan pa'i ched du yid la byed pa'i rkyen kyang gsungs so //
translated: The condition of attention is stated in order to demonstrate that.

original: de bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis de skyed par byed pa ni skyed pa ste /
analyzed: de bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis de skyed par byed pa ni skyed pa ste /
translated: The term “generating” is a verbal form in the sense of “that which generates.”

original: mdo sde gzhan las ji skad du ;
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las ji skad du ;
translated: As it is said in another sūtra:

original: de grong du song yong rung dgon par sang yang rung ste /
analyzed: de grong du song yong rung dgon par sang yang rung ste /
translated: “Whether he goes to the village or returns to the forest,

original: de nyid kyis sdig pa ni mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa mang du kun tu 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni phyis yid la gcags pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis sdig pa ni mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa mang du kun tu 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni phyis yid la gcags pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will later regret the many nonvirtuous thoughts that arose because of that.”

original: yang na de'i ched du skyes pa ni de skyed pa zhes rgyu mtshan nyid bdun pa yin pa'i phyir te /🔽lpags pa'i phyir ni gzig bsad do //🔽bso'i phyir ni glang po bsad /
analyzed: yang na de'i ched du skyes pa ni de skyed pa zhes rgyu mtshan nyid bdun pa yin pa'i phyir te / lpags pa'i phyir ni gzig bsad do // bso'i phyir ni glang po bsad /
translated: Or, “generating” means “generated for that purpose,” because it is a seventh case tatpuruṣa compound.🔽For the sake of leather, cows are killed.🔽For the sake of meat, oxen are killed.

original: rnga ma'i phyir ni g-yag bsad do //
analyzed: rnga ma'i phyir ni g-yag bsad do //
translated: For the sake of wool, sheep are killed.

original: bud med phyir ni byi pho bsad //🔽ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bud med phyir ni byi pho bsad // ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For the sake of a woman, a male cat is killed.

original: de skyed pa yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de skyed pa yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mental attention that produces?

original: gang mi mthun pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang mi mthun pa med pa yin te /
translated: It is the absence of incompatibility.

original: dper na gnyid log pa dang ra ro ba dang yid gzhan du chags pa'i tshe de las gzhan gnyis tshogs pa yod du zin kyang de'i rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: dper na gnyid log pa dang ra ro ba dang yid gzhan du chags pa'i tshe de las gzhan gnyis tshogs pa yod du zin kyang de'i rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa mi skye ste /
translated: For example, when one is asleep, intoxicated, or distracted, consciousness does not arise from the other two conditions, even though they are present,

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i yid la byed pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i yid la byed pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mental attention that is incompatible with it occurs.

original: phyis yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: phyis yang 'byung ste /
translated: It does occur later,

original: de dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is free from that incompatibility.

original: dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa de dag nyid bsdus pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa de dag nyid bsdus pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said that consciousness has the name-and-form that includes the sense faculties, objects, and mental attention as its condition.

original: yang srid pa 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir nus pa skye bar bya ba'i ched du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yang srid pa 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir nus pa skye bar bya ba'i ched du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: He said that the formations have consciousness as their condition in order to produce the ability to generate a new existence.

original: dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa de dag nyid kyi rkyen gyis skad cig re re la skye ba'i rnam par shes pa yin yang 'du byed med par yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i ched du nus pa 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa de dag nyid kyi rkyen gyis skad cig re re la skye ba'i rnam par shes pa yin yang 'du byed med par yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i ched du nus pa 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Even though consciousness arises in each moment due to the conditions of faculties, objects, and attention, the potential to actualize rebirth does not occur without karmic formation.

original: de'i stobs kyi mthus nus pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyi mthus nus pa yin te /
translated: However, the potential does occur through the power of that.

original: dper na rgya skyegs kyi khu ba dmar po bi dza pu ra ka'i me tog la bsgos pa ni ge sar dmar por 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir nus pa 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na rgya skyegs kyi khu ba dmar po bi dza pu ra ka'i me tog la bsgos pa ni ge sar dmar por 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir nus pa 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: For example, the red color of the lac dye that is applied to the flower of the bījapūraka plant occurs as the red stamen.🔽The potential to produce that color does not occur without the flower.

original: de med par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni dpe'o //
analyzed: de med par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni dpe'o //
translated: This is the example.

original: de ltar na dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir @17a * //
analyzed: de ltar na dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir @17a * //
translated: Thus, because their intentions are different,

original: snga phyi 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: snga phyi 'gal ba med do //
translated: there is no contradiction between the earlier and later statements.

original: gal te 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las ma 'ongs pa na ming dang gzugs 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las ma 'ongs pa na ming dang gzugs 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If name-and-form arises in the future due to the cause of consciousness that is infused by karmic formation,

original: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa rnam par shes pa rgyun chad pa la 'du byed de yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa rnam par shes pa rgyun chad pa la 'du byed de yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: How can the consciousness impregnated with the formative forces exist in the attainment of non-perception and in the state of non-perceptive beings, since the continuum of consciousness is interrupted in these states?

original: gang las ma 'ongs pa na ming dang gzugs skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang las ma 'ongs pa na ming dang gzugs skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: From what can the future name-and-form arise?

original: de'i gnas skabs gang yin pa na ni sems yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs gang yin pa na ni sems yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For, in the state of the attainment of cessation, the mind does not exist.

original: zhes bsams pa de skyon de dag yod do zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bsams pa de skyon de dag yod do zhe na /
translated: If you think that this is so, then the following fault arises.

original: mdo sde las 'gog ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas par gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo sde las 'gog ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang bcas par gsungs te /
translated: The Sūtra teaches that the attainment of cessation is associated with mind,

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni lus kyi 'du byed ma 'gags pa yin zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa lus dang ma bral ba yin no zhes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni lus kyi 'du byed ma 'gags pa yin zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa lus dang ma bral ba yin no zhes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that one who has entered the attainment of cessation is not one in whom bodily formative forces have ceased, and so on up to: consciousness is not separated from the body.

original: de bas na lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du rnam par shes pa rgyun 'chad pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du rnam par shes pa rgyun 'chad pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, until one has attained nirvāṇa without remainder, the continuum of consciousness is not interrupted.

original: / de'i tshe yod par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: / de'i tshe yod par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the consciousness that is accepted as existing at that time?

original: kha cig na re yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Some say: It is the mental consciousness.

original: dmigs pa ci yin rnam pa ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa ci yin rnam pa ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is its object? What is its aspect?

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is said: Its object and aspect are not determined.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / gsum 'dus pa las reg pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang 'du shes zhes ma gsungs sam /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / gsum 'dus pa las reg pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang 'du shes zhes ma gsungs sam /
translated: But didn't the Bhagavān say that the mental consciousness arises in dependence on the mental faculty and mental objects, that contact occurs from the union of the three, and that feeling and conceptualization occur with contact as their condition?

original: de'i tshe gsum 'dus pa med par yid kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar yod //
analyzed: de'i tshe gsum 'dus pa med par yid kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar yod //
translated: How can the mental consciousness exist at that time without the union of the three?

original: 'dus pa yod na yang reg pa med pa ji ltar rung /
analyzed: 'dus pa yod na yang reg pa med pa ji ltar rung /
translated: Even if the union exists, how can there be no contact?

original: reg pa yod na yang tshor ba dang 'du shes med par ji ltar rung /
analyzed: reg pa yod na yang tshor ba dang 'du shes med par ji ltar rung /
translated: Even if contact exists, how can there be no feeling and conceptualization?

original: gang gi phyir 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the cessation of conceptualization and feeling?

original: re zhig tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs /
analyzed: re zhig tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs /
translated: How does the Lord say that craving has feeling as its condition?

original: tshor ba thams cad sred pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad sred pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: Not all feelings are the condition for craving.

original: brag pa zad pa rnams la sred pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brag pa zad pa rnams la sred pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because craving does not arise for those who have exhausted their feelings.

original: de bzhin du reg pa thams cad tshor ba la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pa thams cad tshor ba la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: In the same way, not all contact is the condition for feeling, etc.

original: mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa 'byung ngo zhes bye brag tu byas kyi /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa 'byung ngo zhes bye brag tu byas kyi /
translated: In another sutra, the Lord specifies that craving arises in dependence on feeling that is born from contact with ignorance.

original: reg pa ni gang du yang bye brag tu byas pa med do //
analyzed: reg pa ni gang du yang bye brag tu byas pa med do //
translated: But he does not specify contact anywhere.

original: dgra bcom pa'i sred pa ni rtsa ba nas gcod @17b pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sred pa ni rtsa ba nas gcod @17b pa yin gyi /
translated: The craving of an arhat is cut off at the root,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang tshor ba gnyis ni ma yin pas dpe dang don du 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang tshor ba gnyis ni ma yin pas dpe dang don du 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: but not the two, ideation and feeling, of one who has entered the absorption of cessation. Therefore, they are not similar as the example and the meaning.

original: gzhan na re nus pa tshogs pa ni 'dus pa yin na gsum de ni 'du shes dang tshor ba bskyed par bya ba'i ched du nus pa 'dus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan na re nus pa tshogs pa ni 'dus pa yin na gsum de ni 'du shes dang tshor ba bskyed par bya ba'i ched du nus pa 'dus pa ma yin no //
translated: Another says: The collection of potentialities is a coming together. But these three are not a coming together of potentialities in order to generate a discernment and a feeling.

original: de sun 'byin bas de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sun 'byin bas de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they refute that, they are eliminated.

original: de bas na 'di ni reg pa ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni reg pa ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, this is not contact.

original: 'o na de'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba 'am /
analyzed: 'o na de'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba 'am /
translated: Now, it must be stated what kind of mental consciousness is present, whether virtuous,🔽afflicted,

original: nyon mongs pa can nam /🔽lung du ma bstan pa'am /🔽ci 'dra ba zhig yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can nam / lung du ma bstan pa'am / ci 'dra ba zhig yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: or neutral.

original: ci nyes gal te dge ba yin na dge ba'i rtsa ba med par ji ltar dge ba yin /
analyzed: ci nyes gal te dge ba yin na dge ba'i rtsa ba med par ji ltar dge ba yin /
translated: What is wrong with that? If it is virtuous, how can it be virtuous without roots of virtue?

original: de dag kyang reg pa med pa ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang reg pa med pa ji ltar yin te /
translated: And how can they be without contact?

original: dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phongs pa'i phyir gal te dge ba yin na ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phongs pa'i phyir gal te dge ba yin na ni mi rung ste /
translated: If it is virtuous, it is not tenable that it is virtuous because it is projected by the condition of the immediately preceding virtuous mind.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su sems rnam pa gsum skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su sems rnam pa gsum skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because three types of mind arise immediately after a virtuous mind and so on.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyis 'phongs te sems dge ba'i ngo bo yin na yang de zlog par byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyis 'phongs te sems dge ba'i ngo bo yin na yang de zlog par byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the power of the root of good is strong, and even though the mind is of the nature of good, there is no cause for its being turned back.

original: mi dge ba yang de dag thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba yang de dag thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The same would hold for the non-defined.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'gog pa bzhin du dge ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'gog pa bzhin du dge ba nyid yin no //
translated: The attainment of cessation is good, like cessation itself.

original: nyon mongs pa can yin na nyon mongs pa med par ji ltar nyon mongs pa can yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yin na nyon mongs pa med par ji ltar nyon mongs pa can yin /
translated: If it were defiled, how could it be defiled without defilement?

original: de dag kyang reg pa med par ji ltar 'gyur de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshor ba'i phung po gang yin pa dang 'du shes kyi phung po dang 'du byed kyi phung po cung zad gang yin pa de thams cad ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis yin
analyzed: de dag kyang reg pa med par ji ltar 'gyur de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshor ba'i phung po gang yin pa dang 'du shes kyi phung po dang 'du byed kyi phung po cung zad gang yin pa de thams cad ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis yin
translated: And how could these be without contact? The Blessed One has said: “Whatever the aggregate of sensation, whatever the aggregate of ideation, whatever the aggregate of formations, all that is conditioned by contact.

original: no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: lung du ma bstan pa yin na ni lud du ma bstan pa'i sems bzhir 'dod de /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yin na ni lud du ma bstan pa'i sems bzhir 'dod de /
translated: If it is non-defined, it is the four non-defined minds.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / spyod lam dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / spyod lam dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa pa'o //
translated: The first is the mind arisen from the ripening cause, the second is the mind of deportment, the third is the mind of skill in arts and crafts, and the fourth is the mind of emanation.

original: re zhig de rnam par smin pa las byung ba yin par ni mi rigs te /🔽'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sems ni /
analyzed: re zhig de rnam par smin pa las byung ba yin par ni mi rigs te / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sems ni /
translated: First, it is not logical that the mind of emanation arises from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems kyi mjug thogs pa yin par mi rigs te /🔽sa 'og ma gzhan bdun gyis bar du chod pa'i phyir ro //🔽srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sems ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems kyi mjug thogs pa yin par mi rigs te / sa 'og ma gzhan bdun gyis bar du chod pa'i phyir ro // srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sems ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i yin par mi rigs so //
translated: The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.

analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las ni 'dod pa'i khams su rnam par smin par byed pa ma yin no //🔽@18a * // rnam par smin pa yin na ni 'ga' yang ci dgar byar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause.🔽The mind of emanation is not the mind arisen from the ripening cause because the

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa po rnams ni ci dgar byar yod pa yang yin pas rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa po rnams ni ci dgar byar yod pa yang yin pas rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin par mi rigs so //
translated: And it is not tenable that it arises from karmic maturation, because those who enter meditative attainment can do whatever they want.

original: spyod lam la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin te ;
analyzed: spyod lam la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin te ;
translated: It is also not the nature of conduct and so on,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams ni spyod lam la sogs pa mngon par 'du byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams ni spyod lam la sogs pa mngon par 'du byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for those who enter meditative attainment of cessation to manifest conduct and so on.

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa de yang reg pa med par ji ltar rung /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa de yang reg pa med par ji ltar rung /
translated: And how could that mental formation occur without contact?

original: gal te yang de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa gzhan zhig yin par rnam par rtog par byed na /
analyzed: gal te yang de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa gzhan zhig yin par rnam par rtog par byed na /
translated: If you imagine that at that time there is another neutral mental consciousness,

original: sems las su rung zhing sems mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa dag ji ltar de ltar dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i g-yeng ba byed par 'gyur te lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon du gyur par 'dod pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las su rung zhing sems mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa dag ji ltar de ltar dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i g-yeng ba byed par 'gyur te lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon du gyur par 'dod pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then how could those with pliable minds abiding in signless concentration be distracted by objects and aspects, because you do not assert that a neutral mind manifests.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: The Bhagavån also says, Having completely transcended the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon du byas te /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon du byas te /
translated: he abides in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: gnas so zhes gsungs te 'di ni gnas pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas so zhes gsungs te 'di ni gnas pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the complete transcendence of abiding,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba las yang dag par 'das ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba las yang dag par 'das ba ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the complete transcendence of freedom from attachment,

original: lus kyis mngon du byed pa rnams la de med par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyis mngon du byed pa rnams la de med par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the case that those who abide in the body do not have it.

original: de bas na 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la rnam pa thams cad du yid kyi rnam par shes pa mngon du gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la rnam pa thams cad du yid kyi rnam par shes pa mngon du gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who enter the meditative attainment of cessation do not have manifest mental consciousness in any way.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa //🔽srid rtse'i mtshan nyid 'du shes med //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa // srid rtse'i mtshan nyid 'du shes med //
translated: Here there is a verse:

original: 'du shes med pa min nyid 'dod //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa min nyid 'dod //
translated: The summit of existence is characterized by neither perception nor non-perception.🔽It is asserted that it is not non-perception.

original: 'gog la de yi sa sems med //
analyzed: 'gog la de yi sa sems med //
translated: In cessation, there is no mind of that level.

original: des na de ni gzhan zhig yin //
analyzed: des na de ni gzhan zhig yin //
translated: Therefore, it is something else.

original: gzhan dag na re 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems med pa can kho na yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems med pa can kho na yin no zhes zer na /
translated: Others say: The meditative attainment of cessation is only mindless.

original: 'o na sems rgyun chad pa yin na yang 'du byed kyis bsgos pa'i sems ci ltar 'byung zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'o na sems rgyun chad pa yin na yang 'du byed kyis bsgos pa'i sems ci ltar 'byung zhes zer na /
translated: If the mind is severed, how could a mind that is imbued with formative forces arise?

original: kha cig na re sems las de 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig na re sems las de 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Some say: It does not arise from the mind.

original: sems kyis yongs su bsgos pa nyid ni lus kyi dbang po'i rgyun las yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: sems kyis yongs su bsgos pa nyid ni lus kyi dbang po'i rgyun las yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: It arises from the continuum of the body sense faculty that is imbued by the mind.🔽How does this not contradict the sutra that declares:

original: yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mdo sde 'di dang ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i mdo sde 'di dang ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: The mental consciousness arises in dependence on the mental faculty and phenomena?

original: yid kyi bag chags la yang yid ces lan @18b 'ga' brjod de /
analyzed: yid kyi bag chags la yang yid ces lan @18b 'ga' brjod de /
translated: The mental faculty is sometimes called the latent tendencies of the mind.

original: ji ltar las kyi bag chags la yang las zhes bya ba dang / gang gi tshe las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes zer ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar las kyi bag chags la yang las zhes bya ba dang / gang gi tshe las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes zer ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Just as formative forces are called karma and the maturation of karma is called the result of karma.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'di la yid kyi rnam par smin pa'i sa bon rgyud gnyis la yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'di la yid kyi rnam par smin pa'i sa bon rgyud gnyis la yod par 'gyur te /
translated: In this theory, the seed of the maturation of the mental faculty would exist in two continuities.

original: gcig ni sems kyi rgyun las bsgos pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni sems kyi rgyun las bsgos pa'o //
translated: One is infused in the continuity of the mind.

original: gcig ni lus kyi rgyun la'o //
analyzed: gcig ni lus kyi rgyun la'o //
translated: The other is infused in the continuity of the body.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore two mental consciousnesses would occur simultaneously.

original: ci'i phyir gang gcig las 'byung ba de'i tshe cig shos ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang gcig las 'byung ba de'i tshe cig shos ma yin /
translated: Why is it that when one occurs, the other does not?

original: gal te yang rnam par shes pa la yin pa de bzhin du lus kyi dbang po la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis bsgos par gyur na ni de la yang bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par
analyzed: gal te yang rnam par shes pa la yin pa de bzhin du lus kyi dbang po la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis bsgos par gyur na ni de la yang bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par
translated: If the body faculty is infused by minds and mental factors in the same way that consciousness is, then it too would be infused by the formative factors of merit and so on.

original: shes pa nyi tshe la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: shes pa nyi tshe la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro /
translated: Therefore it would be incorrect to say that consciousness alone is the condition for the formative factors.

original: rnam par shes pa nyi tshe rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs kyang ma yin gyi lus kyi dbang po yang de la mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyi tshe rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs kyang ma yin gyi lus kyi dbang po yang de la mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The name-and-form is not only the consciousness, but also the body sense-faculty, because it has power over the body.

original: gzhan dag na re 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ni ma'i mngal du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ni ma'i mngal du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: According to another opinion, the condition of the formations is the consciousness that enters the mother’s womb,

original: las ji lta ba bzhin du tshe gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las ji lta ba bzhin du tshe gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the consciousness that is projected into another life by action.

original: de ltar ni rgyu'i rnam grangs chen po las kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du ma zhugs na 'on kyang de'i ming dang gzugs nur nur por brgyal bar 'gyur ram zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni rgyu'i rnam grangs chen po las kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du ma zhugs na 'on kyang de'i ming dang gzugs nur nur por brgyal bar 'gyur ram zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: In the great enumeration of the causes, the Fortunate One says: “If the consciousness does not descend into the mother’s womb, would name-and-form coagulate in the womb?”

original: rnam par rtog pa 'di la yang mdo sde dang 'gal ba dang rigs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'di la yang mdo sde dang 'gal ba dang rigs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This conception is in contradiction with the Sūtra and with logical reasoning.

original: ji ltar mdo sde dang 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde dang 'gal zhe na /
translated: How is it in contradiction with the Sūtra?

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i yan lag ces rnam par dbye ba las ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ces gsungs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i yan lag ces rnam par dbye ba las ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ces gsungs la /
translated: In the same way, the member called consciousness is the sixfold collection of consciousnesses.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na nyid nying mtshams sbyor gyi drug gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na nyid nying mtshams sbyor gyi drug gis ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is only the mental consciousness that is the appropriator of action, not the six consciousnesses.

original: kha cig na re 'gal pa med de mdo sde 'di las ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa rnam par dbye ba'i zla la rnam par shes pa mtha' dag rnam par phye'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'gal pa med de mdo sde 'di las ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa rnam par dbye ba'i zla la rnam par shes pa mtha' dag rnam par phye'o //
translated: Some say that there is no contradiction, because in this Sutra the Blessed One, in the section on the analysis of consciousness, analyzes all the consciousnesses.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ni ji ltar rigs par te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ni ji ltar rigs par te /
translated: The condition of the formations is the mental consciousness, as is appropriate.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba yin par rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba yin par rigs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the mental consciousness is the appropriator of action.🔽For example, in the analysis of name-and-form, the Sutra says:

original: dper na ming dang gzugs rnam par dbye ba las gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: dper na ming dang gzugs rnam par dbye ba las gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is form?

original: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: Any form whatsoever, whether past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or refined, far or near.

original: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o @19a * //
analyzed: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o @19a * //
translated: All of that is to be viewed as it really is with correct wisdom in this way: “This is only the four great elements” or “This is only form derived from the four great elements.”

original: zhes gzugs mtha' dag 'dir rnam par phye yang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs rnam par 'jog pa na ji snyed yod pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gzugs mtha' dag 'dir rnam par phye yang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs rnam par 'jog pa na ji snyed yod pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that form is classified here, but name and form are posited as conditions of consciousness when all that exists is classified,

original: gnas skabs de na gzugs gang yin pa de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang de dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes de ltar bstan pa ni rig pa yin gyis /
analyzed: gnas skabs de na gzugs gang yin pa de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang de dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes de ltar bstan pa ni rig pa yin gyis /
translated: then you should understand that the statement “Whatever form exists at that time, all of it is the four great elements and what is derived from them” is a teaching.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ma yin pas /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ma yin pas /
translated: The consciousness that links with the next life is not the sixfold collection of consciousness.

original: 'di chos 'dra ba ci yod /
analyzed: 'di chos 'dra ba ci yod /
translated: What is the similarity between this and that?

original: 'dir ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa bstan pa brtsams pa yin pas zla la ci'i phyir bya /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa bstan pa brtsams pa yin pas zla la ci'i phyir bya /
translated: Here the statement “Conditioned by formations, consciousness arises” is the beginning of the teaching, so why do you bring up the moon?

original: gzhan dag na re de las gzhan pa bstan ba yang skye mched drug gi bar du las kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de las gzhan pa bstan ba yang skye mched drug gi bar du las kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Others say that the teaching of what is other than that is the teaching that the six sense bases are engaged by karma.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug smos pa ming dang gzugs tsam gyi rkyen yin na ni skye mched drug gi tshe 'ga' yang long ba 'am 'on par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug smos pa ming dang gzugs tsam gyi rkyen yin na ni skye mched drug gi tshe 'ga' yang long ba 'am 'on par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the condition of mere name-and-form is the six sense-spheres, then no one would ever be blind or deaf.

original: de smos pa don med de /
analyzed: de smos pa don med de /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de smos pa med par yang las kyi bye brag gis rnam par shes pa bye brag tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de smos pa med par yang las kyi bye brag gis rnam par shes pa bye brag tu 'gyur /
translated: The sense-spheres are distinguished by the distinctions in consciousness, which are due to the distinctions in karma.

original: de las ming dang gzugs bye brag tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de las ming dang gzugs bye brag tu 'gyur /
translated: Name-and-form are distinguished by the distinctions in consciousness.

original: de las skye mched drug gi bye brag go zhes rnam par rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las skye mched drug gi bye brag go zhes rnam par rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six sense-spheres are distinguished by the distinctions in name-and-form.

original: gal te de'i bye brag gis de bye brag tu mi 'gyur na ni ji ltar yang snga ma ni phyi ma'i rkyen du 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de'i bye brag gis de bye brag tu mi 'gyur na ni ji ltar yang snga ma ni phyi ma'i rkyen du 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the distinctions in the latter were not due to the distinctions in the former, then the former would not be the condition of the latter.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du ma zhugs na zhes gsungs pa de dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du ma zhugs na zhes gsungs pa de dpyad par bya ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Ananda, if consciousness does not enter the mother’s womb,” and so on.

original: re zhig mngal du ma zhugs na zhes bya ba 'di'i don ji lta bu /
analyzed: re zhig mngal du ma zhugs na zhes bya ba 'di'i don ji lta bu /
translated: What is the meaning of the phrase “does not enter the mother’s womb”?

original: gal te 'di'i don mi 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di'i don mi 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the meaning of this is that it does not enter,

original: skye bar nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ma'i mngal du 'jug par rig pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skye bar nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ma'i mngal du 'jug par rig pa ma yin gyi /
translated: then it is not the consciousness that links with birth that enters the mother's womb.🔽Rather, it is the consciousness fully infused by karmic formation that enters the mother's womb through the continuum of the intermediate existence, because it is related to that.

original: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa ni srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis ma'i mngal du 'jug pa yin par rigs te de dang 'brel ba'i phyir khrag dang khu ba 'dus pa na ming dang gzugs su rnam par smin pa ni kun tu brgyal🔽ba yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa ni srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis ma'i mngal du 'jug pa yin par rigs te de dang 'brel ba'i phyir khrag dang khu ba 'dus pa na ming dang gzugs su rnam par smin pa ni kun tu brgyal ba yin te /
translated: When blood and semen mix, name and form fully swoon,

original: gang las nur nur por rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gang las nur nur por rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: and it is posited as an arbuda.

original: 'on te 'di'i don ma'i mngal du mi skye ba yin na ni de'i tshe ming dang gzugs skyes pa kho na yin pas de'i rkyen gyis de skye bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'on te 'di'i don ma'i mngal du mi skye ba yin na ni de'i tshe ming dang gzugs skyes pa kho na yin pas de'i rkyen gyis de skye bar mi rigs so //
translated: If the meaning of this is that it does not arise in the mother's womb, then at that time name and form have already arisen, so it is illogical that it arises due to their condition.

original: de las kyang nam ma shi'i bar du rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis dngos por bstan pas de ji ltar nying mtshams @19b sbyor ba'i rnam par shes par rung /
analyzed: de las kyang nam ma shi'i bar du rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis dngos por bstan pas de ji ltar nying mtshams @19b sbyor ba'i rnam par shes par rung /
translated: Moreover, since the condition of name and form is taught to be the entity of consciousness until death, how could it be the linking consciousness?

original: mdo sde 'di las /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las /
translated: In this sutra,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis phung po lnga pa'i ming dang gzugs bstan pas nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa de ji ltar de dang lhan cig byung ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du rung /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis phung po lnga pa'i ming dang gzugs bstan pas nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa de ji ltar de dang lhan cig byung ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du rung /
translated: the name and form of the five aggregates is taught to be the condition of consciousness, so how could that linking consciousness be the condition of the name and form that arises simultaneously with it?

original: dus phyi ma'i rkyen yin no zhe na yang /
analyzed: dus phyi ma'i rkyen yin no zhe na yang /
translated: If you say that it is a condition of the future,

original: 'o na de'i dus kyi ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gang yin /
analyzed: 'o na de'i dus kyi ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gang yin /
translated: then what is the condition of the name and form of that time?

original: rkyen 'du byed yin no zhe na yang /
analyzed: rkyen 'du byed yin no zhe na yang /
translated: If you say that it is the condition of karmic formation,

original: de gnyis ka'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ci'i rnam par shes pa'i yan lag brtag par bya /
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ci'i rnam par shes pa'i yan lag brtag par bya /
translated: then why is it not the consciousness link?

original: ming dang gzugs kho na'i rkyen 'du byed ma yin te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kho na'i rkyen 'du byed ma yin te /
translated: Karmic formation is not the condition of just name and form.

original: de dang skad cig ma phyi ma dang khyad par yang ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de dang skad cig ma phyi ma dang khyad par yang ci zhig yod /
translated: What difference is there between it and the subsequent moment?

original: gzhan dag na re 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes brjod na gzugs med par nying mtshams sbyor ba bstan par 'gyur te de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes brjod na gzugs med par nying mtshams sbyor ba bstan par 'gyur te de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Others say: If it is said that name-and-form has the condition of formation, then it would be taught that one is conceived in the formless realm, because there is no form there.

original: 'o na lta rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs kyang brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: 'o na lta rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs kyang brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur te ;
translated: Well then, it would not be said that name-and-form has the condition of consciousness,

original: gzugs med pa na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no form in the formless realm.

original: 'on te 'dir ji ltar srid pa'i rkyen gyis dngos por 'dod na ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis kyang de bzhin du ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te 'dir ji ltar srid pa'i rkyen gyis dngos por 'dod na ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis kyang de bzhin du ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: But if you assert that the condition of existence is a thing, then why not assert that the condition of formation is also like that?

original: de ltar re zhig mdo sde dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mdo sde dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it contradicts the sutras.

original: ji ltar rigs pa dang 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa dang 'gal zhe na /
translated: How does it contradict reasoning?

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yin na ni 'das pa'i 'du byed kyis rnam par shes pa bskyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
