analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yin na ni 'das pa'i 'du byed kyis rnam par shes pa bskyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the consciousness that is the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the consciousness that is the reincarnating consciousness, then it follows that the formations give rise to the consciousness of the immediately past life.

original: ci nyes she na /
analyzed: ci nyes she na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: bya gag shi nas skad 'byin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya gag shi nas skad 'byin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that a dead crow would caw.

original: tshig 'di'i don ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: tshig 'di'i don ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this statement?

original: rgyu rnam par zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu rnam par zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that an effect does not arise from a cause that has perished.

original: kha cig na re rgyu zhig pa las kyang 'bras bu 'byung ba yod de /
analyzed: kha cig na re rgyu zhig pa las kyang 'bras bu 'byung ba yod de /
translated: Some say: An effect arises from a cause that has perished,

original: dper na ma du lung ga'i 'bras bu skyur po las phyi ma skyur por 'gyur ba dang / ma du lung ga'i me tog la rgya skyegs kyi khu ba dmar po bsgos pa las de'i 'bras bu ge sar dmar ba nyid dang / lcags kyi thu lum bsregs pa dmar po mjug tu rnam par zhig pa'i rgyu can yang rtsa dmar pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na ma du lung ga'i 'bras bu skyur po las phyi ma skyur por 'gyur ba dang / ma du lung ga'i me tog la rgya skyegs kyi khu ba dmar po bsgos pa las de'i 'bras bu ge sar dmar ba nyid dang / lcags kyi thu lum bsregs pa dmar po mjug tu rnam par zhig pa'i rgyu can yang rtsa dmar pa yin no zhe na /
translated: for example, the sour fruit of the madāḍaka tree arises from a sour seed, the red pericarp of the madāḍaka fruit arises from a madāḍaka flower that is smeared with red lac dye, and the red color of a burnt iron ball arises from the iron ball that has perished at the end of its burning.

original: 'di ni glo bur du nyam nga bar zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni glo bur du nyam nga bar zhugs pa yin no //
translated: This is a sudden and violent fear.

original: 'di la nyam nga ba ci yod ce na /🔽rgyu med pa la 'bras bu 'am /
analyzed: 'di la nyam nga ba ci yod ce na / rgyu med pa la 'bras bu 'am /
translated: What is there to fear?🔽The fear is that the effect will be without a cause,

original: rnam par zhig pa las yod par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par zhig pa las yod par rtog pa'o //
translated: or that it will exist without a cause.

original: skyur ba de rnam par zhig pa las phyis skyur ba 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyur ba de rnam par zhig pa las phyis skyur ba 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: The sour taste does not arise later from the disintegration of the sour taste.

original: 'o na de gang las she na /
analyzed: 'o na de gang las she na /
translated: If not from that, then from what?

original: de las skyes pa'i mthu'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i rgyun yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag las so//
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i mthu'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i rgyun yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag las so//
translated: From the transformation of the continuum endowed with the particular power that arises from that.

original: @20a * // de dag gis ni dmar ba nyid dang / rtsa dmar ba nyid kyi lan kyang btab pa yin te /
analyzed: @20a * // de dag gis ni dmar ba nyid dang / rtsa dmar ba nyid kyi lan kyang btab pa yin te /
translated: They also respond to the question of why the blood is red and the veins are red.

original: phyis rtsa dmar ba rnam par zhig pa'i rgyu can skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phyis rtsa dmar ba rnam par zhig pa'i rgyu can skye ba ma yin no //
translated: The blood that arises later does not have the disintegration of the red blood as its cause.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If not that, then what?

original: de skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen btsal na rang bzhin gyis lcags kyi thu lum 'byung ba chen po de 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen btsal na rang bzhin gyis lcags kyi thu lum 'byung ba chen po de 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the conditions that are not compatible with its arising are sought, the great elements that are the nature of iron ore arise, because they are compatible with its arising.

original: 'di ji ltar mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar mngon zhe na /
translated: How is this known?

original: 'di ltar me shi ba ni sreg par mi byed do //🔽chu skam pa ni brlan par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar me shi ba ni sreg par mi byed do // chu skam pa ni brlan par mi byed do //
translated: Thus, when the fire is extinguished, it does not burn.🔽When the water dries up, it does not moisten.

original: rlung zhi ba ni skam par mi byed do //
analyzed: rlung zhi ba ni skam par mi byed do //
translated: When the wind subsides, it does not dry.

original: brdungs ba zhig pa yang sgra mi byed do //
analyzed: brdungs ba zhig pa yang sgra mi byed do //
translated: When the sound is broken, it does not resound.

original: dbang po dang don yang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang don yang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The sense faculty and the object are the consciousness.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa spangs pa yang srid do //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa spangs pa yang srid do //
translated: When action and affliction are abandoned, there is no rebirth.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: rnam zhig rgyu las 'bras 'byung na //
analyzed: rnam zhig rgyu las 'bras 'byung na //
translated: When the effect arises from the cause that has ceased,

original: dbang po la sogs rnam zhig las //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs rnam zhig las //
translated: From the cessation of the sense faculty and so on,

original: mthong ba la sogs 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Seeing and so on arise.

original: me yi du ba'ang zhi ba med //
analyzed: me yi du ba'ang zhi ba med //
translated: Smoke also does not arise from the cessation of fire.

original: gal te 'das pa'i las las 'bras bur mi 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa'i las las 'bras bur mi 'dod pa'am /
translated: If the effect is not accepted as arising from the past action,

original: de med pa yin ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du gang 'das pa'i las zhig pa 'gag pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa de yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de med pa yin ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du gang 'das pa'i las zhig pa 'gag pa bral ba yongs su gyur pa de yod pa yin no //
translated: or if that does not exist, why did the Blessed One say this: “That past action which has ceased, stopped, changed, that exists”?

original: de dang ldan pa med du zin na /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa med du zin na /
translated: If one does not possess that,

original: 'di na kha cig mtshams med pa byas na rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas de ma thag tu dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs /
analyzed: 'di na kha cig mtshams med pa byas na rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas de ma thag tu dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs /
translated: Some say: If one commits a heinous act, immediately after the body is destroyed, one is born in hell due to that cause and condition.

original: de yang da ltar 'byung ba bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid gnas pa la dgongs nas yod do zhes gsungs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang da ltar 'byung ba bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid gnas pa la dgongs nas yod do zhes gsungs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not stated with the intention that it exists in the present, but rather that it exists in terms of the intrinsic identity of the present.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how?

original: de las skyes pa dgos pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las skyes pa dgos pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the purpose of the continuum that arises from that exists.

original: des gzhag pa'i sems kyi rgyun la bsgos pa yod de /
analyzed: des gzhag pa'i sems kyi rgyun la bsgos pa yod de /
translated: The continuum of mind that is infused by that exists.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag tu gyur pa gang las 'bras bu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag tu gyur pa gang las 'bras bu 'byung ba'o //
translated: The specific transformation from which the effect arises exists.

original: de yod pa yang las kyi 'bras bu ma byin pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de yod pa yang las kyi 'bras bu ma byin pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: And because the effect of karma is not given, it is said to exist.

original: de las byung ba'i 'bras bu smin par nus pa ma spyad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'bras bu smin par nus pa ma spyad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect that arises from that exists, the effect is able to ripen.

original: de lta ma yin na de 'das pa nyid yin par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de 'das pa nyid yin par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, it would not be established as past.

original: 'di rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni phyi nas bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni phyi nas bya'o //
translated: The detailed explanation of this will be given later.

original: de ltar 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Thus, the consciousness that links with birth conditioned by formations

original: rig pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: rig pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: is incompatible with awareness.

original: kha cig na re 'das pa'i las las de skye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'das pa'i las las de skye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Some say: It does not arise from past karma because the continuum of karma is posited after cessation.

original: 'di ltar rgyun rnam par gzhag nas 'du byed 'gags la /🔽de dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu gcig tu 'phangs nas sa bon gyi rgyun bzhin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyun rnam par gzhag nas 'du byed 'gags la / de dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu gcig tu 'phangs nas sa bon gyi rgyun bzhin /
translated: Thus, after the continuum is posited, formations cease and

original: @20b du ; de las phyis rim gyis rnam par shes pa sa bon yang srid kyi zhing la skyed par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: @20b du ; de las phyis rim gyis rnam par shes pa sa bon yang srid kyi zhing la skyed par byed do zhe na /
translated: a single result compatible with that is projected and from that, later, consciousness gradually arises in the field of the seed of existence.

original: de'i bsam pa ni bdag gis ma rtogs na /🔽ci sems pa'i rgyun rnam par gzhag nas 'du byed 'gag gam /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ni bdag gis ma rtogs na / ci sems pa'i rgyun rnam par gzhag nas 'du byed 'gag gam /
translated: If one does not understand the meaning of this,

original: 'on te bag chags kyi rgyun sems kyi rgyun la rnam par gzhag nas yin /
analyzed: 'on te bag chags kyi rgyun sems kyi rgyun la rnam par gzhag nas yin /
translated: does the continuum of mind cease after the continuum of intention is posited or does the continuum of latent states cease after the continuum of mind is posited?

original: ci nyes gal te sems pa'i rgyun yin na ni /
analyzed: ci nyes gal te sems pa'i rgyun yin na ni /
translated: What is wrong with that? If the continuum of intention is posited,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa'i rgyun kyang de'i 'og tu 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems pa'i rgyun kyang de'i 'og tu 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Also, a continuum of neutral minds would arise after that.

original: ji ltar na de'i rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe rnam par shes pa yin par rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na de'i rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe rnam par shes pa yin par rigs par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be logical that consciousness at the time of rebirth is a condition of that?

original: ji ltar na yang 'di bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang 'di bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin /
translated: How could it be that this is posited as formation of merit and so on?

original: 'on te bag chags kyi rgyun sems la gzhag nas yin na ni de nyid la 'du byed rnams kyi nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te bag chags kyi rgyun sems la gzhag nas yin na ni de nyid la 'du byed rnams kyi nus pa yin gyi /
translated: But if it is posited in the mindstream of habitual propensities, then the potency of formations would be in that mindstream alone.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa la ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar na 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa rnam par shes pa de nyid 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis yin gyi /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa la ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro // de ltar na 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa rnam par shes pa de nyid 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis yin gyi /
translated: It would follow that it would not be in the consciousness at the time of rebirth.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus that consciousness fully infused by formations is the condition of formations, but the consciousness at the time of rebirth is not.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dus na ni yang srid pa mngon par grub pa kho na yin pas de'i tshe de gang gi sa bon yin na gang 'di skad du rnam par shes pa sa bon yang srid kyi zhing la skyed do zhes brjod /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dus na ni yang srid pa mngon par grub pa kho na yin pas de'i tshe de gang gi sa bon yin na gang 'di skad du rnam par shes pa sa bon yang srid kyi zhing la skyed do zhes brjod /
translated: At the time of the consciousness that links with the next birth, the next birth is already established, so at that time, what is the seed of that consciousness?

original: de bas na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yin par rigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yin par rigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not logical that the condition of the formations is the consciousness that links with the next birth.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed yin la /
translated: The condition of ignorance is the formations.

original: des bsgos pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis yin no //
analyzed: des bsgos pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis yin no //
translated: The consciousness that is imbued with the formations is the condition of the formations.🔽At the time of the condition of that consciousness linking with the next birth, it is name and form.

original: de'i rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe ming dang gzugs yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i lugs 'di ni skyon pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe ming dang gzugs yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i lugs 'di ni skyon pa yin no //
translated: This is the correct system.

original: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan las rnam par shes pa sa bon zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan las rnam par shes pa sa bon zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de rigs pa yin no //
translated: If this is the case, then the statement in another sutra that consciousness is the seed is logical.

original: yang gzhan dag na re 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yin par brjod kyang 'das pa'i las las de byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yin par brjod kyang 'das pa'i las las de byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Others say: The consciousness that links with the next life is conditioned by the karmic predispositions, but it does not arise from past karma.

original: 'on kyang kha cig na re de'i rgyu can rnam par ma zhig pa las yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang kha cig na re de'i rgyu can rnam par ma zhig pa las yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say: It arises from the non-disintegration of its cause.

original: kha cig na re bstsags pa las yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re bstsags pa las yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say: It arises from the accumulation of karma.

original: rnam par ma zhig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin /
analyzed: rnam par ma zhig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin /
translated: What is this non-disintegration?

original: bstsags pa yang ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: bstsags pa yang ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is this accumulation?

original: sems dang mi ldan pa'i chos gzhan nam 'bras bu byin pa'i bar du rjes su 'jug pa de yin zhes grags @21a * //
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa'i chos gzhan nam 'bras bu byin pa'i bar du rjes su 'jug pa de yin zhes grags @21a * //
translated: It is a phenomenon not associated with the mind that continues until the result is produced.

original: so ; / de las skyes pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis zhes ston to //
analyzed: so ; / de las skyes pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis zhes ston to //
translated: The consciousness that links with the next life, which arises from that, is taught as conditioned by the karmic predispositions.

original: des byas pa la de nye bar 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des byas pa la de nye bar 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: It is designated as that because it is produced by that.

original: dper na rkun pos grong khyer bsregs pa dang / rtsva sa 'bras chan tshos pa dang / 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde//
analyzed: dper na rkun pos grong khyer bsregs pa dang / rtsva sa 'bras chan tshos pa dang / 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde//
translated: For example, a town was burned by thieves,🔽grass and rice were cooked,🔽and the noble ones are pleasant to see.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a thief is said to burn a town, grass is said to cook rice, and the noble ones are said to be pleasant to see.

original: de dag gi yang mdo sde dang 'gal ba de kho na bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi yang mdo sde dang 'gal ba de kho na bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
translated: And their statements are contradicted by the sutras.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'du byed kyi phung po gang ji snyed pa 'di thams cad reg pa la brten nas zhes gsungs kyang thob pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'du byed kyi phung po gang ji snyed pa 'di thams cad reg pa la brten nas zhes gsungs kyang thob pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān also says, “Whatever the aggregates of compositional activity are, all of them are based on contact,” but he does not say that they are based on obtainment and so on.

original: sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rdzas su yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rdzas su yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Nonassociated compositional factors do not substantially exist.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa'i gnas skabs gzhan la brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa'i gnas skabs gzhan la brtags pa yin te /
translated: They are imputed to be different states of substantially existent form and so on.

original: dper na nus pa dang kun tu sbyor ba dang / rnam par phye ba dang pha rol nyid dang tshu rol nyid dang / rgyang ring ba dang thag nye ba nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nus pa dang kun tu sbyor ba dang / rnam par phye ba dang pha rol nyid dang tshu rol nyid dang / rgyang ring ba dang thag nye ba nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, they are like potency, connection, separation, farness, nearness, and so on.

original: de dag ji ltar rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa ni chos mngon pa'i mdzod las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa ni chos mngon pa'i mdzod las shes par bya'o //
translated: How they do not substantially exist should be understood from the Abhidharmakośa.

original: gang yang sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i mjug tu ldang ba'i sems skye ba dang / gang yang yi ge'i gzhung lan mang du bton pa'am don rtag tu mthong ba la sogs pa las phyir dran pa skye ba dang /
analyzed: gang yang sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i mjug tu ldang ba'i sems skye ba dang / gang yang yi ge'i gzhung lan mang du bton pa'am don rtag tu mthong ba la sogs pa las phyir dran pa skye ba dang /
translated: Also, when mind arises from mindless meditative attainment or from the end of the state of nondiscernment, when recollection arises from frequently reciting texts or always seeing meaning and so on,

original: gang yang rgya skyegs kyi khu bas ma du lung ga'i me tog la bsgos pa'i rgyun yongs su gyur pa la phyis 'bras bu ge sar dmar por skye ba de dag la ci sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos gzhan bar skabs su 'ga' yang yod dam
analyzed: gang yang rgya skyegs kyi khu bas ma du lung ga'i me tog la bsgos pa'i rgyun yongs su gyur pa la phyis 'bras bu ge sar dmar por skye ba de dag la ci sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos gzhan bar skabs su 'ga' yang yod dam
translated: and when the red stamen of a flower arises later from the transformation of the stream of madhuka flowers soaked in lac liquid, do any other phenomena that are not mind exist in the interim?

original: / gang goms pas dran pa skye bar 'gyur ba skad cig ma gang la de skye bar brtag bar byed /
analyzed: / gang goms pas dran pa skye bar 'gyur ba skad cig ma gang la de skye bar brtag bar byed /
translated: Also, when recollection arises through familiarity, on what instant is it imputed to arise?

original: de bas na 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin par khas len kyang rung /
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin par khas len kyang rung /
translated: Therefore, it is suitable to accept that the six collections of consciousness that are infused by formations are consciousness conditioned by formations.

original: sems dang bcas pa ba dang sems med pa pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa khas len kyang rung /
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa ba dang sems med pa pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa khas len kyang rung /
translated: It is also suitable to accept the meditative attainment of cessation that is accompanied by mind and that which is not.

original: 'das pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa khas len kyang rung /
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa khas len kyang rung /
translated: It is also suitable to accept that the consciousness that links to a rebirth is conditioned by past formations.

original: de'i rgyu can rnam par mi 'jig pa la sogs pa rkyen yin par khas len kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can rnam par mi 'jig pa la sogs pa rkyen yin par khas len kyang rung ste /
translated: It is also suitable to accept that the conditions for the non-disintegration of its cause and so on are conditions.

original: sgra'i don ji lta ba bzhin du drangs na don de bzhin du 'gror mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sgra'i don ji lta ba bzhin du drangs na don de bzhin du 'gror mi rung ngo //
translated: However, if one takes the meaning of the words literally, it is not suitable to accept the meaning in that way.

original: de bas na 'dir don nyid ni dgongs pa can yin @21b par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir don nyid ni dgongs pa can yin @21b par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here the meaning itself should be understood as having an underlying intent.

original: 'dir don nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir don nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning here?

original: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun yongs su gyur pas yang srid /
analyzed: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun yongs su gyur pas yang srid /
translated: The continuum of the consciousness of the store of impressions, which is infused by the formations, is transformed, and is able to produce a new existence.

original: 'byung bar nus pa ni 'dir 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin par dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar nus pa ni 'dir 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin par dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the condition of the formations is consciousness.

original: gang yang 'di skad du rnam par shes pa drug go zhes gsungs pa ni gnas pas gnas bstan pa dang 'bras bus rgyu ste de dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun 'bab pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du rnam par shes pa drug go zhes gsungs pa ni gnas pas gnas bstan pa dang 'bras bus rgyu ste de dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun 'bab pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the statement that there are six consciousnesses is made in terms of the teaching of the basis by the basis and the teaching of the cause by the result, in order to show the stream of consciousness that possesses those six.

original: gnas pas gnas bstan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gnas pas gnas bstan pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also the teaching of the basis by the basis.🔽For example, in the Udayana Sūtra, it says:

original: dper na 'char ka'i mdo las btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyi sku ni rnying pa dang gnyer ma can dang ; dbang po rnams ni gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dper na 'char ka'i mdo las btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyi sku ni rnying pa dang gnyer ma can dang ; dbang po rnams ni gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin te /
translated: “Venerable! The body of the Bhagavat is old and wrinkled, and his faculties have changed.

original: 'di lta ste mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du bstan kyang de'i dbang po rnams ni gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar du bstan kyang de'i dbang po rnams ni gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin te /
translated: For example, his eye faculty and his body faculty have been shown to have changed.”

original: gzigs pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzigs pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the basis of the sense faculties.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression indriya?

original: dbang po rnams kyi gtan dang de'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi gtan dang de'i gnas yin no //
translated: The sense faculties are the basis of the controlling power and of the sense objects.

original: smra ba po'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: smra ba po'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra of the Explanations says,

original: de 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe dbang po rnams rnam par gsal ba yin no zhes gsungs kyang /
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe dbang po rnams rnam par gsal ba yin no zhes gsungs kyang /
translated: “At the moment of death, the sense faculties are clear.”

original: dbang po rnams gsal ba ni mthong bar yang mi nus kyi /
analyzed: dbang po rnams gsal ba ni mthong bar yang mi nus kyi /
translated: But it is not possible for the sense faculties to be clear when the body is decomposed;

original: de'i gnas dang dbang po'i rten la nus so //
analyzed: de'i gnas dang dbang po'i rten la nus so //
translated: but it is possible for the basis of the sense faculties to be clear.

original: 'jig rten na yang 'di'i mig ni nyams dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang 'di'i mig ni nyams dga' ba yin te /
translated: In the world, one says, “His eyes are pleasant,”

original: gdong gi mig ni autpa la sngon po'i 'dab ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba mthong ba dang mig gis de'i gnas bstan to //
analyzed: gdong gi mig ni autpa la sngon po'i 'dab ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba mthong ba dang mig gis de'i gnas bstan to //
translated: “The eyes on his face are like the petals of a blue lotus.”

original: 'bras bus kyang rgyu ston pa yod de /
analyzed: 'bras bus kyang rgyu ston pa yod de /
translated: The effect can also indicate the cause.

original: ji ltar mdo sde las dge slong dag rlung ni nad yin no //🔽nad chen po yin no zhes pa yang rlung ni nad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde las dge slong dag rlung ni nad yin no // nad chen po yin no zhes pa yang rlung ni nad ma yin gyi /
translated: The Sūtra says, “Monks, wind is a disease,🔽a great disease.”

original: nad kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nad kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: But wind is not a disease; it is the cause of disease.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las kyang 'dod chags ma lus rgyun bcad ces 'byung ba yang 'dod chags kyi rgyun nye bar bcad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las kyang 'dod chags ma lus rgyun bcad ces 'byung ba yang 'dod chags kyi rgyun nye bar bcad pa ma yin te /
translated: The verse also says that all attachment is severed, but this does not mean that the continuum of attachment is severed,

original: de mngon du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not manifest.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: rgyu dang de'i sa bon no //
analyzed: rgyu dang de'i sa bon no //
translated: It is the cause and its seed.

original: ji ltar chos mngon pa las 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag rgyur byas pa'i reg bya gang zhe na zhes rgyas par byas nas bkres pa dang / skom pa'i bar du 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar chos mngon pa las 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag rgyur byas pa'i reg bya gang zhe na zhes rgyas par byas nas bkres pa dang / skom pa'i bar du 'byung ba la /
translated: In the Abhidharma, the question is asked, “What is the tactile object derived from the four great elements?”

original: de gnyis ni reg bya ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de gnyis ni reg bya ma yin gyi /
translated: Hunger and thirst are not tactile objects,

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu reg bya yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu reg bya yin no //
translated: but they are the cause of tactile objects.

original: 'jig rten na yang shing sa bon 'debs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang shing sa bon 'debs so //
translated: In the world, people say, “I plant seeds,”

original: me tog sa bon 'debs so zhes pa de nyid sa bon du 'debs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: me tog sa bon 'debs so zhes pa de nyid sa bon du 'debs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: but they do not plant seeds in seeds,🔽but rather in the earth, water, etc.

original: 'o na ci zhe na de dag gi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na de dag gi rgyu yin te /
translated: that are the causes of seeds.

original: @22a * // brten pa'i ming rten la ston pa dang / 'bras bus rgyu yin no //
analyzed: @22a * // brten pa'i ming rten la ston pa dang / 'bras bus rgyu yin no //
translated: The name of the support is figuratively designated to the supported, and the effect is designated to the cause.

original: ci'i phyir 'di kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is this called the storehouse consciousness?

original: chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the basis of the seeds of all dharmas.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te /🔽ris mthun pa gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te / ris mthun pa gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba nas brtsams te /
translated: It is also the appropriating consciousness,🔽because it has held the body since the beginning of the present rebirth,

original: nam ma shi ba'i bar du des lus bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam ma shi ba'i bar du des lus bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and it will continue to do so until the end of that rebirth.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te /
translated: It is also the consciousness that evolves as retribution,

original: skye ba so so ni las tha dad pa'i rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba so so ni las tha dad pa'i rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the retribution of different actions is experienced in different rebirths.

original: las de dang des bsgos pa de ni las tha dad pa'i shugs yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang / las gzhan goms pa'i 'jug pa rnyed pa'i phyir lus kyi dngos po de dang / de'i gnas nyid du rnam par smin to //
analyzed: las de dang des bsgos pa de ni las tha dad pa'i shugs yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang / las gzhan goms pa'i 'jug pa rnyed pa'i phyir lus kyi dngos po de dang / de'i gnas nyid du rnam par smin to //
translated: That consciousness is perfumed by those actions, and the retribution of those actions is experienced in the body of that rebirth, in that place, because the force of the retribution of those different actions is exhausted, and because the force of the habit energy of other actions is obtained.

original: nam mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du re zhig 'di rgyun chad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du re zhig 'di rgyun chad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Until one enters nirvāṇa, it is not interrupted.

original: btsun pas ston pa rnams kyi srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa yang de yin te /
analyzed: btsun pas ston pa rnams kyi srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa yang de yin te /
translated: The consciousness that is a member of cyclic existence of the venerable is also that.

original: de gnas yongs su ma gyur na srid pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnas yongs su ma gyur na srid pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the basis is not transformed, existence is not severed.

original: 'o na de'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is its object and aspect?

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o //
translated: It has an object and aspect that are not fully ascertained.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po gang gi nang du 'dus she na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po gang gi nang du 'dus she na /
translated: In which appropriated aggregate is it included?

original: rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung por ro //🔽'o na 'di ni rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo las rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung por ro // 'o na 'di ni rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo las rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: It is included in the appropriated aggregate of consciousness.🔽Well then, it would be untenable to state in the sutra Unraveling the Intention:🔽“What is the appropriated aggregate of consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes 'byung ba mi 'thad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes 'byung ba mi 'thad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It is the six collections of consciousness.”

original: yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa yin te /🔽ji ltar 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa yin te / ji ltar 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: It is taught in an incomplete way.🔽Just as it says, “What is the appropriated aggregate of mental formations?

original: sems pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is the six collections of volition.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi las mi dge ba dang / ngag gi las mi dge ba dang / yid kyi las mi dge ba yin no zhes bstan pa de ni dgongs pa can yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi las mi dge ba dang / ngag gi las mi dge ba dang / yid kyi las mi dge ba yin no zhes bstan pa de ni dgongs pa can yin te /
translated: The statement in the sutra that the venerable one of great belly, Pūrṇa, said that unwholesome means unwholesome physical, verbal, and mental karma is interpretable in meaning.

original: sems pa ni 'du byed gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems pa ni 'du byed gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because intention is the principal formative force.

original: las kyi rang gi ngo bo mi dge ba yin par 'di las gsungs par bzhed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: las kyi rang gi ngo bo mi dge ba yin par 'di las gsungs par bzhed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: This is because it is asserted that this sutra teaches that the nature of karma is unwholesome.

original: /'di yang dgongs pa can yin te /
analyzed: /'di yang dgongs pa can yin te /
translated: This is also interpretable in meaning.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa chad pa dang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par shes pa dag 'di la brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa chad pa dang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par shes pa dag 'di la brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is asserted that this sutra teaches that the consciousnesses of those who have severed the wholesome roots are virtuous, unwholesome, and neutral.

original: de ni dgongs pa can rigs te /
analyzed: de ni dgongs pa can rigs te /
translated: This is reasonable because it is interpretable in meaning.

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos de dag rnams mdo sde gzhan las gsungs @22b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos de dag rnams mdo sde gzhan las gsungs @22b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because other phenomena are mentioned in other sūtras.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gang dag tu yang ma gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gang dag tu yang ma gsungs so zhe na /
translated: But the foundation consciousness is not mentioned anywhere.

original: zhal nas gsungs pa phal cher nub la /
analyzed: zhal nas gsungs pa phal cher nub la /
translated: Most of what he said has disappeared.🔽And this scripture also was not taught anywhere, because the spread of this scripture and the root of beings has now mostly disappeared.

original: gsung rab 'di yang da ltar ni phal cher 'phros pa dang / 'gro ba'i rtsa ba dag nub pa'i phyir gang du yang ma gsungs so zhes ji ltar nges par bya dgongs te gsungs pa yin du zin kyang rigs pas kyang rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: gsung rab 'di yang da ltar ni phal cher 'phros pa dang / 'gro ba'i rtsa ba dag nub pa'i phyir gang du yang ma gsungs so zhes ji ltar nges par bya dgongs te gsungs pa yin du zin kyang rigs pas kyang rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Even though it is said to be a statement of intention, it should be understood through reasoning.

original: gdon mi za bar ma gsungs pa yin no zhes ma gsungs pa kho na dgag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar ma gsungs pa yin no zhes ma gsungs pa kho na dgag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to negate only the statement that it was not taught, saying that it was definitely not taught.

original: da 'dir rigs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med pa 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa gzhag par mi nus pa dang / lus zin pa nyid kyang de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nam ma shi'i bar du lus mtha' dag khyab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: da 'dir rigs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med pa 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa gzhag par mi nus pa dang / lus zin pa nyid kyang de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nam ma shi'i bar du lus mtha' dag khyab pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the reasoning is that without foundation consciousness, it is impossible to posit consciousness conditioned by karmic formations, and even the appropriation of a body is not pervaded by a consciousness other than that, as long as the entire body is not dead.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba dang zag pa med pa'i sems la ni de'i 'gro bas bsdus pa rnam par smin pa'i rdzas gzhan gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba dang zag pa med pa'i sems la ni de'i 'gro bas bsdus pa rnam par smin pa'i rdzas gzhan gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: The afflicted, virtuous, and uncontaminated minds of those born in the formless realm cannot be posited as substances that are the maturational results of their own reincarnating beings.

original: srid pa'i rtse mor 'phags pa'i lam dang ldan pa rnams la de'i sa pa'i lus kyi dngos po'i rdzas gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mor 'phags pa'i lam dang ldan pa rnams la de'i sa pa'i lus kyi dngos po'i rdzas gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: The substance of the body of the level of the summit of existence cannot be posited as the substance of the ārya path.

original: de'i sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The ārya path of that level does not exist.🔽A sūtra states:

original: mdo sde las kyang 'gog pa'i snyom par zhugs pa ni lus kyi 'du byed ma 'gags pa yin zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs las ma 'das pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs na /
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang 'gog pa'i snyom par zhugs pa ni lus kyi 'du byed ma 'gags pa yin zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs las ma 'das pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs na /
translated: One who enters the meditative attainment of cessation has not stopped the formative factors of the body and has not transcended the collection of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ma 'das pa de gang zhig yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma 'das pa de gang zhig yin /
translated: What is the consciousness that has not been transcended?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Mental consciousness.

original: yang phyogs de sngar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: yang phyogs de sngar dpyad zin to //
translated: This position has already been analyzed.

original: lus las ma 'das pa'o zhes bya ba 'di'i don re zhig gang yin /
analyzed: lus las ma 'das pa'o zhes bya ba 'di'i don re zhig gang yin /
translated: The meaning of the statement “it is not beyond the body” is that it is not separate from the body.

original: ma bral ba dang ma shi ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma bral ba dang ma shi ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “not separate” is that it is not dead.

original: lus de las de 'gags su zin kyang yang 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir lus las ma bral bar brjod do zhes ci ste de ltar mi 'dod /
analyzed: lus de las de 'gags su zin kyang yang 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir lus las ma bral bar brjod do zhes ci ste de ltar mi 'dod /
translated: Even though the body has ceased to exist, it is said to be not separate from the body because it arises again. Why do you not accept this?

original: gal te 'gags na gang las yang 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gags na gang las yang 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it has ceased, from what would it arise again?

original: phyogs de yang sngar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: phyogs de yang sngar dpyad zin to //
translated: This point has already been examined.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa de ni gzhan zhig yin par gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa de ni gzhan zhig yin par gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it must be accepted that consciousness is something else.

original: de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya ste de dag ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya ste de dag ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: That is the foundation consciousness. This is the reasoning.

original: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las kyang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de ni de nyid yin par bstan to //🔽rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / @23a * //
analyzed: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las kyang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de ni de nyid yin par bstan to //🔽rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / @23a * //
translated: In the first chapter of the Analysis of Phenomena and Reality, it says, “The condition of the karmic predispositions that gives rise to consciousness is the foundation consciousness.”🔽The Levels of Yogic Deeds and the Compendium of the Mahāyāna say that the foundation consciousness is the support for the imprints of the actions of sentient beings.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las kyang tshig so sor brjod do //
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las kyang tshig so sor brjod do //
translated: The Samdhinirmocana also uses the term in the same way.

original: btsun pas ston pa'i chos mngon pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las de nyid brjod do //
analyzed: btsun pas ston pa'i chos mngon pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las de nyid brjod do //
translated: The Bhadanta, in the Abhidharma treatise, uses the term in the same way.

original: de ltar na rigs pa dang / mdo sde dang bstan bcos las kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rigs pa dang / mdo sde dang bstan bcos las kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin par grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the alaya-vijnana is established by reason, by the Sutras, and by the treatises.

original: de yang srid pa mngon par grub par bya ba'i phyir ji srid du 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i nus pas khyad par can skye ba de srid du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang srid pa mngon par grub par bya ba'i phyir ji srid du 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i nus pas khyad par can skye ba de srid du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And, in order to establish existence, as long as the special power of the perfuming of the samskaras is born, it is called vijnana with the condition of samskaras.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa gang gi bar du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa gang gi bar du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Until what point is it established as vijnana with the condition of samskaras?

original: srid pa'i gnas skabs la thug gi bar du'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i gnas skabs la thug gi bar du'o //
translated: Until the point of the state of existence.

original: 'o na rgyu chen po chos kyi rnam grangs las nam ma shi'i bar du rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'o na rgyu chen po chos kyi rnam grangs las nam ma shi'i bar du rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen nyid du bstan to //
translated: But in the Maha-Nidana-Sutra, it is taught that until the end of life, vijnana is the condition of name-and-form.

original: kun dga' bo khye'u 'am bu mo'i rnam par shes pa gal te rgyu de rnam par zhig par gyur na de'i ming dang gzugs rgyas shing 'phel ba dang yangs par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo zhe na de ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa
analyzed: kun dga' bo khye'u 'am bu mo'i rnam par shes pa gal te rgyu de rnam par zhig par gyur na de'i ming dang gzugs rgyas shing 'phel ba dang yangs par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo zhe na de ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa
translated: Ananda, if the consciousness of a boy or girl were to cease, name and form would not increase and grow.

original: la dgongs te gsungs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: la dgongs te gsungs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not stated with respect to consciousness being a condition of formation,

original: de'i 'bras bu ming dang gzugs skyes pa na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i ming dang gzugs rnams rgyun gyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ming dang gzugs skyes pa na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i ming dang gzugs rnams rgyun gyis 'jug ste /
translated: but rather when name and form, which are its effects, arise, the consciousness that is the maturational result and name and form other than that continue in a stream.

original: nam ma shi'i bar du gcig la gcig bstan pa'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir gcig la gcig rkyen nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: nam ma shi'i bar du gcig la gcig bstan pa'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir gcig la gcig rkyen nyid du bstan to //
translated: Until death, they continue in a stream that supports each other and they are taught to be conditions of each other.

original: mdo sde 'di las kyang 'du shes kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa na de'i 'bras bu ming dang gzugs ma byung ba 'byung ba'i rkyen du dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las kyang 'du shes kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa na de'i 'bras bu ming dang gzugs ma byung ba 'byung ba'i rkyen du dgongs pa ste /
translated: This sutra also states that consciousness conditioned by discrimination is the condition for the future arising of name and form, which are its effects.

original: de ci tsam 'brel pa'i bar du de rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ci tsam 'brel pa'i bar du de rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is established as long as there is a connection.

original: ming dang gzugs ni skye mched drug la thug gi par du yin gyi /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni skye mched drug la thug gi par du yin gyi /
translated: Name and form are up to the six sense bases.

original: de phan chad ma yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad ma yin no //
translated: It is not beyond that.

original: ming dang gzugs de skyed nas kyang de la yod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni tshe snga ma'i las kyis 'phangs pa ma 'ongs pa'i tshe gzhan gyi ming dang gzugs de skye bar bya ba'i phyir rgyu'i dngos por gnas zer ba ni 'du byed
analyzed: ming dang gzugs de skyed nas kyang de la yod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni tshe snga ma'i las kyis 'phangs pa ma 'ongs pa'i tshe gzhan gyi ming dang gzugs de skye bar bya ba'i phyir rgyu'i dngos por gnas zer ba ni 'du byed
translated: Having produced that name and form, the fruitional consciousness that exists there, projected by karma from a previous life, remains as the cause for the production of future other name and form.

original: kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'i yan lag yin par rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'i yan lag yin par rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: This is established as the link of consciousness conditioned by karmic formation.

original: des byas pa 'di skye bar nus pa ni ma spyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des byas pa 'di skye bar nus pa ni ma spyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is able to produce this, it is not exhausted.

original: de ltar na 'du byed shin tu mang pos yongs su bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'du byed shin tu mang pos yongs su bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is the foundation consciousness that is completely infused by many karmic formations.

original: ming dang gzugs gang la de 'phen par byed pa'i 'du byed kyis @23b bsgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir nus pa ma spyad pa yin te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs gang la de 'phen par byed pa'i 'du byed kyis @23b bsgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir nus pa ma spyad pa yin te /
translated: Name-and-form is the potential for the existence of the embryo, because it is impregnated by the formative forces that project the embryo.

original: de'i don du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'i yan lag rnam bar gzhag gi gang du nus pa spyad zin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'i yan lag rnam bar gzhag gi gang du nus pa spyad zin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The link of consciousness is established as a condition for name-and-form in order to demonstrate that the potential for the existence of the embryo is not yet active.

original: de ltar na sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, the maturation of sentient beings’ karma is inconceivable.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa bar ma pa'i ming dang gzugs rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa bar ma pa'i ming dang gzugs rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is the existence of name-and-form in the intermediate state not established as a condition for consciousness?

original: 'du byed rnams ni skye ba'i dbang du byas te rab tu 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir dang / der yang rnam par smin pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni skye ba'i dbang du byas te rab tu 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir dang / der yang rnam par smin pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the formative forces are active in relation to birth and because the maturation of karma is not yet complete.

original: 'dir yang rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa gnyis la skyon yod de /
analyzed: 'dir yang rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa gnyis la skyon yod de /
translated: Here, there is a fault in the two certainties and two uncertainties of the condition and the possession of the condition.

original: gal te 'du byed kho na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin na ni gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ba dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'du byed kho na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin na ni gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ba dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If only formations were the condition of consciousness, then that would contradict the sutra that states, “Consciousness is in dependence on name-and-form,” and the sutra that states, “Consciousness is a condition for name-and-form.”

original: 'on te 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa kho na na yin na ni //🔽bsod nams rnams kyi rnam smin bde ba yin //
analyzed: 'on te 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa kho na na yin na ni // bsod nams rnams kyi rnam smin bde ba yin //
translated: If only consciousness were the condition of formations,🔽then that would contradict the verse that states, “The ripening of merit is happiness,”

original: zhes 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / las gzhan gyi ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / las gzhan gyi ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would not be the immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, or the dominant condition.

original: gnyis ka nges na skyon rnam pa gnyis po de dag yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka nges na skyon rnam pa gnyis po de dag yin no //
translated: If both were definite, then there would be the two errors.

original: ma nges na ni 'chad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma nges na ni 'chad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they are indefinite, then it is pointless to explain them.

original: ma nges kyang nyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges kyang nyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if they are indefinite, there is no error,

original: gtso bo'i rkyen 'chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rkyen 'chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it explains the principal condition.

original: yang srid kyi sa bon can rnam par shes pa skyed pa la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang srid kyi sa bon can rnam par shes pa skyed pa la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and the consciousness that is the seed of rebirth is the principal condition of karmic formation because

original: las kyi bye brag gis de'i nus pa'i bye brag skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi bye brag gis de'i nus pa'i bye brag skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the specific power of karma generates the specific power of consciousness.

original: rten cing 'bral par 'byung ba bshad pa las rnam par shes pa rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rten cing 'bral par 'byung ba bshad pa las rnam par shes pa rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the analysis of consciousness in the explanation of dependent origination.

original: // / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming gang zhe na /
translated: What is name-and-form?

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste /
translated: The four non-material aggregates.

original: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is form?

original: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste thams cad ces rgyas par 'byung ba de dag ni phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste thams cad ces rgyas par 'byung ba de dag ni phung po lnga ste /
translated: Whatever is form is all the four great elements and whatever is derived from the four great elements.

original: nur nur po dang / nar nar po dang / gor gor po dang / mkhrang por gyur pa dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs nas skye mched drug ma dod pa'i @24a * //
analyzed: nur nur po dang / nar nar po dang / gor gor po dang / mkhrang por gyur pa dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs nas skye mched drug ma dod pa'i @24a * //
translated: These are the five aggregates: the kalala stage, the arbuda stage, the peśin stage, the ghana stage, the praśākhā stage, and the six sense bases.

original: bar du ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bar du ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: In the middle period, there is name-and-form conditioned by consciousness.

original: 'di ltar des bsgos pa'i bye brag gis ris mthun pa gzhan du de bye brag can du 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar des bsgos pa'i bye brag gis ris mthun pa gzhan du de bye brag can du 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: For, by the influence of that, the other homogeneous collections of components are established as having that as their specific nature.

original: de la bde ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Among them, feeling is the experience of the three kinds of objects that are agreeable, disagreeable, and neither.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa ni 'du shes so //
translated: Ideation is the grasping of the sign of the object.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba dang / sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba dang / sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa ni 'du byed do //
translated: The formative forces are those things other than these, and those associated with thought but not the same as thought.

original: yul nye bar dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yul nye bar dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the perception of the object.

original: de la kha cig na re cung zad shes pa ni rnam par shes pa de cung zad zos pa bzhin no //🔽mi bzang ba'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re cung zad shes pa ni rnam par shes pa de cung zad zos pa bzhin no // mi bzang ba'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Some say that consciousness is so called because it is aware of a little, like a little food.

original: gzugs ngan pa bzhin no //🔽shes pa'i las nus pa med pa'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ngan pa bzhin no // shes pa'i las nus pa med pa'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Some say that consciousness is so called because it is aware of what is not good, like an ugly form.

original: sems g-yengs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa bzhin no //
translated: Some say that consciousness is so called because it is aware of the powerless object, like a deranged mind.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Incomplete knowledge is consciousness.

original: yan lag ma tshang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag ma tshang ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a limb that is incomplete.

original: mi gsal ba'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Unclear knowledge is consciousness.

original: kha zas ma zhu ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: kha zas ma zhu ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: It is like food that is not digested.

original: de ltar 'dod na ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i bye brag kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod na ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i bye brag kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept this, then what is called consciousness would be a specific type of knowledge.

original: shes pa dang rnam par shes pa gnyis mtshungs par ldan par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang rnam par shes pa gnyis mtshungs par ldan par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Knowledge and consciousness would not be associated.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i chos kyang 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i chos kyang 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The factor called knowledge would not be included in the aggregate of formations.

original: de lta bu ni grub pa'i mtha' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni grub pa'i mtha' yang ma yin no //
translated: This is not the philosophical position.

original: de bas na shes pa las rnam par shes pa rigs gzhan yin te /
analyzed: de bas na shes pa las rnam par shes pa rigs gzhan yin te /
translated: Therefore, consciousness is a different type than knowledge.

original: dper na bre las gzhal med khang dang / mu tig gi chun po las gtsug lag khang lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bre las gzhal med khang dang / mu tig gi chun po las gtsug lag khang lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a house being a different type than a bushel, or a monastery being a different type than a string of pearls.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams te /
translated: The four great elements are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: sra ba dang gsher ba dang / dro ba dang g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sra ba dang gsher ba dang / dro ba dang g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Their characteristics are solidity, liquidity, heat, and motion.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni mig dang / rna ba dang sna dang / lce dang lus kyi dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni mig dang / rna ba dang sna dang / lce dang lus kyi dbang po rnams so //
translated: Derived form is the faculties of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: de'i yul la gzugs dang / sgra dang dri dang ro dang 'byung ba chen po ma rtog pa'i reg bya'o ;
analyzed: de'i yul la gzugs dang / sgra dang dri dang ro dang 'byung ba chen po ma rtog pa'i reg bya'o ;
translated: Their objects are form, sound, smell, taste, and the part of the tangible that is the great elements.

original: / yid kyi yul ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: / yid kyi yul ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: The object of the mental faculty is noninformative form.

original: 'dir ni lus kyi dbang po dang gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang ro dang reg bya'i phyogs gcig yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni lus kyi dbang po dang gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang ro dang reg bya'i phyogs gcig yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the body faculty, form, sound, smell, taste, and part of the tangible should be understood as the form aggregate.

original: gzugs 'di dag dang snga ma'i ming gcig tu mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: gzugs 'di dag dang snga ma'i ming gcig tu mdor bsdus te /
translated: These forms and the previous one are combined into one aggregate.

original: gnyis gcig nyid du ston na ni gzhan du tshig sbyor ba'i rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis gcig nyid du ston na ni gzhan du tshig sbyor ba'i rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they were taught as two, then the idea that the words refer to something else would be eliminated.

original: skyes pa'i skad cig @24b ma phyi ma rnams ni ming dang gzugs nyid kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs ma yin nam /
analyzed: skyes pa'i skad cig @24b ma phyi ma rnams ni ming dang gzugs nyid kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs ma yin nam /
translated: But aren’t the subsequent moments of birth the condition of name and form?

original: ji ltar de dag rnam par shas pa'i rkyen gyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag rnam par shas pa'i rkyen gyis yin zhe na /
translated: How are they the condition of consciousness?

original: rang gi rigs skad cig ma gzhan yan lag gi rkyen gyi dngos por ni 'dir brjod par bzhed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi rigs skad cig ma gzhan yan lag gi rkyen gyi dngos por ni 'dir brjod par bzhed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here the Vaibhāṣikas do not assert that the other moments of its type are the condition of the substantial entity of its parts,

original: khyad par can gyi rdzas gzhan gyi dngos por brjod par bzhed pa yin pas dang por skye ba nyid kyi rkyen yin par bstan gyi /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rdzas gzhan gyi dngos por brjod par bzhed pa yin pas dang por skye ba nyid kyi rkyen yin par bstan gyi /
translated: but they assert that they are the condition of the substantial entity of its special qualities. Therefore they teach that the first moment of birth is the condition of name and form,

original: skyes pa'i rgyun gyi rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rgyun gyi rkyen ma yin no //
translated: but they do not assert that it is the condition of the continuum of birth.

original: de lta ma yin na ma rig pa yang ma rig pa'i rkyen yin par brjod par bya dgos par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin par brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ma rig pa yang ma rig pa'i rkyen yin par brjod par bya dgos par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin par brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, it would follow that ignorance would be the condition of ignorance and consciousness would be the condition of consciousness.

original: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i skad cig ma dang po ni 'og ma'i rkyen yin par brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i skad cig ma dang po ni 'og ma'i rkyen yin par brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: The first moment, impregnated by the formative forces, should be described as the condition of the lower.

original: ji ltar thog mar nur nur por 'dug go //🔽nur nur po las nar nar por skye'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thog mar nur nur por 'dug go // nur nur po las nar nar por skye'o //
translated: How is that? First, there is the kalala.🔽From the kalala, the arbuda arises.

original: nar nar po las gor gor por skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽gor gor po las mkhrang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nar nar po las gor gor por skye bar 'gyur ro // gor gor po las mkhrang por 'gyur ro //
translated: From the arbuda, the peśin arises.🔽From the peśin, the ghana arises.

original: mkhrang po las rkang lag skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mkhrang po las rkang lag skye bar 'gyur /
translated: From the ghana, the praśākhā arises.

original: skra dang spu dang sen mo la sogs pa 'byung yang /
analyzed: skra dang spu dang sen mo la sogs pa 'byung yang /
translated: From the praśākhā, hair, body hair, nails, etc. arise.

original: 'dir nur nur po la sogs pa rnams nur nur po la sogs pa'i rkyen nyid yin par mi brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir nur nur po la sogs pa rnams nur nur po la sogs pa'i rkyen nyid yin par mi brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rigs par bya'o //
translated: Just as the kalala, etc. are not described as the condition of the kalala, etc., so it is here.

original: ci'i phyir yang phung po bzhi la ming zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang phung po bzhi la ming zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are the four aggregates called name?

original: 'gyur bas na ming zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'gyur bas na ming zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they change, they are called name.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang rab tu dbye ba'i bye brag gis rgyun mi 'chad par de'i rgyun yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang rab tu dbye ba'i bye brag gis rgyun mi 'chad par de'i rgyun yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their continuum is transformed without interruption through the differences of objective support, aspect and differentiation.

original: shi ste gzugs kyi lus bor nas skye ba gzhan gyi dngos por de'i rgyun yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shi ste gzugs kyi lus bor nas skye ba gzhan gyi dngos por de'i rgyun yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one dies, the body is abandoned and the continuum of the aggregates is transformed into another existence.🔽As the Mahaparinirvana-sutra says:

original: ji skad du ming chen gyi mdo sde las zhes bya ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du ming chen gyi mdo sde las zhes bya ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Where does the name go?”

original: 'o na gang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed tshig bla dags ming zhes bstan pa gzugs zhes bya ba dang / sgra zhes bya ba de la sogs pa de dag don gang gis yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed tshig bla dags ming zhes bstan pa gzugs zhes bya ba dang / sgra zhes bya ba de la sogs pa de dag don gang gis yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term “form” and the terms “sound,” etc., which refer to the formations that are not associated with mind?

original: de dag ji skad du bstan pa 'di 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa gzhan bskal pa rnams la yang ming gis 'dud par byed pas ming zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ji skad du bstan pa 'di 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa gzhan bskal pa rnams la yang ming gis 'dud par byed pas ming zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “name” because they are the names that bend the mind to the objects of past and future time, even though the eons may be infinite.

original: mig gi yul ni gzugs zhes bya ba 'jig rten na grags na /
analyzed: mig gi yul ni gzugs zhes bya ba 'jig rten na grags na /
translated: The world is familiar with the term “form” as the object of the eye.

original: 'dir 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa thams cad la ci'i phyir gzugs zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa thams cad la ci'i phyir gzugs zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the term “form” applied to everything that is derived from the elements and to the elements themselves?

original: gnod par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod par gyur pa yin te /
translated: Because they are subject to being struck.

original: de bas na gzugs zhes mdo sde @25a * //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs zhes mdo sde @25a * //
translated: Thus, the Sūtra teaches that form is suffering.

original: gzhan las bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan las bstan te /
translated: In another Sūtra,

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gnod par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gnod par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said: “That which is called form is that which is subject to being injured.

original: ji skad du lha'i tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du lha'i tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: ” As the gods say in verse:

original: nad pa gnyid ni ga la yod //
analyzed: nad pa gnyid ni ga la yod //
translated: How can the sick have sleep?

original: zug rngus zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: zug rngus zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur /
translated: They are injured like one who is pierced by an arrow.

original: zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar yang phran tshogs las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar yang phran tshogs las /
translated: And as the Saṃyukta Āgama says:

original: 'dod pa skyed pa'i lus can te //🔽gal te 'dod pa tshol byed pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa skyed pa'i lus can te // gal te 'dod pa tshol byed pa //
translated: Those who seek pleasure are embodied beings.🔽If those who seek pleasure

original: 'dod pa de dag ma grub na //🔽zug rngus zug pa bzhin du gnod //
analyzed: 'dod pa de dag ma grub na // zug rngus zug pa bzhin du gnod //
translated: do not obtain that pleasure,

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: they are injured like one who is pierced by an arrow.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa la cis gnod ce na /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa la cis gnod ce na /
translated: What injures the primary elements and the derivative form?

original: lag pa'i 'dus te reg pa la sogs pas gzhan du gyur par byas so //
analyzed: lag pa'i 'dus te reg pa la sogs pas gzhan du gyur par byas so //
translated: They are injured by the transformation of contact with the hand, etc.

original: gzugs na spyod pa dag la ji ltar gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa dag la ji ltar gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are those who experience the form realm injured?

original: de'i sa pa'i mes so //
analyzed: de'i sa pa'i mes so //
translated: They are injured by the fire of their own realm.

original: sems can gyi grangs su rtogs pa la de bzhin du nyid kyi mes so //
analyzed: sems can gyi grangs su rtogs pa la de bzhin du nyid kyi mes so //
translated: Those who are counted as sentient beings are injured by the fire of their own realm.

original: mthu khyad par can dang ldan pas kyang gnod par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu khyad par can dang ldan pas kyang gnod par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is capable of being harmed by those who possess extraordinary power.

original: gnod par byar med pa yin yang de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnod par byar med pa yin yang de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: But even though it is not capable of being harmed, it is called form because it is of the same class as form,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa bzhin no //
translated: like the emanation of a Buddha.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs zhes bya ba ni gags byed pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs zhes bya ba ni gags byed pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Others say: Form is that which is capable of obstruction.

original: tshigs su bcad pa de nyid dang mi 'byor pa yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de nyid dang mi 'byor pa yin no //
translated: This is not compatible with the verse.

original: grang ba dang dro ba dang / bkres pa la sogs pas kyang gags byed do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: grang ba dang dro ba dang / bkres pa la sogs pas kyang gags byed do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not compatible to say that cold, heat, hunger, etc. are capable of obstruction.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ji ltar gzugs yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ji ltar gzugs yin zhe na /
translated: How is non-informative matter form?

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba rdzas gzhan ni cung zad yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba rdzas gzhan ni cung zad yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: There is no substance called non-informative matter.

original: khas blangs ba dang chos nyid kyis lus dang ngag ldog ba dang ldog pa ma yin pa tsam la de brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas blangs ba dang chos nyid kyis lus dang ngag ldog ba dang ldog pa ma yin pa tsam la de brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is merely the body and speech of one who has taken a vow or the nature of the Dharma that are imagined to be non-informative because they are not active or are active.

original: brtags pa can de ni gzugs med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa can de ni gzugs med pa nyid yin no //
translated: That which is imagined is formless.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not a real entity,

original: gzugs yod pa la de brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs yod pa la de brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a concept in regard to form.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la brjod par bya ba mang du yod de /🔽re zhig 'dir shin tu 'phros pa gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la brjod par bya ba mang du yod de / re zhig 'dir shin tu 'phros pa gzhag go //
translated: There is much to be said in regard to non-informative form,🔽but that discussion is set aside for the present.

original: 'di'i rnam par nges pa ni phyis bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par nges pa ni phyis bya'o //
translated: Its definition will be given later.

original: ji ltar ming dang gzugs nyid yin pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar ming dang gzugs nyid yin pa bstan zin to //
translated: The explanation of name-and-form is finished.

original: ci'i phyir phung po lnga la ming dang gzugs nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po lnga la ming dang gzugs nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the five aggregates established as name-and-form?

original: byis pa phal cher de gnyis la lus can dang lus su mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa phal cher de gnyis la lus can dang lus su mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that the majority of foolish common people are conceited with the conceit of “I am” in regard to those two.

original: ming sngar smos pa ni des gzugs bzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming sngar smos pa ni des gzugs bzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Name is mentioned first because form is grasped by it.

original: 'di ltar de la ni des bdag dang bdag gi'o zhes bdag gir byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la ni des bdag dang bdag gi'o zhes bdag gir byed do //
translated: Thus, it is in regard to that by which one makes the statement “This is mine, that is mine.”

original: des btang na yang btul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des btang na yang btul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is abandoned, one is liberated.

original: @25b de'i dbang gis kyang bya ba dag la 'jug go //
analyzed: @25b de'i dbang gis kyang bya ba dag la 'jug go //
translated: One engages in activities under its influence.

original: de med par yang ris mthun pa bzhin du mngon par 'grub pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de med par yang ris mthun pa bzhin du mngon par 'grub pa ma yin gyi /
