translated: But if the form of the prior stage does not exist, the form of the subsequent stage does not arise in the formless realm, as it does in the same class of rebirth.

original: gzugs med par yang gzugs med pa dag tu mi mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽ming gi rgyun la brten nas ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu sngon ma byung ba'i gzugs kyi rgyun len par byed kyi /
analyzed: gzugs med par yang gzugs med pa dag tu mi mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro // ming gi rgyun la brten nas ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu sngon ma byung ba'i gzugs kyi rgyun len par byed kyi /
translated: Thus, even though form does not exist in the formless realm, form does arise there, but it is not manifest.

original: gzugs kyi rgyun ni sngon ma byung ba'i ming gi rgyun len par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyun ni sngon ma byung ba'i ming gi rgyun len par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The continuum of name is the support for the arising of the continuum of form in other classes of rebirth, but the continuum of form is not the support for the arising of the continuum of name.

original: gang yang 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skyes pa dag ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skyes pa dag ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin zhe na /
translated: How does form that is derived from the primary elements arise due to consciousness?

original: gal te 'byung ba dang 'byung ba la brten pa'i gzugs rnams las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas skye na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba dang 'byung ba la brten pa'i gzugs rnams las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas skye na /
translated: If form derived from the primary elements arises in dependence on consciousness that is infused by karma,

original: 'dir 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: 'dir 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: what is the contradiction in this?

original: 'byung ba dang tha dad pa med par de skye ba na 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang tha dad pa med par de skye ba na 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If it arises without being separate from the primary elements, it is called derived from the primary elements.

original: de 'dzin pa dang / 'phrog pa dang / yongs su gyur na de 'dzin pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming ni re zhig rigs grang na /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa dang / 'phrog pa dang / yongs su gyur na de 'dzin pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro // rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming ni re zhig rigs grang na /
translated: because the appropriator, the one who is robbed, and the one who is transformed exist.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dag rnam par shes pa las ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dag rnam par shes pa las ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: Name is a condition for the six sense spheres, but how can name arise from consciousness, since they are not of the same nature?

original: 'di ni brgal du med pa la rgol ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni brgal du med pa la rgol ba yin te /
translated: This is an argument against what is not at issue.

original: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las kyang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las kyang 'bras bu 'byung ba de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las kyang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las kyang 'bras bu 'byung ba de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: Even in the world and in the treatises, effects arise from causes that are not of the same nature.

original: re zhig 'jig rten na dbang po dang don gnyis las bde ba dang / sdug bsngal skye ba dang / brdabs pa las sgra dang / rva las 'dam bu dang / me dang shing las du ba dang / rdo thal dang chu las me dang /
analyzed: re zhig 'jig rten na dbang po dang don gnyis las bde ba dang / sdug bsngal skye ba dang / brdabs pa las sgra dang / rva las 'dam bu dang / me dang shing las du ba dang / rdo thal dang chu las me dang /
translated: In the world, pleasure and pain arise from the two, the sense faculty and the object. Sound arises from striking. Mud arises from reeds. Smoke arises from fire and fuel. Fire arises from flint and steel.

original: klu'i sems kyi mthus chu dang de la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: klu'i sems kyi mthus chu dang de la sogs pa'o //
translated: Water arises from the power of the nāga’s mind.

original: bstan bcos las kyang sh'akya'i sras rnams kyi gzugs med pa las kyang skye ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang sh'akya'i sras rnams kyi gzugs med pa las kyang skye ste /
translated: The sons of the Śākya are born from the formless realm.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag las lha'i ming dang rna ba dang / sprul pa'i sems las sprul pa dang / rlung gi stobs 'chang ba la sogs pa rtse bar mngon par dga' ba las rlung dang char la sogs pa dang / klu'i sems kyi mthus chu'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag las lha'i ming dang rna ba dang / sprul pa'i sems las sprul pa dang / rlung gi stobs 'chang ba la sogs pa rtse bar mngon par dga' ba las rlung dang char la sogs pa dang / klu'i sems kyi mthus chu'o //
translated: From the specific meditative attainment, the name of a god, the mind of emanation, emanations, the power of wind, and so on arise. From the mind of a nāga, water arises.

original: gzugs las kyang gzugs med pa skye ba ni mig la sogs pa las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs las kyang gzugs med pa skye ba ni mig la sogs pa las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: From form, the five collections of consciousness and their concomitant states arise from the eye and so on.🔽From dissimilar characteristics, neutral states arise from virtuous and nonvirtuous states, and from the formless realm, form arises.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las kyang yin pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba las lung du ma bstan pa dang / lung du bstan pa las kyang skye ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'dod ma chags pa las 'dod chags skye ba dang /🔽'dod chags @26a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las kyang yin pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba las lung du ma bstan pa dang / lung du bstan pa las kyang skye ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'dod ma chags pa las 'dod chags skye ba dang / 'dod chags @26a * //
translated: From nonattachment, attachment arises.

original: las kyang 'dod ma chags te /
analyzed: las kyang 'dod ma chags te /
translated: From attachment, nonattachment arises.

original: de la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: grangs can pa'i bstan bcos las kyang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i chen po 'am nga'o snyam pa las kyang sgra dang / reg pa dang / ro dang gzugs dang dri'o //
analyzed: grangs can pa'i bstan bcos las kyang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i chen po 'am nga'o snyam pa las kyang sgra dang / reg pa dang / ro dang gzugs dang dri'o //
translated: The Sāṃkhya treatise also says, “Sound, touch, taste, form, and smell arise from the great one, which is not of the nature of those.”

original: bye brag pa dag la yang rigs mi mthun pa rdzas dang las gnyis las yon tan skye ba dang / rdzas dang yon tan las kyang las so //
analyzed: bye brag pa dag la yang rigs mi mthun pa rdzas dang las gnyis las yon tan skye ba dang / rdzas dang yon tan las kyang las so //
translated: The Vaiśeṣikas say that qualities arise from substance and action, which are of a different type, and that action also arises from substance and qualities.

original: bdag dang dbang po dang yid don 'dus pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang dbang po dang yid don 'dus pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
translated: They say that pleasure, pain, and so on arise from the assembly of the self, sense faculties, and objects.

original: bha ra ta las kyang tshangs pa'i yid las bu bdun zhes bya ba dang / rig byed las kyang skye dgu'i bdag po 'dod pa med par skye dgu rnams byas pa dang / de'i dka' thub kyis gdungs nas sprul pa byas so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bha ra ta las kyang tshangs pa'i yid las bu bdun zhes bya ba dang / rig byed las kyang skye dgu'i bdag po 'dod pa med par skye dgu rnams byas pa dang / de'i dka' thub kyis gdungs nas sprul pa byas so zhes bya ste /
translated: The Bhārata says, “The seven sons were born from the mind of Brahmā,” and the Vedas also say, “The lord of beings created beings without desire,” and “He created emanations because he was tormented by austerities.”

original: ci zhe na sprul pa ni de 'dod pa dang dka' thub gnyis kyi mtshan nyid dang bcas pa can yin no //
analyzed: ci zhe na sprul pa ni de 'dod pa dang dka' thub gnyis kyi mtshan nyid dang bcas pa can yin no //
translated: What is that? Emanations have the characteristics of both desire and austerity.

original: de bas na 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i phyir brgal du med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i phyir brgal du med pa dag yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not to be disputed because they are well known in the world and in the treatises.

original: ji ltar mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba yin de lta na ni thams cad las thams cad ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba yin de lta na ni thams cad las thams cad ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: If an effect arises from a cause that is dissimilar to it, why doesn’t everything arise from everything?

original: dpe de dag nyid kyis re zhig mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung yang thams cad las thams cad 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag grub pa yin na 'di la dri bar bya ci dgos /
analyzed: dpe de dag nyid kyis re zhig mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung yang thams cad las thams cad 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag grub pa yin na 'di la dri bar bya ci dgos /
translated: Since the examples show that an effect arises from a cause that is dissimilar to it, but not that everything arises from everything, what need is there to ask this question?

original: chos nyid kyis gang dngos po tha dad pa'i chos de dag ni nus pa tha dad pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis gang dngos po tha dad pa'i chos de dag ni nus pa tha dad pa yod pa yin no //
translated: By the nature of things, those phenomena that are different from each other have different potencies.

original: de bas na de gnyis kas kyang brgal du med do //
analyzed: de bas na de gnyis kas kyang brgal du med do //
translated: Therefore, neither of these two arguments is successful.

original: 'dir yang rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod de /
analyzed: 'dir yang rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod de /
translated: Here, there is a fault in the certainty and uncertainty of the conditions and the conditioned.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa kho na'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs yin na ni dga' ba'i kun 'byung ba las kyang gzugs kun 'byung ba dang / reg pa'i kun 'byung ba las tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams kun 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa kho na'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs yin na ni dga' ba'i kun 'byung ba las kyang gzugs kun 'byung ba dang / reg pa'i kun 'byung ba las tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams kun 'byung ba dang /
translated: If name-and-form were a condition of consciousness alone, then the sūtra would be contradicted when it says, “The origin of pleasure is the origin of form,” and “The origin of contact is the origin of feeling, perception, and volitional dispositions.”

original: ming dang gzugs kun 'byung ba las rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kun 'byung ba las rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if name-and-form were a condition of consciousness alone, then the sūtra would be contradicted when it says, “The origin of name-and-form is the origin of consciousness.”

original: 'on te ming dang gzugs kho na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin na ni rdzus te byung ba rnams las logs shig ni ming dang gzugs med pa'i phyir skye mched drug / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te ming dang gzugs kho na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin na ni rdzus te byung ba rnams las logs shig ni ming dang gzugs med pa'i phyir skye mched drug / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If name-and-form were a condition of consciousness alone, then the six sense bases would not be a condition of consciousness in the case of beings who are born spontaneously, because they do not have name-and-form apart from the six sense bases.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yan lag la yang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yan lag la yang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the link of consciousness would not be a condition of contact in the case of the three types of beings who are born from wombs, eggs, and moisture, because they do not have contact apart from the six sense bases.

original: 'on te gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni rnam pa gnyis po de dag nyid skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni rnam pa gnyis po de dag nyid skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If both are determined, then the two alternatives are faulty.

original: @26b 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @26b 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If neither is determined, then the explanation is meaningless.

original: 'dir nges pa yang med la nges pa med pa'i skyon yang med de /
analyzed: 'dir nges pa yang med la nges pa med pa'i skyon yang med de /
translated: Here, there is neither determination nor the fault of non-determination,

original: gtso bo'i rkyen ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rkyen ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it shows the principal condition.

original: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam grangs shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi gtso bo'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam grangs shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi gtso bo'i rkyen yin te /
translated: The knowledge of synonyms, which is perfumed by formations, is the principal condition of name-and-form,

original: de'i bye brag gis ris mthun pa de dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bye brag gis ris mthun pa de dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those homogeneous groups are differentiated by its distinctions.

original: 'bras s'a lu dang / nas la sogs pa'i myu gu tha dad pa ni sa bon gtso bor gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras s'a lu dang / nas la sogs pa'i myu gu tha dad pa ni sa bon gtso bor gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the differences in sprouts such as rice, barley, etc. are due to the principal seeds.

original: 'dir yang skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa brjod par bzhed pas 'dir skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis gtso bo yang rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa brjod par bzhed pas 'dir skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis gtso bo yang rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, because it is intended to state the complete process of arising, consciousness is not the principal condition of the six sense bases.

original: mdo sde 'di las yan lag re re rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i zla la gsung rab mtha' dag blangs te bshad par nus shing /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las yan lag re re rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i zla la gsung rab mtha' dag blangs te bshad par nus shing /
translated: One can take the entire scriptural collection and explain it by way of the topics of this sutra, by way of determining each of its topics.

original: khyad par du na ming dang gzugs kyi yang nus mod kyis shin tu spros pas chog go //
analyzed: khyad par du na ming dang gzugs kyi yang nus mod kyis shin tu spros pas chog go //
translated: In particular, one can explain name-and-form, but this is too much elaboration.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las ming dang gzugs rnam par dbye ba'o //🔽ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya ba'i skye mched drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las ming dang gzugs rnam par dbye ba'o // ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya ba'i skye mched drug gang zhe na /
translated: This concludes the explanation of name-and-form in the explanation of dependent origination.🔽What are the six sense bases?🔽The six internal sense bases are the eye sense base, the ear sense base, the nose sense base, the tongue sense base, the body sense base, and the mental sense base.

original: nang gi skye mched drug ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni drug nyid skye mched yin pas skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni drug nyid skye mched yin pas skye mched drug ste /
translated: They are called sense bases because they are the bases of the senses.

original: ji ltar sa gsum dang 'bras bu dang tsha ba gsum lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sa gsum dang 'bras bu dang tsha ba gsum lta bu'o //
translated: They are like the three earths and the three hot things.

original: 'di dag la bdag tu nga rgyal skyed par byed pas bdag ni so so'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag la bdag tu nga rgyal skyed par byed pas bdag ni so so'i lus dang sems kyi rgyun yin te /
translated: Since the pride of self is generated in relation to them, self is the continuum of the individual body and mind.

original: de'i dbang du byas pa yin pas nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas pa yin pas nang zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are controlled by that, they are called internal.

original: der byung ba'i skye mched gang yin pa de ni nang gi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: der byung ba'i skye mched gang yin pa de ni nang gi zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is an internal sense-sphere is that which arises from that.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seventh case is the reason.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not form, etc.

original: gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is common to the continuum of consciousness of others.

original: yang na nang nyid nang gi yin te /
analyzed: yang na nang nyid nang gi yin te /
translated: Or, the internal is internal,

original: rnam par gdul bar bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //🔽bdag gi dgra lhag par sngar byas pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par gdul bar bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no // bdag gi dgra lhag par sngar byas pa'am /
translated: like those to be disciplined, etc.

original: de'i dogs pa yin pa ni nang gi'o //
analyzed: de'i dogs pa yin pa ni nang gi'o //
translated: One’s own enemy is internal when it is especially active in the past or is feared.

original: phyi rol ni de las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol ni de las gzhan yin no //
translated: The external is the opposite.

original: 'byung ba'i don ni skye mched kyi don te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i don ni skye mched kyi don te /
translated: The meaning of sense-sphere is the meaning of origination,🔽as it is said: “Consciousness arises in dependence on two.

original: ji skad du gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: As it is said, “Consciousness arises in dependence on two.”🔽

original: gzhan dag na re sgo'i don yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sgo'i don yin te /
translated: Others say that it means door,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: tshangs pa mig ni sgo yin te //
analyzed: tshangs pa mig ni sgo yin te //
translated: “Brahma, the eye is the door

original: gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: for seeing forms.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: de dag gi phyi rol rnams gang gi sgo yin pa @27a * //
analyzed: de dag gi phyi rol rnams gang gi sgo yin pa @27a * //
translated: What is the external gate of the eye?

original: brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: It is necessary to explain this.

original: gzhan dag na re gnas kyi don yin te lha'i skye mched bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnas kyi don yin te lha'i skye mched bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: According to others, the gate has the meaning of a place, as in the expression: the place of the gods.

original: mig gnyis las rnam par shes pa gcig skye na de'i gnas gang yin /
analyzed: mig gnyis las rnam par shes pa gcig skye na de'i gnas gang yin /
translated: If a single consciousness arises from two eyes, what is the place of this consciousness?

original: gnyis ka yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis ka yin no zhe na /
translated: Both eyes.

original: bar na de med pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar na de med pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: But then the consciousness will be twofold, because the place is twofold.

original: yang na de yang de'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: yang na de yang de'i gnas yin no //
translated: Or else, the place of the consciousness is the place of the eye.

original: gnyis ka las gcig skye ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis ka las gcig skye ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But a single consciousness does not arise from two eyes.

original: yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: yang mi rung ste /
translated: This hypothesis is inadmissible.

original: gnyis kyis shin tu gsal bar skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyis shin tu gsal bar skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the visual consciousness arises very clearly when the two eyes are open.

original: mig phye ba dang phyed btsums pa gnyis kyis cig car zla ba gnyis la sogs pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig phye ba dang phyed btsums pa gnyis kyis cig car zla ba gnyis la sogs pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When the two eyes are open, one sees two moons; but not when one closes one of the eyes.

original: ji ltar mig gnyis ka phye ba dang gnyis ka phyed btsums pas cig car ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mig gnyis ka phye ba dang gnyis ka phyed btsums pas cig car ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is the same when the two eyes are open and when the two eyes are half closed.

original: phyi rol gyi zin pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi zin pa rnams kyang /
translated: But if the external sense-faculties are not agglomerations,

original: ji ltar gnas nyid yin /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas nyid yin /
translated: how can they be the place of the consciousness?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dus mi mtshungs pa'i yid dang chos gnyis kyang ji ltar gnas nyid yin /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dus mi mtshungs pa'i yid dang chos gnyis kyang ji ltar gnas nyid yin /
translated: Also, how could the mind and the phenomenon that are not simultaneous with the mental consciousness be its basis?

original: lha'i gnas bzhin du mig la sogs pa ni gnas nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: lha'i gnas bzhin du mig la sogs pa ni gnas nyid ma yin te /
translated: The eyes, etc. are not its basis, like the abode of a god.🔽Because non-embodiment and non-materiality cannot be established as a basis.

original: lus can ma yin zhing gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyis gnas rnam par gzhag par nus pa med pa'i phyir de nyid kyi phyir dgu brgya las mig gi rnam par shes pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: lus can ma yin zhing gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyis gnas rnam par gzhag par nus pa med pa'i phyir de nyid kyi phyir dgu brgya las mig gi rnam par shes pa las brtsams te /
translated: For this very reason, the Navaślokī says:

original: de ni mig dang gzugs la med //
analyzed: de ni mig dang gzugs la med //
translated: It does not exist in the eyes or in form.

original: de gnyis bar na'ang gnas pa med //
analyzed: de gnyis bar na'ang gnas pa med //
translated: It does not exist between those two.

original: gang la de ni gnas gyur pa //🔽de yod ma yin de med min //
analyzed: gang la de ni gnas gyur pa // de yod ma yin de med min //
translated: Where it exists,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: it does not exist, nor does it not exist.

original: kun mkhyen gyis ni rnam par shes //
analyzed: kun mkhyen gyis ni rnam par shes //
translated: The Omniscient One taught that consciousness

original: de phyir sgyu ma lta bur bstan //
analyzed: de phyir sgyu ma lta bur bstan //
translated: is like an illusion.

original: byis pa gang zhig bdag tu 'dzin //
analyzed: byis pa gang zhig bdag tu 'dzin //
translated: The childish who grasp at a self

original: rnam par g-yos pas gzung ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yos pas gzung ba yin // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: are agitated by grasping.

original: 'o na bdag gi glad bar tshor ro//
analyzed: 'o na bdag gi glad bar tshor ro//
translated: Well then, I feel pain in my head.

original: bdag gi glad pa'i ched du tshor ro zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar yongs su gcod ce na /
analyzed: bdag gi glad pa'i ched du tshor ro zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar yongs su gcod ce na /
translated: How can one determine that the tactile body-sense-faculty is the cause of the tactile consciousness?

original: lus kyi phyogs de dag ni de yod pa'i yul las de skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi phyogs de dag ni de yod pa'i yul las de skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the tactile consciousness arises from the contact of the body-sense-faculty with its object.

original: 'di ni de lta bu kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu kho na yin te /
translated: This is the only way to explain the expression “the tactile body-sense-faculty.”

original: gang zhig lus kyi phyogs yongs su ma bzung bar tshor ba'i rang bzhin yongs su gcod pa med do ;
analyzed: gang zhig lus kyi phyogs yongs su ma bzung bar tshor ba'i rang bzhin yongs su gcod pa med do ;
translated: In fact, the tactile body-sense-faculty is not determined as the nature of a sensation, unless one determines the part of the body that is the seat of the sensation.

original: / de bas na lha'i gnas bzhin du gnas kyi don ni skye mched kyi don ma yin no //
analyzed: / de bas na lha'i gnas bzhin du gnas kyi don ni skye mched kyi don ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of “sense-sphere” is not the same as the meaning of “seat.”

original: rgyu la yang gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu la yang gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: The cause is also called a “seat.”

original: ji skad du tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: As it is said in a verse:

original: rnam pa 'di gsum gnas kyis ni //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gsum gnas kyis ni //
translated: By means of these three seats,

original: lha yi nang du skye bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lha yi nang du skye bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: one is born among the gods.

original: de lta na ni gnas kyi don ni @27b skye mched kyi don yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'byung ba'i don ni skye mched kyi don yin no zhes gang smras pa de dag rung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni gnas kyi don ni @27b skye mched kyi don yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'byung ba'i don ni skye mched kyi don yin no zhes gang smras pa de dag rung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of “sense-sphere” is the same as the meaning of “seat,” and the meaning of “sense-sphere” is the same as the meaning of “origin.”

original: nges pa'i tshig tu ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug rnams skye ba mched par byed pas skye mched de /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig tu ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug rnams skye ba mched par byed pas skye mched de /
translated: In terms of their etymological definition, the six collections of consciousness are called sense bases because they generate the arising of consciousness.

original: de skye ba'i rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the cause of the continuity of arising.

original: de las gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang ro dang / reg bya yul gzugs dang ba'i bye brag mig la sogs pa lnga go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang ro dang / reg bya yul gzugs dang ba'i bye brag mig la sogs pa lnga go rims bzhin no //
translated: From them, form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible objects arise, respectively, as the five types of object fields, such as form, and the five sense faculties, such as the eye.

original: ci'i phyir 'di las reg bya yul dang bya ba'i bye brag ni lus zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di las reg bya yul dang bya ba'i bye brag ni lus zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the tangible object called the body?

original: lus la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rdul phra mo bstsags pa'i bye brag can yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang gi tshe lus kyi tshor ba zhes ston pa de'i tshe ni lnga la yang ming lus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lus la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rdul phra mo bstsags pa'i bye brag can yin pa'i phyir ro // gang gi tshe lus kyi tshor ba zhes ston pa de'i tshe ni lnga la yang ming lus zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it pervades the body and because it is a collection of subtle particles.

original: re re la yang rdul phra mo bstsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lus la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: re re la yang rdul phra mo bstsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lus la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: When the body faculty is taught as the basis of body consciousness, the five sense faculties are called the body because they are collections of subtle particles and because they are located in the body.

original: gnas pa yang gnas 'dogs pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gnas pa yang gnas 'dogs pa yang yod do //
translated: The body is also called the basis of the body faculty.

original: khye'u smra ba dang / ri 'dzag pa dang / byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phyogs gcig la mos par byas te zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: khye'u smra ba dang / ri 'dzag pa dang / byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phyogs gcig la mos par byas te zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: the child who speaks, the mountain that flows, the mind endowed with loving kindness, and the direction that is favored.

original: yid kyi skye mched ni phung po'i nang du ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched ni phung po'i nang du ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mental sense-sphere is the consciousness aggregate in the aggregates.

original: khams kyi nang du ni yid kyi khams dang rnam par shes pa'i khams drug go //
analyzed: khams kyi nang du ni yid kyi khams dang rnam par shes pa'i khams drug go //
translated: In the elements, it is the mental faculty element and the six elements of consciousness.

original: de dag las gzhan gang zhig yid kyi khams yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan gang zhig yid kyi khams yin zhe na /
translated: What is the mental faculty element that is different from these?

original: gzhan ni gang yang med kyi /🔽de dag gang yin pa nyid gang gi de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pa de'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gang yang med kyi / de dag gang yin pa nyid gang gi de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pa de'i dbang du byas te /
translated: There is nothing other than these.🔽It is just these that are considered the mental faculty element,

original: yid kyi khams su rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: yid kyi khams su rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: because they are the immediately preceding condition of the mental consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa drug pa'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug pa'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to indicate the basis of the six consciousnesses.

original: skye mched drug bshad zin to //
analyzed: skye mched drug bshad zin to //
translated: The six sense-spheres have been explained.

original: de lta yin du zin kyang 'on kyang ming dang gzugs kyi skye mched drug yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin du zin kyang 'on kyang ming dang gzugs kyi skye mched drug yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Even though this is so, if the six sense-spheres of name-and-form do not exist,

original: ji ltar sprin gyi rkyen gyis char ba dang / me tog gi rkyen gyis 'bras bu dang / nur nur po la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis nar nar po la sogs pa lta bur ji ltar de'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sprin gyi rkyen gyis char ba dang / me tog gi rkyen gyis 'bras bu dang / nur nur po la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis nar nar po la sogs pa lta bur ji ltar de'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin zhe na /
translated: Just as rain is a condition for clouds, a flower is a condition for a fruit, and a kalala, etc., is a condition for a arbuda, etc., how can name-and-form be a condition for the six sense spheres?

original: skye mched drug thams cad kyi dang po ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par nges par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug thams cad kyi dang po ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par nges par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the six sense spheres are definitely a condition for all name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs thams cad sprin las char pa la sogs pa bzhin du skye mched drug gi rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs thams cad sprin las char pa la sogs pa bzhin du skye mched drug gi rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Not all name-and-form is a condition for the six sense spheres, like rain, etc., for clouds, etc.

original: gang gi tshe nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma nas brtsams te ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na lus kyi skye mched dang / yid kyi skye @28a * //🔽mched yod pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma nas brtsams te ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na lus kyi skye mched dang / yid kyi skye @28a * // mched yod pa kho na yin na /
translated: When, beginning from the moment of rebirth, there is the state of name-and-form, the body sense sphere and the mind sense sphere definitely exist.

original: ji ltar de'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be that the six sense spheres are a condition for them?

original: mngon par 'grub pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rigs par sbyar te /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rigs par sbyar te /
translated: The condition of the six sense bases is the condition for the arising of contact, because it is the condition for the actualization and completion of contact.

original: mig la sogs pa mngon par grub pa'i gnas skabs na ni gnas pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir lus kyi skye mched yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa mngon par grub pa'i gnas skabs na ni gnas pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir lus kyi skye mched yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: The sense base of body is complete at the time of the actualization of the eye sense base, etc., because the state of abiding is complete.

original: bzhi po de dag la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de dang 'brel par 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de dang 'brel par 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the four are the state of abiding and because they engage in connection with that.

original: yid kyi skye mched yongs su rdzogs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched yongs su rdzogs pa yang yin te /
translated: The sense base of mind is also complete.

original: gnas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the state is complete.

original: rnam par shes pa drug gis bsdus pa yid kyi skye mched kyi gnas ni de'i tshe yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gis bsdus pa yid kyi skye mched kyi gnas ni de'i tshe yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The state of the sense base of mind, which is included in the six consciousnesses, is complete at that time.

original: de ltar ma bstan na ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ma bstan na ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: If it were not taught in this way, it would not be possible to say that contact is conditioned by the six sense bases.

original: skye mched bzhi'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / reg pa'i gnas yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched bzhi'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / reg pa'i gnas yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the four sense-spheres are in question, and because the Sūtra teaches that the condition of contact is not complete.

original: reg pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is contact?🔽It is the group of six contacts.

original: reg pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par nus pa ma yin no //🔽de bas na mdor bsdus te ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug go zhes bya ba 'di nges par brjod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: reg pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par nus pa ma yin no // de bas na mdor bsdus te ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug go zhes bya ba 'di nges par brjod par bya dgos te /
translated: This explanation is not correct,🔽because it is necessary to explain the Sūtra in a way that avoids contradicting the following text: “Conditioned by name-and-form, the six sense-spheres.”

original: mngon par 'grub ba dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'grub ba dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Sūtra teaches that the six sense-spheres are the condition of contact, because they are the condition for the actualization and the completion of contact.

original: gnas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir zhes smras pa gang yin pa yang ji ltar skye mched drug rnam par shes pa drug gi gnas yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir zhes smras pa gang yin pa yang ji ltar skye mched drug rnam par shes pa drug gi gnas yin zhe na /
translated: But how can the six sense-spheres be the condition of the six consciousnesses, since the latter are already actualized when the six sense-spheres are completed?

original: gtso bo'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Sūtra teaches that the six sense-spheres are the condition of the six consciousnesses, because they are the principal cause of the latter.

original: ji skad du sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is how the Sūtra should be interpreted.

original: kha cig rtog pa ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na lus yod kyang lus kyi skye mched ma yin la /
analyzed: kha cig rtog pa ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na lus yod kyang lus kyi skye mched ma yin la /
translated: Some believe that the body exists in the stage of name-and-form, but that it is not yet a sense-sphere of the body.

original: yid yod kyang yid kyi skye mched ma yin no //
analyzed: yid yod kyang yid kyi skye mched ma yin no //
translated: The mental faculty exists, but it is not a sense base.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: reg pa'i gnas ni skye mched ces bya ba yin na /
analyzed: reg pa'i gnas ni skye mched ces bya ba yin na /
translated: The sense bases are called that because they are the bases of contact.

original: reg pa ni de'i tshe yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: reg pa ni de'i tshe yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But contact does not exist at that time.

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mdo sde 'di nyid las ji skad du ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis 'dir chad dam skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di nyid las ji skad du ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis 'dir chad dam skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In this very sūtra, it says, “Conditioned by name-and-form, the six sense bases arise,” and “Conditioned by the six sense bases, contact arises.”

original: de ni khungs su mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni khungs su mi rung ste /
translated: That is not a valid source.

original: gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what is stated there is provisional.

original: gal te yang de'i tshe reg pa med par gyur na tshor ba la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro //🔽rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs @28b zhes bya ba'i ming gang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang de'i tshe reg pa med par gyur na tshor ba la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro // rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs @28b zhes bya ba'i ming gang zhe na /
translated: If contact does not exist at that time, then feeling and so on would not exist.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste zhes ston pa 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste zhes ston pa 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The statement “Conditioned by consciousness, name-and-form” would contradict the explanation, “What is name? The four non-material aggregates.”

original: ming mtha' dag la dgongs nas de skad du rnam par phye ba yin no zhe na yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: ming mtha' dag la dgongs nas de skad du rnam par phye ba yin no zhe na yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not correct to say that this is a classification made with the intention of including all names.🔽

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen du gyur pa'i ming dang gzugs 'dir brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dir yang 'di la dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen du gyur pa'i ming dang gzugs 'dir brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro // 'dir yang 'di la dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: But that is not correct, because it is the name-and-form that is a condition for the six sense bases that is intended here.

original: skye mched drug gi tshig de la dgongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi tshig de la dgongs pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, this is the intended meaning, but the term “six sense bases” is not intended.

original: 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod /
analyzed: 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod /
translated: What is the reason?

original: rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs las mtha' dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs las mtha' dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the term “in its entirety” is a synonym for “great cause.”

original: gzhan du de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyogs de ni lan btab zin to //🔽gzhan yang gal te reg pa'i snga rol du sems las byung ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan du de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyogs de ni lan btab zin to // gzhan yang gal te reg pa'i snga rol du sems las byung ba'am /
translated: The response to this has already been given in the section on the six sense bases.

original: mi ldan pa'i rdzas yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i rdzas yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Moreover, if there is no mental factor or nonassociated compositional factor prior to contact,

original: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming phung po bzhi pa gang zhig yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming phung po bzhi pa gang zhig yin /
translated: then what is the fourfold name that is a condition for consciousness?

original: 'og tu yang ming ji ltar yin /
analyzed: 'og tu yang ming ji ltar yin /
translated: And what is name later on?

original: gal te 'dod na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'dod na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: If you accept, then it is not different from the foundation consciousness.

original: de bas na gnyis po de 'dod par byos shig / mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na gnyis po de 'dod par byos shig / mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would contradict the Garbhāvakrāntauṣṇīṣasūtra,

original: gang nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gang nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: which states:

original: de la dga' bo gang zhig ma dang pha'i mi gtsang ba las nur nur po lus kyi bdag nyid 'di ni gzugs yin no //
analyzed: de la dga' bo gang zhig ma dang pha'i mi gtsang ba las nur nur po lus kyi bdag nyid 'di ni gzugs yin no //
translated: “Ānanda, this body, which is the self-nature of a fetus, is form.

original: de las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa 'di ni ming yin te /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa 'di ni ming yin te /
translated: Feeling, discernment, formation, and consciousness that arise from that are name.🔽Name and form are counted as one, called name-and-form.”

original: ming 'di dang snga mi'i gzugs de dag gcig tu bsdus te ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro zhes bya ba dang yang gsungs pa de de'i dus kyi tshe dbang po gsum thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming 'di dang snga mi'i gzugs de dag gcig tu bsdus te ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro zhes bya ba dang yang gsungs pa de de'i dus kyi tshe dbang po gsum thob par 'gyur te /
translated: It also says: At that time, three faculties are obtained:

original: lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po ste /
translated: the body faculty, the mind faculty, and the life faculty.

original: de ni skye mched drug gi nang du 'dus pa'i dbang po bzhi dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas te bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni skye mched drug gi nang du 'dus pa'i dbang po bzhi dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas te bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught from the perspective of the four faculties that are included in the six sense bases.

original: de lta ma yin na don gyi tshul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don gyi tshul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no way to interpret the meaning.

original: gang yang gnas brtan gyi mdo sde las btsun pa dge 'dun phal cher sde pa dag 'don pa /
analyzed: gang yang gnas brtan gyi mdo sde las btsun pa dge 'dun phal cher sde pa dag 'don pa /
translated: Also, the elder’s sutra recited by the Mahāsāṃghika sectarians states:

original: rmongs pa dang ni sred pa dag / de bzhin gnyis ka ma spangs pa //
analyzed: rmongs pa dang ni sred pa dag / de bzhin gnyis ka ma spangs pa //
translated: The confused, those with craving, and those who do not abandon both

original: de las skyes pa'i las rnams kyis //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i las rnams kyis //
translated: through karma born from that

original: rnam smin ma yi mngal du gnas //
analyzed: rnam smin ma yi mngal du gnas //
translated: dwell in the womb of a mother.🔽Any mental factor

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dag / de ni ming zhes bya ba yin //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang dag / de ni ming zhes bya ba yin //
translated: is called name.

original: der skyes @29a * //🔽nur nur po la sogs //
analyzed: der skyes @29a * // nur nur po la sogs //
translated: Born there,

original: de ni gzugs zhes bya ba yin //
analyzed: de ni gzugs zhes bya ba yin //
translated: it is called form.

original: zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This contradicts that sutra.

original: 'gal du brad mod 'gal na gnod pa ci yod de /
analyzed: 'gal du brad mod 'gal na gnod pa ci yod de /
translated: If it contradicts that sutra, what is the harm?

original: de gnyis ka yang lung gi nang du ma gtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang lung gi nang du ma gtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Both are not valid because they are not included in the scriptures.

original: kye ma'o rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa dag mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: kye ma'o rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa dag mi 'dzin to //
translated: Alas! Those who are attached to their own views do not accept it.

original: bsdus pa'i rtsa ba dang lung dang mdo sde rnams nyams pa lad su zhig tshad ma ma yin par shes par nus pa yod /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rtsa ba dang lung dang mdo sde rnams nyams pa lad su zhig tshad ma ma yin par shes par nus pa yod /
translated: When the root of the collection, the scriptures, and the sūtras are corrupted, who can know what is valid?

original: nyi tshe ba tha dad pa dag gi lung dang 'don pa tha dad par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba tha dad pa dag gi lung dang 'don pa tha dad par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could there be different scriptures and recitations of the limited ones?

original: so so'i lung de dag kha cig gis mdo sde rnams bsdus pa dag kyang smras pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i lung de dag kha cig gis mdo sde rnams bsdus pa dag kyang smras pa yin no //
translated: Some say that those individual scriptures were also collected in the sūtras.

original: mdo sde dang 'dul ba las bsdus pa'i rtsa ba nyams par 'gyur bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo sde dang 'dul ba las bsdus pa'i rtsa ba nyams par 'gyur bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs par 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said that the Blessed One saw that the root of the collection from the sūtras and the Vinaya would be corrupted.

original: 'di ltar bshad pa po las tshig rnam pa gsum gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad pa po las tshig rnam pa gsum gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the speaker spoke three kinds of words:

original: chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo 'dod chags kyi shas che ba'i gnyen por rigs pa'i ngo bo bshad pa gang gis 'di btul ba'i mdo sde 'di lta bu gzhan la mi dmigs pa dang 'dul ba las kyang gsungs so //🔽mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo sde las tshe dang ldan pa dga' bos dgra bcom pa mngon du byas so zhes gsungs pa dang / gnas brtan gyi mdo sde dag nyi tshe ba dge 'dun phal chen pa mtha' dag tshad mar byed do //
analyzed: chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo 'dod chags kyi shas che ba'i gnyen por rigs pa'i ngo bo bshad pa gang gis 'di btul ba'i mdo sde 'di lta bu gzhan la mi dmigs pa dang 'dul ba las kyang gsungs so // mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo sde las tshe dang ldan pa dga' bos dgra bcom pa mngon du byas so zhes gsungs pa dang / gnas brtan gyi mdo sde dag nyi tshe ba dge 'dun phal chen pa mtha' dag tshad mar byed do //
translated: The Vinaya also states that the sutra that explains the nature of the rational mind, which is the antidote to the great passion of the venerable Nanda, was not observed by others and that he was disciplined.🔽The Sutra on Entering Lanka states that the venerable Nanda actualized arhatship and the sutras of the elders are accepted as authoritative by the entire Lokottaravada school.

original: lhug pa dang tshe mthar gtugs pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde rnams ni nyi tshe ba mtha' dag tshad mar byed pas na /
analyzed: lhug pa dang tshe mthar gtugs pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde rnams ni nyi tshe ba mtha' dag tshad mar byed pas na /
translated: The sutras of the Mahasamghika school are accepted as authoritative by the entire Lokottaravada school.

original: lung gi nang du ma 'dus pa'i phyir de gnyis ka yang tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba de nyid tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: lung gi nang du ma 'dus pa'i phyir de gnyis ka yang tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba de nyid tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since they are not included in the scriptures, both of these are not authoritative.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na lus dang yid gnyis skye mchad ma yin pa'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis kyis thams cad bsdus pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dge slong dag thams cad thams cad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /🔽skye mched bcu gnyis so zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //🔽rjes su 'gro ba la yang de skad du brjod de ma btab pa'i sa bon bzhin no zhe na yang /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na lus dang yid gnyis skye mchad ma yin pa'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis kyis thams cad bsdus pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dge slong dag thams cad thams cad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste / skye mched bcu gnyis so zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro // rjes su 'gro ba la yang de skad du brjod de ma btab pa'i sa bon bzhin no zhe na yang /
translated: If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so, because the twelve links are not all.🔽If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so, because the twelve links are not all.🔽If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so, because the twelve links are not all.

original: mig la sogs pa mngon par grub pa yang reg pa med na skye mched ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa mngon par grub pa yang reg pa med na skye mched ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so, because the twelve links are not all.

original: nus pa yin pa'i phyir de skye mched yin no @29b zhe na /🔽yang sngar gang gis nus pa med par gyur /🔽zhan pas so zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa yin pa'i phyir de skye mched yin no @29b zhe na / yang sngar gang gis nus pa med par gyur / zhan pas so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so, because the twelve links are not all.

original: yang zhan pa ni zhan pa la nus pa yin te /🔽ji ltar yid ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang zhan pa ni zhan pa la nus pa yin te /🔽ji ltar yid ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la nus pa bzhin no //
translated: If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so, because the twelve links are not all.🔽If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so, because the twelve links are not all.🔽If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so, because the twelve links are not all.🔽If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so, because the twelve links are not all.🔽If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so, because the twelve links are not all.🔽If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so, because the twelve links are not all.🔽If you say that the twelve bases are all because they are the basis of the twelve links, that is not so

original: mdo sde gzhan las kyang yid nang gi skye mched ma nyams shing de skyed pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa yin pa de las skye ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las kyang yid nang gi skye mched ma nyams shing de skyed pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa yin pa de las skye ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: When the mental faculty is undamaged and the attention that produces it is present, then the mental consciousness arises from that.

original: yid kyi skye mched dang yid la byed pa med par ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched dang yid la byed pa med par ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: How could the mental consciousness arise without the mental faculty and attention?

original: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba yang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan sems kyi rtsol ba yin par sde pa thams cad la grags pa yin na de ji ltar reg pa med par yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba yang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan sems kyi rtsol ba yin par sde pa thams cad la grags pa yin na de ji ltar reg pa med par yod par 'gyur /
translated: Attention is known to all schools as a mental factor, a mental process that is the exertion of the mind. How could it exist without contact?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa de thams cad reg pa la brten nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa de thams cad reg pa la brten nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān also said, “Whatever is the aggregate of formation is all based on contact.”

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa goms pa'i 'jug pa rnyed pa ni 'dir de skyed pa yid la byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa goms pa'i 'jug pa rnyed pa ni 'dir de skyed pa yid la byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Here the attention that produces the mental faculty is the attention that obtains the engagement of the mental consciousness that is habituated to it.

original: sems kyi rtsol ba ni ma yin no zhe na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi rtsol ba ni ma yin no zhe na yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not mental exertion.

original: mdo sde gzhan las yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang skye ba dang yongs su gcad par bya ba dag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang skye ba dang yongs su gcad par bya ba dag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because other sūtras teach the focal object, aspect, arising, and object of observation of mental attention.🔽The Abhidharmakośa states,🔽Those who wish to understand the Abhidharma should constantly attend to the five appropriated aggregates as diseased, as a boil, as a thorn, as an affliction, as impermanent, as suffering, as empty, and as selfless.🔽And,

original: chos mngon par khong du chud par 'dod pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la rgyun mi 'chad par nad yin par yid la bya'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / chos 'di dag bdag gis yid la byed pa na 'dod pa'i brag pa ma byung bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: chos mngon par khong du chud par 'dod pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la rgyun mi 'chad par nad yin par yid la bya'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / chos 'di dag bdag gis yid la byed pa na 'dod pa'i brag pa ma byung bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang /
translated: When I attend to these phenomena, the desire realm does not arise in me.🔽And,

original: 'di ltar tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa na /
translated: When one attends improperly,

original: ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / 'di yid la byed cing 'di yid la mi byed par gzugs la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / dge slong dag dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rtsom pa na yid la byed pa shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //🔽'jug pa rnyed pa la ni dmigs pa yang yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / 'di yid la byed cing 'di yid la mi byed par gzugs la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / dge slong dag dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rtsom pa na yid la byed pa shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no // 'jug pa rnyed pa la ni dmigs pa yang yod pa ma yin /
translated: The Sūtra says: When the bhikṣu begins the member of enlightenment called mindfulness, he knows the attention.

original: rnam pa yang med 'di la ni 'dod pa bzhin byed pa 'ga' yang med /
analyzed: rnam pa yang med 'di la ni 'dod pa bzhin byed pa 'ga' yang med /
translated: In the acquisition of entry, there is no object, no aspect. There is nothing here that is done according to one's wish.

original: 'di yongs su bcad par nus pa yang ma yin pas 'di yid la byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yongs su bcad par nus pa yang ma yin pas 'di yid la byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to delimit it. Therefore one does not pay attention to it.

original: kha cig tu ni yid byed pa rtsol ba @30a * //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni yid byed pa rtsol ba @30a * //
translated: In some places, attention is effort.

original: yin ; kha cig tu ni 'jug pa rnyed pa yin no zhe na yang 'di la rigs pa ci yod /
analyzed: yin ; kha cig tu ni 'jug pa rnyed pa yin no zhe na yang 'di la rigs pa ci yod /
translated: In some places, it is the acquisition of entry. What is the reason here?

original: rtsol ba med pa rnam par shes pa de mi skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na yang de 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: rtsol ba med pa rnam par shes pa de mi skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na yang de 'gal ba med de /
translated: If you say that consciousness does not arise without effort, that is not a contradiction.

original: yid la byed pa ni de skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni de skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: Attention is what generates it.

original: de brtsal ba med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de brtsal ba med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not that there is no effort,

original: sngar shes par byas so //
analyzed: sngar shes par byas so //
translated: because we have already explained that.

original: 'o na gal te mngal du dang po nyid kyi ming dang gzugs phung po lnga pa yin na ni khams drug la brten nas ma'i mngal du lugs 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na gal te mngal du dang po nyid kyi ming dang gzugs phung po lnga pa yin na ni khams drug la brten nas ma'i mngal du lugs 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If name-and-form is a five-aggregate embryo in the womb, then it would enter the mother’s womb in dependence on six elements.

original: lus zhugs na ming dang gzugs yod par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: lus zhugs na ming dang gzugs yod par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro//
translated: This would contradict the sūtra that states, “When the body has entered, name-and-form exists.”

original: de bas na de'i tshe khams drug nyid ming dang gzugs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na de'i tshe khams drug nyid ming dang gzugs yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, at that time, the six elements are name-and-form.

original: ci re zhig khams drug gang yin pa'i lus de nyid la brten nas de 'jug pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci re zhig khams drug gang yin pa'i lus de nyid la brten nas de 'jug pa yin nam /
translated: At that time, does the embryo enter the womb in dependence on the body that is the six elements?

original: 'on te gzhan zhig yin ci nyes gal te de nyid la yin na ni ji ltar lus de nyid la brten te lus de 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan zhig yin ci nyes gal te de nyid la yin na ni ji ltar lus de nyid la brten te lus de 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the same, then how could the body enter the body?

original: 'on te gzhan zhig yin na ni gnas skabs de ci yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan zhig yin na ni gnas skabs de ci yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: But if it is something else, then you must explain what it is.

original: gal te thog mar lus ma'i mngal du khrag dang khu ba de'i gnas skabs kyi sa dang / chu dang me dang rlung dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / de dag dang 'brel pa'i srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams de dag la brten nas gal te phung po lnga'i lus 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te thog mar lus ma'i mngal du khrag dang khu ba de'i gnas skabs kyi sa dang / chu dang me dang rlung dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / de dag dang 'brel pa'i srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams de dag la brten nas gal te phung po lnga'i lus 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the body of five aggregates arises in dependence on the elements of blood and semen in the mother’s womb, the elements of water, fire, wind, and space, and the element of consciousness in the intermediate existence that is connected to them,

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur /
translated: then how does this contradict the sūtra?

original: 'on kyang skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa dang / rig pa'i skye mched drug dang / yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad ces 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa dang / rig pa'i skye mched drug dang / yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad ces 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te ;
translated: But it would contradict the statement, “This person has six elements, six sense bases, and eighteen mental activities.”

original: der yang ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs dang / reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas skabs dang / tshor ba'i gnas skabs kyi skyes bu yin par go rims bzhin du bstan to /🔽'on te ci reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas skabs sam /
analyzed: der yang ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs dang / reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas skabs dang / tshor ba'i gnas skabs kyi skyes bu yin par go rims bzhin du bstan to / 'on te ci reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas skabs sam /
translated: Moreover, the person is taught to be the stage of name-and-form, the stage of the sense bases of contact, and the stage of feeling, respectively.🔽But is it not the case that the elements do not exist at the stage of the sense bases of contact?

original: yid kyi rgyu ba'i gnas skabs na khams de dag med dam /
analyzed: yid kyi rgyu ba'i gnas skabs na khams de dag med dam /
translated: Or at the stage of the movement of mind?

original: yod dam zhes smras so //
analyzed: yod dam zhes smras so //
translated: Is it not the case that they do exist?

original: ci de don gyi tshul de de ltar brtag par bya 'am /
analyzed: ci de don gyi tshul de de ltar brtag par bya 'am /
translated: Is it the case that this meaning should be investigated in this way?

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid las 'jug tu nang gi sa'i khams la sogs pa rnam par che ba de bzhin du reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas skabs na shin tu rig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid las 'jug tu nang gi sa'i khams la sogs pa rnam par che ba de bzhin du reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas skabs na shin tu rig pa kho na yin no //
translated: Just as in this very sūtra, the internal earth element, etc., are distinguished, in the same way, at the stage of the sense bases of contact, they are also distinguished.

original: gnas skabs gang @30b na yang lus kyi khams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i khams med par khams drug tsam 'ba' zhig yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang @30b na yang lus kyi khams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i khams med par khams drug tsam 'ba' zhig yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: At no stage are there just the six elements alone, without the body element and the elements of form, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the element of consciousness does not exist.

original: mdo sde 'di'i don 'di ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i don 'di ma yin no //
translated: This is not the meaning of this sūtra.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir khams la sogs pa gsum smos she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir khams la sogs pa gsum smos she na /
translated: Well then, why are the three, the elements, etc., mentioned?

original: gnas dang gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach the basis and what is based on it.

original: khams rnams ni reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas yin te /
analyzed: khams rnams ni reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas yin te /
translated: The elements are the basis of the sense bases of contact,

original: de la brten nas 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of the arising of contact.

original: de yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba rnams kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: de yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba rnams kyi gnas yin no //
translated: And that is the basis of the mental applications.

original: lus la khams so sor brtag pa ni bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: lus la khams so sor brtag pa ni bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir te ;
translated: The investigation of the elements in the body is in order to teach selflessness,🔽because it is reasonable to see selflessness by equating the internal with the external elements, etc.

original: 'di ltar phyi'i sa'i khams la sogs pa dang nang gi mnyam par byas nas bdag med pa mthong ba yod pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yin pa dang / bdag med pa yin yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir reg pa'i skye mched dang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi'i sa'i khams la sogs pa dang nang gi mnyam par byas nas bdag med pa mthong ba yod pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yin pa dang / bdag med pa yin yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir reg pa'i skye mched dang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba smos so //
translated: The sense bases of contact and the mental applications are mentioned in order to teach that even though there is no self, there is the arising of afflicted feelings.

original: de bas na thog ma kho nar mngal du phung po lnga'i ming dang gzugs grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thog ma kho nar mngal du phung po lnga'i ming dang gzugs grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, first of all, the five aggregates are formed in the womb.

original: 'o na ci ming dang gzugs 'dus pa skye mched drug gi rkyen yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na ci ming dang gzugs 'dus pa skye mched drug gi rkyen yin nam /
translated: Is the union of name-and-form the condition of the six sense spheres?

original: 'on te gzugs rnams kyi ni gzugs yin la /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs rnams kyi ni gzugs yin la /
translated: Or is form the condition of the five sense spheres that have form,

original: yid kyi ni ming gcig pu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi ni ming gcig pu yin zhe na /
translated: and name the condition of the mental sense sphere?

original: drug car gyi yang gnyis ka tshogs yin te /
analyzed: drug car gyi yang gnyis ka tshogs yin te /
translated: Both are the condition of the six sense spheres.

original: skrag pa dang / mya ngan dang / dga' ba dang / nad dang rgas pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na lus dang sems gnyis gcig la gcig rjes su byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skrag pa dang / mya ngan dang / dga' ba dang / nad dang rgas pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na lus dang sems gnyis gcig la gcig rjes su byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For we see that in the states of fear, sorrow, joy, sickness, and old age, the body and mind are mutually dependent.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir phyi'i skye mched drug gi rkyen 'dir ma bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir phyi'i skye mched drug gi rkyen 'dir ma bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is the sixfold sense-object not taught as a condition here?

original: de ni yan lag tha dad par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yan lag tha dad par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not a separate member,

original: ming dang gzugs kyi skad cig ma dang po'i tshe na yang de yod pa yin pa'i phyir dang / ming dang gzugs kyang rkyen yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir dang / sgra yang gnas skabs ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lnga po yang gcig kho nas sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi skad cig ma dang po'i tshe na yang de yod pa yin pa'i phyir dang / ming dang gzugs kyang rkyen yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir dang / sgra yang gnas skabs ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lnga po yang gcig kho nas sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the first moment of name-and-form also exists, because name-and-form is already taught to be a condition, because sound is not ascertained as a condition, and because the five are not included in the number of sentient beings.

original: chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i reg pa la sogs pa'i yang rkyen yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i reg pa la sogs pa'i yang rkyen yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because contact and so on, which are included in the phenomena base, are already taught to be conditions.

original: gal te ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin na /
analyzed: gal te ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin na /
translated: If the six sense bases are a condition of name-and-form,

original: ci'i phyir kha cig dbang po ma tshang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kha cig dbang po ma tshang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why are some beings incomplete in their faculties?

original: @31a * // ming dang gzugs la nus pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: @31a * // ming dang gzugs la nus pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Because there are different potentials in name-and-form, as was previously explained.

original: 'di yang rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod pa yin te /
translated: This also has the fault that the definite and indefinite conditions and that which possesses conditions are not ascertained.

original: gal te ming dang gzugs kho na'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin na ni rdzus te byung ba rnams kyi de'i rkyen rnam par shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ming dang gzugs kho na'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin na ni rdzus te byung ba rnams kyi de'i rkyen rnam par shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the six sense spheres are the condition of name-and-form alone, then the consciousness of apparitional sentient beings would not have name-and-form for its condition.

original: 'on te skye mched kho na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin na ni de dag la gnas pa'i gzugs dang / yid kyi skye mched dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos dang / sgra'i skye mched rnams kyi rkyen ming dang gzugs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te skye mched kho na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin na ni de dag la gnas pa'i gzugs dang / yid kyi skye mched dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos dang / sgra'i skye mched rnams kyi rkyen ming dang gzugs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the six sense spheres are the condition of name-and-form alone, then the form of those born from wombs, the mental faculty and the factors dissociated from thought of those born from wombs and eggs, and the sound sphere of those born from wombs, eggs and moisture would not have name-and-form for their condition.

original: gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni skyon rnam pa gnyis po de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni skyon rnam pa gnyis po de dag nyid yin no //
translated: If it is certain that both are the condition of each other, then the two faults would be incurred.🔽If it is uncertain, then the explanation would be pointless.

original: ma nges pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na 'dir nges pa yang ma yin la ma nges pa la 'chad pa don med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na 'dir nges pa yang ma yin la ma nges pa la 'chad pa don med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not certain that both are the condition of each other, nor is the explanation pointless,

original: skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi ched du skyon bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi ched du skyon bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fault is explained in terms of the complete stage of birth.

original: yan lag tha dad pa yang de la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni yan lag tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag tha dad pa yang de la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni yan lag tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The different parts of the body, such as the head, etc., are not different sense spheres because they are not separate substances.

original: sngon med pa'i rdzas gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i rdzas gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The different parts of the body, such as the head, etc., are not different sense spheres because they are not separate substances.

original: sgra yang gnas skabs ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las skye mched rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: sgra yang gnas skabs ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las skye mched rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
translated: Sound is not a separate sense sphere because it is not permanent.🔽The analysis of the sense spheres is concluded.

original: // / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par 'byed pa bshad pa /🔽bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: // / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par 'byed pa bshad pa / bam po gsum pa /
translated: The first chapter of the Abhidharmakośabhāṣya has been completed.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba'i reg pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba'i reg pa gang zhe na /
translated: The six sense spheres are the condition for contact. What is contact?

original: reg pa'i tshogs drug ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas reg pa'i rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas rab tu dbye ba bstan gyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: reg pa'i tshogs drug ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas reg pa'i rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas rab tu dbye ba bstan gyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One taught the classification of contact from the perspective of the different bases of contact, depending on the disciples.

original: 'o na reg pa zhes bya ba ni gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na reg pa zhes bya ba ni gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is contact?

original: gsum 'dus pas reg pa yin no zhes mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pas reg pa yin no zhes mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and the coming together of the three is contact.

original: de yang rgyu bstan pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyu bstan pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the cause of contact, not its intrinsic nature.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan la reg pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan la reg pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Contact is a factor dissociated from thought.

original: gang la brten nas sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad skye ba'o //
analyzed: gang la brten nas sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad skye ba'o //
translated: It is the support for the arising of all the factors associated with thought.

original: ji skad du dris pa rnam pa bcu'i mdo las tshor ba'i phung po dang 'du shes kyi phung po dang 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa de thams cad reg @31b pa la brten nas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du dris pa rnam pa bcu'i mdo las tshor ba'i phung po dang 'du shes kyi phung po dang 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa de thams cad reg @31b pa la brten nas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Sūtra of Questions by Revata says, “All the aggregates of sensation, of ideation, and of formations are supported by contact.

original: de ni tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du de yid kyis 'gas kyang yongs su mi chod do //
