analyzed: de ni tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du de yid kyis 'gas kyang yongs su mi chod do //
translated: ” It is not, like sensation, etc., susceptible to being cut off in part.

original: 'di ji ltar yid ches par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar yid ches par bya zhe na /
translated: How can one have confidence in this?

original: yid brten du rung ba'i lung las so //
analyzed: yid brten du rung ba'i lung las so //
translated: From the trustworthy scripture.

original: yid brten du rung ba'i lung yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yid brten du rung ba'i lung yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The trustworthy scripture is of three types:

original: mngon sum gyi don dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don dang dad par bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don dang dad par bya ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning of direct perception, the meaning of inference, and the meaning of faith.

original: de la gnyis ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis yid ches par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnyis ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis yid ches par bya ste /
translated: Of these, the first two are to be believed by means of direct perception and inference.

original: gang de dang 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang de dang 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: That which is not contradicted by them is the meaning of faith.

original: dad par bya ba'i don de la yang yid ches par bya'o //
analyzed: dad par bya ba'i don de la yang yid ches par bya'o //
translated: And that meaning of faith is to be believed.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yang rnam par shes pa las gzhan du yongs su mi chod de /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yang rnam par shes pa las gzhan du yongs su mi chod de /
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is not distinguished from consciousness.

original: de ni rang gi sde pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya mi nus pa yin yang tshor ba gsum zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang gi sde pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya mi nus pa yin yang tshor ba gsum zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although it cannot be understood by our own schools, it is said that there are three feelings.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa na tshor ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa na tshor ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that there is no feeling in the fourth concentration and the formless realm.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dang po'i bye brag dang / ma rig pa yang rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi chod pa yin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dang po'i bye brag dang / ma rig pa yang rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi chod pa yin la /
translated: The distinction of the first such as the eye, and ignorance, are not distinguished from their own nature.

original: yongs su mi chod pa'i mtshan nyid yin du zin kyang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa'o zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan yod par yid brten du rung ba'i lung las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi chod pa'i mtshan nyid yin du zin kyang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa'o zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan yod par yid brten du rung ba'i lung las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Although it is not a distinct real entity, it is to be understood from the scriptures that contact is a distinct mental factor, since it is said that contact is the coming together of three things.

original: 'o na mdo sde gzhan las 'di skad du chos gsum po gang yin pa de dag phrad pa dang / tshogs pa dang 'dus pa de reg pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mdo sde gzhan las 'di skad du chos gsum po gang yin pa de dag phrad pa dang / tshogs pa dang 'dus pa de reg pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But in another sutra, it is said, “The coming together, meeting, and union of these three things is contact.”

original: de dag ni rgyu la 'bras bu gdags pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni rgyu la 'bras bu gdags pa yin te /
translated: The effect is figuratively designated as the cause.

original: dper na / 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde //
analyzed: dper na / 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde //
translated: For example, it is said, “The noble ones are to be seen as happiness,”

original: zhes bya ba dang / tshangs spyod dri ma bud med yin //🔽zhes bya ba lta bu'o //🔽'jig rten na yang me ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / tshangs spyod dri ma bud med yin // zhes bya ba lta bu'o // 'jig rten na yang me ni bde ba'o //
translated: and “The stainless conduct of celibacy is a woman.”🔽In the world, it is said, “Fire is happiness,”

original: me ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: me ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: and “Fire is suffering.”

original: rgyu la 'bras bu de ltar gdags kyi /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu de ltar gdags kyi /
translated: The effect is figuratively designated as the cause.

original: gsum 'dus pa nyid reg pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar yid ches par bya /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa nyid reg pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar yid ches par bya /
translated: How can it be believed that the coming together of three things is not contact?

original: 'jig rten na phrad pa la reg go zhes brjod de zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten na phrad pa la reg go zhes brjod de zhe na /
translated: In the world, contact is said to occur when two things meet.

original: 'di ni re zhig skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: This contradicts the sutra that states, Contact occurs with the six bases as its condition.

original: skye mched drug ni gsum gyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir dang / sems las byung ba'i reg pa yang ma yin par thal bar 'gyur la /🔽gsum 'dus pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos @32a * //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni gsum gyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir dang / sems las byung ba'i reg pa yang ma yin par thal bar 'gyur la / gsum 'dus pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos @32a * //
translated: For, the six bases are included in the three and contact is not a mental factor.

original: reg pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: reg pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The meeting of the three is not the mental factor of contact.🔽Contact is a designation, like the designation of a crossroad.

original: reg pa ni brtags pa yin te dris 'dra ba bzhin no zhe na yang de ltar na mi ldan pa yin par gyur la de lta bu ni sde pa gang gi grub pa'i mtha' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: reg pa ni brtags pa yin te dris 'dra ba bzhin no zhe na yang de ltar na mi ldan pa yin par gyur la de lta bu ni sde pa gang gi grub pa'i mtha' yang ma yin no //
translated: If you say that contact is not substantially real, then it is not substantially established, and that is not the tenet of any school.

original: btsun pa gos smra ba dang mdo sde 'di nyid las gsungs pa ming gang zhe na /
analyzed: btsun pa gos smra ba dang mdo sde 'di nyid las gsungs pa ming gang zhe na /
translated: The Venerable Vāsava and this sutra itself state, What is name?

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba dang / sde tshan drug pa drug las kyang sde tshan drug rnams ni rigs tha dad pa la rnam par gzhag gi / gsum 'dus pa nyid reg pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba dang / sde tshan drug pa drug las kyang sde tshan drug rnams ni rigs tha dad pa la rnam par gzhag gi / gsum 'dus pa nyid reg pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The six groups of six are established on the basis of different types, but contact is not merely the coming together of the three.

original: 'di ji ltar nges par bya /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar nges par bya /
translated: How is this determined?

original: gal te skye mched drug gi rkyen kho nas reg pa yin na ni gsum 'dus pas reg pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde gzhan dang / de bzhin du gnyis po 'di la brten nas reg pa'o zhes 'byung ba spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te skye mched drug gi rkyen kho nas reg pa yin na ni gsum 'dus pas reg pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde gzhan dang / de bzhin du gnyis po 'di la brten nas reg pa'o zhes 'byung ba spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If contact exists only on the basis of the condition of the six sense spheres, then the other sutra that states, “Contact exists due to the coming together of the three,” and the statement, “In dependence on these two, contact occurs,” would be rejected.

original: 'on te reg pa kho nar skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te reg pa kho nar skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis yin na ni /
translated: But if the condition of the six sense spheres is contact itself,

original: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde gzhan spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde gzhan spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the other sutra that states, “Consciousness arises in dependence on two,” would be rejected.

original: 'on te gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni gnyis ka'i skyon de dag kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni gnyis ka'i skyon de dag kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If both are determined, then the faults of both are incurred.

original: 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If neither is determined, then the explanation is meaningless.

original: don med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not meaningless,

original: gtso bo'i rkyen gyis chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rkyen gyis chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the condition of the principal factor is severed.

original: gtso bo'i rkyen ni skye mched drug yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rkyen ni skye mched drug yin te /
translated: The condition of the principal factor is the six sense bases,

original: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin te /
translated: because they are common and uncommon, as before.

original: de yod na nges par yul dang rnam par shes pa de gnyis kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na nges par yul dang rnam par shes pa de gnyis kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When they exist, the object and consciousness definitely exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di las mig la sogs pa'i sgo nas reg pa bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di las mig la sogs pa'i sgo nas reg pa bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, contact is taught here from the perspective of the eye, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa ste rnga sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa ste rnga sgra bzhin no //
translated: not from the perspective of form, etc., like the sound of a drum.

original: sgrib pa'i mdo sde las gnyis po 'di la brten nas reg pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sgrib pa'i mdo sde las gnyis po 'di la brten nas reg pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: In the Sūtra on Obstructions, these two are called contact,

original: rten dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas reg pa tha dad par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas reg pa tha dad par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because contact is taught to be different from the perspective of different supports and different objects.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyis ni der nang gi skye mched bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyis ni der nang gi skye mched bstan te /
translated: The internal sense bases are taught there in the context of the body that possesses consciousness.

original: lus smos pas ni lnga char smos pa yin no //
analyzed: lus smos pas ni lnga char smos pa yin no //
translated: The word body refers to all five sense faculties,

original: 'di ltar de la brten pa'i tshor ba ni lus kyi zhes ston pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la brten pa'i tshor ba ni lus kyi zhes ston pa bzhin no //
translated: because feeling that is based on them is taught as bodily feeling.

original: phyi rol gyi ming dang gzugs ni phyi yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ming dang gzugs ni phyi yin te /
translated: External form is external because it is the external sense bases.

original: gnyis po de dag nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis po de dag nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two are taught as a division of the internal and external.

original: de la gsungs pa reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag gang gis reg pa'i @32b byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa'i so so'i skye bo dag bde ba dang / sdug bsngal so sor myong bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung na /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag gang gis reg pa'i @32b byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa'i so so'i skye bo dag bde ba dang / sdug bsngal so sor myong bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung na /
translated: The Sūtra says, “The six bases of contact are the cause of the feeling of pleasure and pain of the immature, ordinary beings who are not learned.”

original: skye mched drug dang gnyis dang reg pa'i skye mched gsum la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: skye mched drug dang gnyis dang reg pa'i skye mched gsum la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the six sense bases, the two, and the three bases of contact?

original: bye brag ci yang med de dgongs pa gang gis bshad pa de dag bdag gis smras zin to//
analyzed: bye brag ci yang med de dgongs pa gang gis bshad pa de dag bdag gis smras zin to//
translated: There is no difference at all. I have already explained the intention behind the teaching of the three bases of contact.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na reg pa'am tshor ba yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na reg pa'am tshor ba yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don’t contact and sensation exist in the stage of name-and-form?

original: ci gang gi phyir skye mched drug gi 'og tu rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci gang gi phyir skye mched drug gi 'og tu rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are they established after the six sense bases?

original: med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not absent.

original: ji ltar lus dang yid kyi skye mched gnyis de'i tshe yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yan lag gzhan du rnam par ma gzhag pa ltar reg pa dang / tshor ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar lus dang yid kyi skye mched gnyis de'i tshe yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yan lag gzhan du rnam par ma gzhag pa ltar reg pa dang / tshor ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the body and mind sense bases are not established as separate members because they are complete at that time, so also contact and sensation.

original: gal te skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa yin na /
translated: If contact is conditioned by the six sense bases,

original: rgyu chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las ci'i phyir ming dang gzugs rkyen du gsungs she na /
analyzed: rgyu chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las ci'i phyir ming dang gzugs rkyen du gsungs she na /
translated: why is name-and-form stated as the condition in the Mahānidāna Sūtra?

original: der ni thogs pa dang tshig bla dags 'dus te reg pa gnyis brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der ni thogs pa dang tshig bla dags 'dus te reg pa gnyis brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated there that the two, contact and designation, are included in name.

original: de las skye mched rkyen nyid yin pa yang bstan zin te /
analyzed: de las skye mched rkyen nyid yin pa yang bstan zin te /
translated: It has already been explained that the sense bases are the condition for name-and-form.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because contact of the eye and so on is mentioned.

original: 'on te yang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa zhes gsungs na 'dus pa zhes bya ba de ci yin /
analyzed: 'on te yang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa zhes gsungs na 'dus pa zhes bya ba de ci yin /
translated: But if you say that contact is the coming together of the three, what is this coming together?

original: tshogs yin no zhe na yang ji ltar de dag tshogs pa yin /
analyzed: tshogs yin no zhe na yang ji ltar de dag tshogs pa yin /
translated: If you say that it is a collection, how can there be a collection of these three?

original: gal te lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni ;
analyzed: gal te lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni ;
translated: If you say that it is because they occur together,

original: dbang po dang don rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po dang don rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then the sense faculty and the object are not the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa skyes zin na ni de gnyis nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes zin na ni de gnyis nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If consciousness has already arisen, these two are not its cause, because they are not capable of producing it.

original: ma skyes pa yin na yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yin na yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If consciousness has not yet arisen, they are not its cause, because they do not exist.

original: gcig la gcig rgyu nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: gcig la gcig rgyu nyid yin na yang /
translated: If you say that they are the cause of each other,

original: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang gnyis ka yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang gnyis ka yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then you contradict the sutra that says, “Consciousness arises in dependence on two.”

original: drug pa'i gsum yang dus tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar tshogs pa yin /
analyzed: drug pa'i gsum yang dus tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar tshogs pa yin /
translated: And how can the three of the sixth consciousness be a collection, since they exist at different times?

original: tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig tu 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig tu 'jug pa yin no //
translated: A collection is a simultaneous occurrence.

original: 'on te sngar skyes pa'i dbang po dang don gnyis rnam par shes pa'i tshe gnas pa'i phyir gsum tshogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar skyes pa'i dbang po dang don gnyis rnam par shes pa'i tshe gnas pa'i phyir gsum tshogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the three are present when the consciousness arises after the sense faculty and object have already arisen,

original: de lta yin na dbang po dang don gnyis skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na dbang po dang don gnyis skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that the sense faculty and object are not momentary.

original: drug pa gsum la yang rnam par shes pa gnyis lhan cig tshogs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drug pa gsum la yang rnam par shes pa gnyis lhan cig tshogs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the case of the sixth consciousness, two consciousnesses would occur simultaneously.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gsum tshogs pa yin no zhe na yang /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gsum tshogs pa yin no zhe na yang /
translated: If you say that the three are present as cause and effect,

original: lnga'i gsum dag lhan @33a * //
analyzed: lnga'i gsum dag lhan @33a * //
translated: then the five sense faculties, their objects, and the five consciousnesses would occur simultaneously.

original: cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir dbang po dang don dang / rnam par shes pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rigs te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: cig tu 'byung ba'i phyir dbang po dang don dang / rnam par shes pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rigs te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that the sense faculty, object, and consciousness are cause and effect, as explained above.

original: rim gyis byung ba yin na ni /
analyzed: rim gyis byung ba yin na ni /
translated: If they occur sequentially,

original: thog mar dbang po dang don gnyis de nas rnam par shes pa de nas reg pa yin pas rnam par shes pa khon reg pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'thad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: thog mar dbang po dang don gnyis de nas rnam par shes pa de nas reg pa yin pas rnam par shes pa khon reg pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'thad pa yin gyi /
translated: then the sense faculty and object occur first, then the consciousness, and then contact. Therefore it is tenable that consciousness is the cause of contact.

original: dbang po dang don gnyis ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang don gnyis ma yin te /
translated: The sense faculty and the object are not the contact,

original: rnam par shes pa'i dus na de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i dus na de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not exist at the time of consciousness.

original: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The coming together of the three is not the contact,

original: gcig kho na de la nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig kho na de la nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only one has the capacity for that.

original: rnam par shes pa dang reg pa lhan cig byung ba yin no zhe na yang rnam par shes pa ni reg pa'i rgyu yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang reg pa lhan cig byung ba yin no zhe na yang rnam par shes pa ni reg pa'i rgyu yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that contact is the arising of consciousness and contact together, then consciousness cannot be the cause of contact,

original: ji skad du sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: as was explained above.

original: de ltar na yang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the coming together of the three is not the contact,

original: gnyis kho na de la nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kho na de la nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only two have the capacity for that.

original: gang dag yang gsum 'dus pa kho na reg pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag yang gsum 'dus pa kho na reg pa yin te /
translated: Some say that the coming together of the three is contact.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba rgyur mi 'dod pa de'i yang dbang po dang don gnyis rnam par shes pa'i tshe 'phags pa'i phyir tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu'i dngos por rigs pa ma yin pas reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba rgyur mi 'dod pa de'i yang dbang po dang don gnyis rnam par shes pa'i tshe 'phags pa'i phyir tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu'i dngos por rigs pa ma yin pas reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since the two, the sense faculty and object, are prior to the consciousness, it is illogical that they are the entity that is the cause of the arising of feeling. Therefore feeling is not established as having contact as its condition.

original: de dag gi gsum po rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa ni reg pa yin gyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de dag gi gsum po rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa ni reg pa yin gyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin pas so //
translated: The three of them are contact because they are cause and effect, but consciousness alone is not.

original: de bas na tshogs pa ni 'dus pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tshogs pa ni 'dus pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is illogical that the assembly is a collection.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that they are not the entity of cause and effect.

original: 'dus pa'i don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kho na yin la /
translated: The meaning of assembly is only the entity of cause and effect.

original: gsum 'dus pa yang lhan cig pa'am /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa yang lhan cig pa'am /
translated: The assembly of three is either simultaneous or sequential.

original: rim gyis drug po'i gsum rnams ji ltar regs par 'byung ba yin na lhan cig 'byung ba ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis drug po'i gsum rnams ji ltar regs par 'byung ba yin na lhan cig 'byung ba ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin te /
translated: If the three of the six arise in any way, how could the simultaneous be the entity of cause and effect?

original: gcig la gcig rgyu nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig rgyu nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are not even a cause of each other,

original: ji ltar grib ma dang myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar grib ma dang myu gu bzhin no //
translated: like a shadow and a tree.

original: rim gyis byung ba yang ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin /
analyzed: rim gyis byung ba yang ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin /
translated: How can that which arises in succession be a cause and effect?

original: 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: At the time of the effect, the cause does not exist.

original: ji ltar sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no //
translated: Like a seed and a sprout.

original: de 'gag pa dang skye ba gnyis dus mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de 'gag pa dang skye ba gnyis dus mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the cessation of the seed and the arising of the sprout are simultaneous,

original: srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin no //
analyzed: srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin no //
translated: like the rising and falling of a scale.

original: dngos po med pa sngon du song ba'i 'bras bu yin par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa sngon du song ba'i 'bras bu yin par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be that the effect is preceded by the nonexistence of the cause?

original: ji ltar rgyu med pa de dang 'bras bu dus mnyam pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu med pa de dang 'bras bu dus mnyam pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the effect and the cause without a cause are simultaneous.

original: @33b re zhig yid ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos po yin par rigs te /
analyzed: @33b re zhig yid ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i dngos po yin par rigs te /
translated: First, the mind is suitable as the cause of mental consciousness,

original: sa bon dang myu gu bzhin yin no //🔽gang 'das nas yun ring du lon pa'am /
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu bzhin yin no // gang 'das nas yun ring du lon pa'am /
translated: like a seed and a sprout.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams la yid gzhan dag ji ltar rgyu'i dang por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams la yid gzhan dag ji ltar rgyu'i dang por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can the mind that has passed a long time ago or the mind of future phenomena be the first cause of another mind?

original: de'i dbang gis de skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness arises due to the power of that.

original: de lta ma yin na chos rnams de'i dmigs pa tsam yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na chos rnams de'i dmigs pa tsam yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then those phenomena would be its mere focal object.

original: gal te skyes la 'gags pa dang phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnyed pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te skyes la 'gags pa dang phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnyed pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If that which has arisen and ceased and that which will arise later do not exist, then the condition for the arising of consciousness does not exist.

original: de dag la rnam par shes pa 'di skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la rnam par shes pa 'di skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Consciousness does not arise from those.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu'i bye brag gis sa gzhan dag gi de las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pas bsgos pa'i rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag can gyis 'das pa rnams dran pa'am /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu'i bye brag gis sa gzhan dag gi de las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pas bsgos pa'i rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag can gyis 'das pa rnams dran pa'am /
translated: Yogis recall past lives through the power of samādhi, through the transformation of the mindstream that is imbued with consciousness arisen from other levels.

original: ma 'ongs pa la rjes su dpog pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa sngon myong ba'i rjes su dpog pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa sngon myong ba'i rjes su de dang rigs gcig pa'i rjes su dpog par byed pa dang / mngon par 'dod pas kyang sngon du ma byas na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la rjes su dpog pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa sngon myong ba'i rjes su dpog pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa sngon myong ba'i rjes su de dang rigs gcig pa'i rjes su dpog par byed pa dang / mngon par 'dod pas kyang sngon du ma byas na /
translated: It is inferred from the future, from the experience of what is desired in the past, from the experience of what is desired in the past, it is inferred from that which is of the same type, and from what is desired, even though it was not previously experienced.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽'jig rten na yang de'i dbang gis skye ba med par yang rgyu yin par yang sgrogs so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro // 'jig rten na yang de'i dbang gis skye ba med par yang rgyu yin par yang sgrogs so //
translated: The cognition of the past and future is inference.

original: rgyu ci yin zhe na /🔽gal te nga phyug po'i bu yin na ci'i phyir sprang po byed /
analyzed: rgyu ci yin zhe na / gal te nga phyug po'i bu yin na ci'i phyir sprang po byed /
translated: The cognition of the past is inference from the present effect to the past cause.

original: smras pa pa shi ba rgyu yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: smras pa pa shi ba rgyu yin no zhe'o //
translated: The cognition of the future is inference from the present cause to the future effect.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.

original: de spang ba la ni de shi bas nus pa ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de spang ba la ni de shi bas nus pa ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.

original: 'di la bsam pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di la bsam pa ci yod ce na /
translated: The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.🔽The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.

original: gal te de'i pha shi ba ma yin na de dag de 'dra ba'i gnas skabs su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de'i pha shi ba ma yin na de dag de 'dra ba'i gnas skabs su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The cognition of the past and future is also inference from the present effect and cause to the past and future effect and cause.

original: 'dus pa'i rnam par nges pa ni phyis kyang bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rnam par nges pa ni phyis kyang bya'o //
translated: The determination of the assembly will be done later.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
translated: The condition of the six sense spheres is established.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las reg pa rab tu dbye ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las reg pa rab tu dbye ba rdzogs so /
translated: The analysis of contact is completed in the teaching of dependent origination.

original: // / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is feeling?

original: tshor ba rnam pa gsum pa ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de dag gis ni tshor ba'i rab tu dbye ba ston to //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa gsum pa ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de dag gis ni tshor ba'i rab tu dbye ba ston to //
translated: The three kinds of feeling are taught in detail.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is pleasant feeling?

original: gang skyes na mi 'bral bar 'dod pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang skyes na mi 'bral bar 'dod pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is that which, when it arises, one desires not to be separated from it.

original: sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
translated: What is unpleasant feeling?

original: gang skyes na bral bar 'dod pa 'byung ba'o //🔽sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang skyes na bral bar 'dod pa 'byung ba'o // sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: It is that which, when it arises, one desires to be separated from it.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling?

original: gang skyes na gnyis ka mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang skyes na gnyis ka mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is that which, when it arises, one desires neither to be separated from nor to be united with.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: gang skyes pa na 'bral mi 'dod //
analyzed: gang skyes pa na 'bral mi 'dod //
translated: When it arises, one does not desire to be separated from it.

original: 'bral bar 'dod dang gnyis min gyi//
analyzed: 'bral bar 'dod dang gnyis min gyi//
translated: The third is neither.

original: @34a * // rgyu gang tshor bar shes bya ste //
analyzed: @34a * // rgyu gang tshor bar shes bya ste //
translated: The cause of feeling should be understood as the cause of pleasure, etc.

original: de ni bde sogs go rims bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni bde sogs go rims bzhin // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is pleasure, etc., in order.

original: 'o na gang sdom brtson rnams mi 'dod bzhin du 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris nas 'dod chags las skyes pa'i bde ba 'byung ba la 'bral bar 'dod pa gang yin pa 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang sdom brtson rnams mi 'dod bzhin du 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris nas 'dod chags las skyes pa'i bde ba 'byung ba la 'bral bar 'dod pa gang yin pa 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: But if one does not wish to be separated from the pleasure that arises from attachment, even though one is bound by attachment, how can one have the desire to be separated from it?

original: de ni de las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: That pleasure does not arise from attachment.

original: 'o na ci las she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci las she na /
translated: From what does it arise?

original: de'i bde ba ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa nyid du mthong nas de sun 'byin pa las so //
analyzed: de'i bde ba ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa nyid du mthong nas de sun 'byin pa las so //
translated: One sees that pleasure is an obstacle to morality and concentration, and one rejects it.

original: gal te tshor ba gsum yin na /
analyzed: gal te tshor ba gsum yin na /
translated: If there are three feelings,

original: mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci tshor yang rung ste de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci tshor yang rung ste de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the intention of the statement in another sūtra: “Whatever is felt is suffering in this world”?

original: mdo sde gzhan las gang ci tshor yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba 'di ni kun dga' bo ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no zhes dgongs pa lung bstan to //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las gang ci tshor yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba 'di ni kun dga' bo ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no zhes dgongs pa lung bstan to //
translated: “Ananda, I taught this with the intention that conditioned states are impermanent and subject to change, and that conditioned happiness will eventually change into suffering.”

original: de yang tshor ba gnyis la ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba med pas na /
analyzed: de yang tshor ba gnyis la ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba med pas na /
translated: Since the two types of feelings do not inherently exist as suffering,

original: dgongs pa can gyi sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: dgongs pa can gyi sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: he taught that they are suffering in the sense that they are subject to a specific interpretation.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang tshe dang ldan pa tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang tshe dang ldan pa tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
translated: The noble Shariputra also said, “Venerable One, there are three types of feelings:

original: mi rtag pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /🔽bde ba yang ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin / bde ba yang ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: pleasant, painful, and neither pleasant nor painful.

original: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes rtogs na /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes rtogs na /
translated: If you understand that whatever is impermanent is suffering,

original: tshor ba gzhal du med pa dag la yang dga' bde gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba gzhal du med pa dag la yang dga' bde gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: you will not take pleasure in the infinite varieties of feelings.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su 'gyur ba nyid gsungs kyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su 'gyur ba nyid gsungs kyi /
translated: Why did the Lord teach the transformation of the aggregates,

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus ma yin zhe na /
translated: but the noble Śāriputra did not?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sdug bsngal rnam ba gsum bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sdug bsngal rnam ba gsum bstan pa yin la /
translated: The Lord taught the three kinds of suffering.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin te /
translated: The noble Śāriputra taught only the suffering of conditioned states,

original: de khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that pervades all.

original: gal te gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba yin na ni lam la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba yin na ni lam la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If what is impermanent is suffering, then it follows that the path is suffering.

original: mi 'gyur te nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the Lord’s statement is intended to refer to the five aggregates that perpetuate existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dngos po gang yin pa de nyid la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis ni mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dren par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dngos po gang yin pa de nyid la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis ni mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dren par bya'o //
translated: The perception of impermanence in the very things that are the objects of desire and craving will bring about the perception of their unattractiveness.🔽The perception of unattractiveness will bring about the perception of their suffering.

original: mi mthun pa sdug bsngal bde la dgongs nas gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mi mthun pa sdug bsngal bde la dgongs nas gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the Lord taught that whatever is impermanent is suffering, intending to refer to the unattractiveness of pleasant feelings.

original: de bas @34b na lam la thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de bas @34b na lam la thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the path is not subject to the same consequence.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang dngos po gang dga' ba'i yul de mi rtag pa nyid du mthong na mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang dngos po gang dga' ba'i yul de mi rtag pa nyid du mthong na mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: Noble Śāriputra also said: “When one sees as impermanent that object which is the domain of attachment, one becomes averse to it.

original: de bas na gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes rig na bdag gi ba ni der phra rgyas su gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes rig na bdag gi ba ni der phra rgyas su gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, when one knows that whatever is impermanent is suffering, then one’s self-habit will not remain latent there.”

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: Whatever object is the basis of the feeling of suffering, etc., is disagreeable in order, because it is associated with the two, arising and destruction.

original: de ni lung las gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ni lung las gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught in the scriptures: “Whatever is impermanent is suffering.”

original: lam ni 'di lta bu ma yin pas lam la thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: lam ni 'di lta bu ma yin pas lam la thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: But the path is not like that, so the path is not subject to the same consequence.

original: gzhan dag na re tshor ba gsum bstan pa dgongs pa can yin gyi sdug bsngal nyid ni tshor ba gcig kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re tshor ba gsum bstan pa dgongs pa can yin gyi sdug bsngal nyid ni tshor ba gcig kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: Others say: The teaching of three feelings is intentional, but only one feeling is suffering.

original: de ni 'di la log par brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di la log par brtags pa yin te /
translated: This is a wrong analysis.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid yin pa ni dgongs te bka' stsal pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid yin pa ni dgongs te bka' stsal pa yin te /
translated: The Lord has said that all feelings are suffering, but he said that intentionally.

original: kun dga' bo ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed yongs su 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bo ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed yongs su 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Ānanda, I have said that all formations are suffering, intending the impermanence of formations and the transformation of formations.

original: gang ci tshor yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te tshor ba gsum bstan pa dgongs pa can yin na ni ngas 'di la dgongs nas /
analyzed: gang ci tshor yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // gal te tshor ba gsum bstan pa dgongs pa can yin na ni ngas 'di la dgongs nas /
translated: Whatever is felt is suffering in this world.

original: tshor ba gsum bshad do zhes gsungs par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: tshor ba gsum bshad do zhes gsungs par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: If the teaching of three feelings is intentional, then it should be said that the Lord said that intentionally.

original: re zhig tshor ba gsum bstan pa dgongs pa can yin par brtags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig tshor ba gsum bstan pa dgongs pa can yin par brtags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the analysis of the teaching of three feelings as intentional?

original: sdug bsngal chud ba'i tshor ba ni bde ba zhes bya'o //🔽chen po ni sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chud ba'i tshor ba ni bde ba zhes bya'o // chen po ni sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
translated: The feeling of suffering is called pleasant.🔽The feeling of pleasure is called suffering.

original: bar ma ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: bar ma ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin par bstan te /
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is called neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.

original: 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun pa yin te /
translated: This is in accordance with the world.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni de dag la bde ba la sogs pa yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni de dag la bde ba la sogs pa yin par rtogs so //
translated: For the world recognizes these as pleasant, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ci yid /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ci yid /
translated: What is the characteristic of the feeling of suffering?

original: gang gis na tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal yin par bstan /🔽gal te gang skyes na bral bar 'dod pa 'byung ba dang / gang skyes na mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'am ;
analyzed: gang gis na tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal yin par bstan / gal te gang skyes na bral bar 'dod pa 'byung ba dang / gang skyes na mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'am ;
translated: How can it be taught that all feelings are suffering?🔽If it is the feeling that one desires to be separated from as soon as it arises,🔽or that one desires not to be separated from when it arises,

original: gnyis ka ma yin par 'dod pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin par 'dod pa yin na ni /
translated: or that one desires neither to be separated from nor not to be separated from when it arises,

original: de sdug bsngal du ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de sdug bsngal du ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: how can that be established as suffering?

original: 'on te gang la brten na gnod par 'gyur ba de sdug bsngal yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te gang la brten na gnod par 'gyur ba de sdug bsngal yin na ni /
translated: If that which causes harm when it occurs is suffering,

original: gang la brten na phan par 'gyur ba de ji ltar sdug bsngal yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la brten na phan par 'gyur ba de ji ltar sdug bsngal yin par 'gyur /
translated: how can that which causes benefit when it occurs be suffering?

original: 'on te ji ltar 'phags pas sdug bsngal bar gzigs @35a * //
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar 'phags pas sdug bsngal bar gzigs @35a * //
translated: Or, how do āryas see it as suffering?🔽

original: ba de tshor ba sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: ba de tshor ba sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Or else, the suffering that the noble ones see is the characteristic of the suffering of sensation.

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid kyi tshong ba rnams 'phags pas sdug bsngal bar gzigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid kyi tshong ba rnams 'phags pas sdug bsngal bar gzigs so zhe na /
translated: The noble ones see formations as suffering because of the suffering of formations.

original: de yang tha dad pa med pa yin pas ji ltar de'i sgo nas tshor ba la sdug bsngal chung ba nyid dang / bar ma dang / chen po nyid 'grub par 'gyur /🔽gal te yang 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid kho nas tshor ba zhes bya ba sdug bsngal ba nyid yin na ni sdug bsngal nyid gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa med pa yin pas ji ltar de'i sgo nas tshor ba la sdug bsngal chung ba nyid dang / bar ma dang / chen po nyid 'grub par 'gyur / gal te yang 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid kho nas tshor ba zhes bya ba sdug bsngal ba nyid yin na ni sdug bsngal nyid gsum ste /
translated: But since that is not different, how can the lesser, middling, and greater suffering of sensation be established on the basis of that?

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i mdo sde yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i mdo sde yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the suffering of sensation were only the suffering of formations, then the sutra statement, “There are three types of suffering: the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of formations,” would not exist.

original: bsam gtan gsum na sdug bsngal chung ba'i tshor ba yod par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum na sdug bsngal chung ba'i tshor ba yod par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: And it would be established that the sensation of lesser suffering exists in the third absorption.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pleasant feeling is taught.

original: de'i gong mar bar ma sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gong mar bar ma sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the neutral feeling is taught above that.

original: ji ltar shin tu zhi ba'i snyoms par zhugs pa la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba lhag par yod par 'thad /
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu zhi ba'i snyoms par zhugs pa la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba lhag par yod par 'thad /
translated: How can it be reasonable that the feeling of pain is predominant in the meditative attainment of the cessation of feeling and ideation?

original: de bas na tshor ba gsum bstan pa ni dgongs pa can nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tshor ba gsum bstan pa ni dgongs pa can nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that the teaching of three feelings is interpretable in meaning.🔽But the Lord has said that the perception of pleasure in pain is a perversion.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa gang yin pa ni phyin ci log yin no zhes gsungs pa yang sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis la de sdug bsngal yin par mi shes nas gcig kho nar bde bar 'du shes pa ni phyin🔽ci log yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa gang yin pa ni phyin ci log yin no zhes gsungs pa yang sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis la de sdug bsngal yin par mi shes nas gcig kho nar bde bar 'du shes pa ni phyin🔽ci log yin no //
translated: The perception of pleasure in one of the two kinds of pain is a perversion, since one does not understand that it is pain.

original: 'on kyang bde ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa ni sdug bsngal du blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yang sdug bsngal nyid gnyis yin par mthong ba la sbyor bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bde ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa ni sdug bsngal du blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yang sdug bsngal nyid gnyis yin par mthong ba la sbyor bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: But the statement, “Whatever is a feeling of pleasure should be seen as suffering” is made in order to apply the two kinds of suffering to the perception of pleasure.

original: de la chags pa dang bral ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pa'i phyir sran ma sha'i phung po bzhin no //
analyzed: de la chags pa dang bral ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pa'i phyir sran ma sha'i phung po bzhin no //
translated: Because it is the means of becoming free from attachment to it, and because it is associated with much suffering, it is like a heap of beans.

original: btsun pa gzhon nu len gyis smras pa /
analyzed: btsun pa gzhon nu len gyis smras pa /
translated: Bhadanta-Kumāralābha says:

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal mang pos bskyed pa'i phyir te /🔽sdug bsngal yin pa la de yid du 'ong bar lta zhing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal mang pos bskyed pa'i phyir te / sdug bsngal yin pa la de yid du 'ong bar lta zhing /
translated: Because it is the cause of suffering and because it is generated by much suffering,🔽one views it as pleasant, although it is suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yin na bde ba yin par 'dzin to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin na bde ba yin par 'dzin to //
translated: And one grasps it as pleasure, although it is suffering.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no feeling of pleasure,

original: bde ba'i rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not endure as pleasure.

original: bde ba'i rgyur brtags pa'i btung ba dang / bza' ba dang gos la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag las de dag shin tu mang ba'am /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyur brtags pa'i btung ba dang / bza' ba dang gos la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag las de dag shin tu mang ba'am /
translated: The food, drink, clothes, and so on, that are considered to be the causes of happiness are not as numerous as the causes of suffering.

original: dus ma yin par bsten na sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus ma yin par bsten na sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The drinks, food, clothing, etc. that are considered to be the cause of pleasure, when they are used in excess or at the wrong time, become the cause of suffering.

original: @35b gang gis bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba de nyid kyis sdug bsngal du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @35b gang gis bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba de nyid kyis sdug bsngal du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not fitting that what is the cause of pleasure be the cause of suffering.

original: de bas na de dag ni bde ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni bde ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not the cause of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gzhan zhi ba bde ba yin par sems te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan zhi ba bde ba yin par sems te /
translated: One thinks that the alleviation of suffering is pleasure.

original: dper na mgos khur khyer ba spyod lam gzhan du spos na klad pa na ba la sogs pa zhi ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mgos khur khyer ba spyod lam gzhan du spos na klad pa na ba la sogs pa zhi ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one changes one’s position, the headache, etc. that are suffering are alleviated.

original: de bas na bde ba ni med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de bas na bde ba ni med pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, pleasure does not exist.

original: des 'di dag ma rtogs na bde ba'i rgyu de dag rnam par gnas pa yin par rtogs par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: des 'di dag ma rtogs na bde ba'i rgyu de dag rnam par gnas pa yin par rtogs par byed do zhe na /
translated: If one does not understand this, one thinks that the cause of pleasure is the cause of the alleviation of suffering.

original: yul gyi bye brag 'ba' zhig bde ba'i rgyu yin par sems kyi nang gi lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la ni mi sems te /
analyzed: yul gyi bye brag 'ba' zhig bde ba'i rgyu yin par sems kyi nang gi lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la ni mi sems te /
translated: But they do not consider the internal body, the specific condition of the body, as a cause of pleasure.

original: de gnyis ka 'dus pa bde ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ka 'dus pa bde ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The combination of both is the cause of pleasure.

original: de gnyis ka gang ji lta bus bde bar 'gyur bar rtogs pa de lta bus ni lan 'ga' yang sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ka gang ji lta bus bde bar 'gyur bar rtogs pa de lta bus ni lan 'ga' yang sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Whatever causes pleasure in both of these ways, in no way causes pain.

original: bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: The cause of pleasure is not unstable.

original: dper na me dang 'bras s'a lu dang / nas dang tshod sngon dang nya la sogs pa gang 'dra ba'i gnas skabs gzhan rnyed na ro zhim po'i rgyur 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i gnas skabs gzhan rnyed na 'ga' yang ro mi zhim pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin no
analyzed: dper na me dang 'bras s'a lu dang / nas dang tshod sngon dang nya la sogs pa gang 'dra ba'i gnas skabs gzhan rnyed na ro zhim po'i rgyur 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i gnas skabs gzhan rnyed na 'ga' yang ro mi zhim pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin no
translated: For example, fire, rice, barley, green gram, fish, etc., when they acquire a certain condition, become the cause of a delicious taste. When they acquire another condition, they become the cause of a bad taste. This is the example.

original: // sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nye bar zhi yang lan 'ga' zhig na bde ba'i tshor ba gzhan las yongs su gcod de /
analyzed: // sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nye bar zhi yang lan 'ga' zhig na bde ba'i tshor ba gzhan las yongs su gcod de /
translated: Even when the sensation of pain is appeased, sometimes the sensation of pleasure is distinguished from another.

original: der ni bde ba kho na la bde ba'i blo 'byung gi sdug bsngal zhi ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni bde ba kho na la bde ba'i blo 'byung gi sdug bsngal zhi ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: In this case, the idea of pleasure arises only in relation to pleasure, not in relation to the alleviation of pain.

original: dper na ngal ba'i lus bsku mnye byed pa dang / spyod lam gzhan byed pa gnyis lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ngal ba'i lus bsku mnye byed pa dang / spyod lam gzhan byed pa gnyis lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one massages the body of someone who is tired, or when one changes one’s posture after sitting or standing for a long time.

original: de lta ma yin na dus ring por yang ngal bzhi bde 'dra ba kho na'i bde ba'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dus ring por yang ngal bzhi bde 'dra ba kho na'i bde ba'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Otherwise, the idea of pleasure would arise even in relation to a long-lasting pleasure,

original: len 'ga' yang bde ba la yongs su spyod par mi 'gyur /🔽sdug bsngal la yongs su spyod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: len 'ga' yang bde ba la yongs su spyod par mi 'gyur / sdug bsngal la yongs su spyod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and no one would ever experience pleasure or pain.

original: de ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba tsam la bde ba nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba tsam la bde ba nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the idea of pleasure is merely a designation in relation to the mere alleviation of pain.

original: bde ba'i blo yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'i blo yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the idea of pleasure,

original: tshor ba gzhan la yongs su mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba gzhan la yongs su mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not experience pleasure when one experiences another feeling.

original: 'dir ni de lta bu kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de lta bu kho na yin te /
translated: In this case, it is just as has been described.

original: gang phal cher bza' ba dang / btung ba 'bad de zhim po tshol bar byed de 'bras chan phal pa dang / 'bras bu pa ma sa dang / rtsab mo dang chu tsam gyis kyang bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal zhi bar mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //🔽gang gi tshe bkres pa dang skom @36a * //
analyzed: gang phal cher bza' ba dang / btung ba 'bad de zhim po tshol bar byed de 'bras chan phal pa dang / 'bras bu pa ma sa dang / rtsab mo dang chu tsam gyis kyang bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal zhi bar mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no // gang gi tshe bkres pa dang skom @36a * //
translated: For the most part, they seek out food and drink that is delicious and well prepared. It is not the case that the suffering of hunger and thirst is alleviated by ordinary rice, vegetables, and water.

original: pa dang bral nas ro zhim pa'am sna la dri zhim pa'i rdzas gzhan shin tu zhim pa dang / shin tu ches zhim pa'i khyad par las bde ba'i khyad par gyi blo skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe sdug bsngal gzhan zhi ba gang zhig yin /
analyzed: pa dang bral nas ro zhim pa'am sna la dri zhim pa'i rdzas gzhan shin tu zhim pa dang / shin tu ches zhim pa'i khyad par las bde ba'i khyad par gyi blo skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe sdug bsngal gzhan zhi ba gang zhig yin /
translated: When they are free from hunger and thirst, they experience a special pleasure from the special taste of a very delicious substance, or from a very special smell, such as a fragrant flower. At that time, what suffering is alleviated?

original: rna bas kyang yid du 'ong ba snyan pa sna tshogs pa'i sgra rnams la nyan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna bas kyang yid du 'ong ba snyan pa sna tshogs pa'i sgra rnams la nyan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They also listen to various pleasant and agreeable sounds with their ears.

original: de bas na sdug bsngal nyid kyi tshor ba la sdug bsngal gzhan zhi ba'i phyir bde ba'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sdug bsngal nyid kyi tshor ba la sdug bsngal gzhan zhi ba'i phyir bde ba'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the idea of pleasure does not arise from the cessation of another pain in the case of a feeling that is itself painful.

original: sdug bsngal gzhan nye bar zhi ba 'ba' zhig la ma yin par ni lung dang rigs pas kyang grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan nye bar zhi ba 'ba' zhig la ma yin par ni lung dang rigs pas kyang grub pa yin te /
translated: It is established by both scripture and reasoning that the idea of pleasure does not arise from the mere cessation of another pain.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni gsum mo zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni gsum mo zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The scripture says, “Feeling that has contact as its condition is threefold.”

original: 'dir yang rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang / ma nges pa gnyis las ma nges pa nyid la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang / ma nges pa gnyis las ma nges pa nyid la brten par bya'o //
translated: Here, the condition and the conditioned are both determinate and indeterminate. The indeterminate should be relied upon.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: tshor ba'i rkyen nges pa yin na ni rgyu gzhan dang de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa rnams rkyen yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen nges pa yin na ni rgyu gzhan dang de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa rnams rkyen yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the condition of feeling were determinate, then the other causes, the antecedent, and the object would not be conditions.

original: mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would contradict the sutra.

original: sems can rnams kyi tshor ba skye ba gang ci yang rung /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi tshor ba skye ba gang ci yang rung /
translated: Whatever feelings arise for sentient beings,

original: thams cad de la brten nas yin gyi ma brten par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad de la brten nas yin gyi ma brten par ni ma yin no //
translated: all arise in dependence on that, not independently.

original: ci la brten nas she na /
analyzed: ci la brten nas she na /
translated: In dependence on what?

original: mos pa la brten nas dang / rnam par rtog pa la brten nas dang / reg pa la brten nas 'byung ngo zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad kyi 'byung gnas phung po yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mos pa la brten nas dang / rnam par rtog pa la brten nas dang / reg pa la brten nas 'byung ngo zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad kyi 'byung gnas phung po yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: And in the same way, the aggregates are the source of all the suffering of sentient beings.

original: rkyen can nges pa yin na ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis gzhan sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen can nges pa yin na ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis gzhan sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were determined by a condition, then the other mental factors would not have contact as their condition.

original: gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni ji skad du smras pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni ji skad du smras pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were determined by both, then the consequence would be the fault stated above.

original: de bas na ma nges pa kho na la brten par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ma nges pa kho na la brten par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is to be relied upon only as undetermined.

original: 'chad pa don med par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'chad pa don med par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not useless to explain it,

original: gtso bo'i rkyen ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rkyen ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it shows the principal condition.

original: reg pa gtso bo'i rkyen nyid yin par yang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i reg pa tha dad pas bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa gtso bo'i rkyen nyid yin par yang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i reg pa tha dad pas bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and contact is the dominant condition, because the feelings of pleasure, etc., arise from the different contacts that are the causes of experiencing pleasure, etc.

original: 'di ltar de skyes pa na rkyen gzhan dang 'dun pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa yang reg pa la ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de skyes pa na rkyen gzhan dang 'dun pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa yang reg pa la ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: When contact arises, other conditions such as attention and conceptualization, etc., also depend on contact.

original: reg pa ni nges par de dag la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: reg pa ni nges par de dag la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: But contact does not definitely depend on them.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las /
translated: In the explanation of dependent origination,

original: tshor ba rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: tshor ba rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
translated: the analysis of feeling is complete.

original: // / tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba'i sred @36b pa gang zhe na /🔽sred pa gsum ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa tha dad pas sred pa'i rab tu dbye ba gsungs kyi /
analyzed: // / tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba'i sred @36b pa gang zhe na / sred pa gsum ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa tha dad pas sred pa'i rab tu dbye ba gsungs kyi /
translated: Craving is that which craves.🔽The Blessed One has stated that craving is threefold, based on the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: ngo bo nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: He has not stated that craving is threefold in terms of its intrinsic nature.

original: gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: in relation to the different kinds of disciples, as before.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pa ni 'dod pa'i sred pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pa ni 'dod pa'i sred pa ste /
translated: Craving in the realm of desire is the craving of the realm of desire.

original: tshig bar ma mi mngon pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig bar ma mi mngon pa yin te /
translated: The middle term is elided.

original: khyi'i sbrang bu bzhin dang / grong gi phag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khyi'i sbrang bu bzhin dang / grong gi phag pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the expression “dog’s foot” and “village hog.”

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pa ci rigs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pa ci rigs par rig par bya ste /
translated: So too, one should understand the craving of the form realm and the craving of the formless realm.

original: de dag nyid khams gsum pa'i sred pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag nyid khams gsum pa'i sred pa yin par bstan to //
translated: They are taught to be the craving of the three realms.

original: de la yang 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: de la yang 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi go rims bzhin te /
translated: Moreover, they are, respectively, the craving of those who are not free from the attachment of the realm of desire and the attachment of the formless realm.

original: nyon mongs pa can tshol ba dang chags pa dang zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can tshol ba dang chags pa dang zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the afflicted search, attachment, and clinging.

original: sa gang yin pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de yang sa de nyid kyi sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: sa gang yin pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de yang sa de nyid kyi sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Whatever feeling there is in a certain realm is the condition for the craving of that realm.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la yang ji ltar sred ce na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la yang ji ltar sred ce na /
translated: How can there be craving for the feeling of pain?

original: de nyid la sred do zhes ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid la sred do zhes ni mi brjod do //
translated: We do not say that there is craving for that.

original: 'on kyang bde ba'i tshor ba ni de dang ldan zhing mi 'bral bar sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bde ba'i tshor ba ni de dang ldan zhing mi 'bral bar sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: But the pleasant feeling is the condition of craving for union with and nonseparation from the pleasant.

original: sdug bsngal ni de dang mi ldan zhing 'bral bar sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni de dang mi ldan zhing 'bral bar sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The unpleasant feeling is the condition of craving for separation from the unpleasant.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling is the condition of craving for the delight in that state.

original: bsam gtan kha cig tu ni de dang ldan zhing mi 'bral bar sred pa'i rkyen yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas reg pa dang / 'dod pa'i bde ba la mngon par dga' ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan kha cig tu ni de dang ldan zhing mi 'bral bar sred pa'i rkyen yin no // bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas reg pa dang / 'dod pa'i bde ba la mngon par dga' ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: In some contemplatives, the neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling is the condition of craving for union with and nonseparation from the neither pleasant nor unpleasant.🔽The Blessed One said, “The contact of a pleasant feeling arises when a pleasant feeling is contacted, and there is delight in the pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yang bde ba la sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yang bde ba la sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: ” The unpleasant feeling is also a condition of craving for pleasure.

original: gzhan yang tshor ba gsum dang / spyi dril du phung po'i rgyun la bye brag med par bdag tu sred pa dang / bdag tu lta ba lhan cig skyes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshor ba gsum dang / spyi dril du phung po'i rgyun la bye brag med par bdag tu sred pa dang / bdag tu lta ba lhan cig skyes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, the three feelings and the innate view of self and the innate conceit “I am” occur simultaneously and in a general way, without distinction, in the continuum of the aggregates.

original: de yang tshor ba'i sgo nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang tshor ba'i sgo nas 'byung ngo //
translated: And they occur through the medium of feeling.

original: tshor ba'i rgyun ni de thams cad kyi bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rgyun ni de thams cad kyi bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The continuum of feeling is the dominant condition for all of them.

original: rgyu chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las ji skad du /
analyzed: rgyu chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las ji skad du /
translated: As the Great Causality Sūtra says:

original: kun dga' bo gang la tshor ba med cing tshor ba po yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gang la tshor ba med cing tshor ba po yang mi dmigs na /
translated: “Ānanda, if there were no feeling and no one to experience it,

original: 'on kyang de la bdag go snyam byed dam zhes gsungs so //🔽kha cig na re de dag dbye ba med par 'byung ba na bdag gi dngos por sred pa la brten nas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag tu @37a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la bdag go snyam byed dam zhes gsungs so // kha cig na re de dag dbye ba med par 'byung ba na bdag gi dngos por sred pa la brten nas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag tu @37a * //
translated: would there be any sense of ‘I am’?”

original: lta ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: lta ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: Some say: When they occur without distinction, the view of self imputed on the basis of craving for the self occurs.

original: de dag la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skye'o //
analyzed: de dag la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skye'o //
translated: With this in mind, the Lord said: “Craving arises in dependence on feeling born of contact that is accompanied by ignorance.

original: de las 'du byed de dag go //
analyzed: de las 'du byed de dag go //
translated: From that, there is karmic formation.

original: de yang 'di ni bdag tu sma ba nye bar len pa yin par gzhag go //
analyzed: de yang 'di ni bdag tu sma ba nye bar len pa yin par gzhag go //
translated: And that is the appropriation of the self-theories.

original: de ma yin na bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ji ltar sred pa'i rkyen gyis 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ma yin na bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ji ltar sred pa'i rkyen gyis 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If it were not so, how could the appropriation of the self-theories be established as the condition of craving?

original: 'o na gal te chor ba gsum gyi rkyen gyis sred pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te chor ba gsum gyi rkyen gyis sred pa yin na /
translated: If craving is the condition of the three feelings,

original: ci'i phyir bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags phra rgyas su 'gyur bar bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bde ba'i tshor ba la 'dod chags phra rgyas su 'gyur bar bshad ce na /
translated: why is it said that attachment is the latent tendency of the feeling of pleasure?

original: rang gi rgyud kyi bde ba'i dbang du byas nas de la dmigs pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi bde ba'i dbang du byas nas de la dmigs pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is focused on that and associated with that, from the point of view of its own continuum.

original: gal te tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa yin na tshor ba thams cad la yod pas dgra bcom pa la yang sred pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa yin na tshor ba thams cad la yod pas dgra bcom pa la yang sred pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If craving is the condition of feeling, it follows that the arhat would have craving, since he has all the feelings.

original: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa'i yid bde ba la sogs pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa'i yid bde ba la sogs pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and the mental satisfactions, etc. that are based on renunciation would not exist.

original: gang dag sprin gyi char pa zhes ston na ci sprin yod na gdon mi bra bar char pa 'bab pa yin nam /
