analyzed: gang dag sprin gyi char pa zhes ston na ci sprin yod na gdon mi bra bar char pa 'bab pa yin nam /
translated: If you say that the rain falls when the clouds rain, is it certain that rain falls when there are clouds?

original: de bzhin du tshor ba yod kyang gdon mi bra bar sred pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba yod kyang gdon mi bra bar sred pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, even if there is feeling, it is not certain that craving will arise.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Why will it not arise?

original: gnyen po'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the specific antidotes.

original: 'di'i sa bon nyid gnas nas ston pa'am mnan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i sa bon nyid gnas nas ston pa'am mnan pa yin te /
translated: The seed is taught as being the basis of the seed, or as being suppressed.

original: gang gi phyir rkyen yod du zin kyang sa bon mes mnan na mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rkyen yod du zin kyang sa bon mes mnan na mi skye ba yin no //
translated: Because even if the conditions exist, the seed does not arise if it is suppressed by fire.

original: dper na zhing dang chu la sogs pa'i rkyen yod du zin kyang sa bon med pa'am mnan pa ni myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na zhing dang chu la sogs pa'i rkyen yod du zin kyang sa bon med pa'am mnan pa ni myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, even if the conditions such as the field, water, etc. exist, the sprout does not arise if the seed is absent or suppressed.

original: gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis bye brag tu byas pa yod de /
analyzed: gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis bye brag tu byas pa yod de /
translated: The Blessed One has made a distinction in another Sūtra:

original: de ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa skyes so zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba na tshor pa rnams ma shes pas 'dod chags phra rgyas su 'gyur zhing nges par mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa skyes so zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba na tshor pa rnams ma shes pas 'dod chags phra rgyas su 'gyur zhing nges par mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And: “When one experiences a pleasant feeling, due to the non-abandonment of feeling, subtle attachment arises and does not cease. ”

original: de bas na log par rtog pa'i tshor ba ni sred pa'i rkyen yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na log par rtog pa'i tshor ba ni sred pa'i rkyen yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, feeling that is wrongly grasped is the condition for craving, but not all feeling.

original: 'o na 'dir yang de bzhin du ci'i phyir bye brag tu ma byas she na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir yang de bzhin du ci'i phyir bye brag tu ma byas she na /
translated: Why is this not specified in the present case?

original: ma rig pa ni 'du byed kyi spyi'i rkyen nyid yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni 'du byed kyi spyi'i rkyen nyid yin te /
translated: Ignorance is the general condition for formations.

original: de'i don bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its meaning has already been explained.

original: kha cig tu ni sred pa'i rkyen ni ma rig pa kho na yin par bstan te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni sred pa'i rkyen ni ma rig pa kho na yin par bstan te /
translated: In some places, craving is taught to have ignorance as its condition.

original: dge slong dag ma rig pa ni sred pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag ma rig pa ni sred pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: “Monks, ignorance is the cause of craving.

original: ma rig pa ni sred @37b pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni sred @37b pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Ignorance is the condition for craving.

original: ma rig pa ni 'byung ba'i gnas yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni 'byung ba'i gnas yin no zhe'o //
translated: Ignorance is the basis for arising. ”

original: de bzhin du dge slong dag sred pa'i bras gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dag sred pa'i bras gang zhe na /
translated: In the same way, bhikṣus, what is the seed of craving?

original: ma rig pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is ignorance.

original: kha cig tu ni reg pa kho na yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni reg pa kho na yin par gsungs te /
translated: In some places, contact alone is stated as the seed of craving:

original: sred pa'i tshogs drug ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i sred pa'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sred pa'i tshogs drug ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i sred pa'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The six collections of craving are craving born from contact through the coming together of eye, form, and consciousness.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa ci yang rung ba de thams cad reg pa la brten nas zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa ci yang rung ba de thams cad reg pa la brten nas zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, whatever is the aggregate of feeling and whatever is the aggregate of formations, all that is based on contact.

original: 'dir ni tshor ba rkyen nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ni tshor ba rkyen nyid du bstan to //
translated: Here, feeling is taught as a condition.

original: ji ltar mdo sde dang mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde dang mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: How is this not in contradiction with the sūtra?

original: dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of a different intention.

original: ma rig pa ni sred pa'i spyi'i rkyen yin par dgongs nas gsungs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni sred pa'i spyi'i rkyen yin par dgongs nas gsungs so //
translated: The sūtra teaches with the intention that ignorance is the general condition of craving.

original: reg pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: reg pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Contact is the same.

original: tshor ba ni khyad par du rkyen yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba ni khyad par du rkyen yin te /
translated: Feeling is the specific condition.

original: khams gsum char na yang kun tu rmongs pa'i tshor ba sa gang yin pa ni sa de'i sred pa kun du 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum char na yang kun tu rmongs pa'i tshor ba sa gang yin pa ni sa de'i sred pa kun du 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In all three realms, the feeling of confusion that exists on a certain stage causes craving to occur on that stage.

original: sa gcig na yang ma rig pa 'dra ba las de'i tshor ba che chung gi bye brag gis sred pa'i bye brag kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sred pa kun du 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i reg pa'i tshor pa'i bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gcig na yang ma rig pa 'dra ba las de'i tshor ba che chung gi bye brag gis sred pa'i bye brag kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sred pa kun du 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i reg pa'i tshor pa'i bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And even on a single stage, craving occurs in a variety of ways because of the variety of feelings that are similar to ignorance, and because of the variety of feelings of contact that are to be experienced as pleasure, etc., which are the causes for the occurrence of craving.

original: de bas na tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in the statement, “Craving has the feeling as its condition.”

original: 'dir rkyen nges pa yin na ni ji skad du bstan pa'i skyon yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir rkyen nges pa yin na ni ji skad du bstan pa'i skyon yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the condition were definite, the consequence would be the fault that has been demonstrated.

original: rgyu gzhan dang de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen rnams sred pa'i rkyen yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan dang de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen rnams sred pa'i rkyen yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The other causes, the condition as antecedent, and the objective condition would not be the conditions for craving.

original: rkyen can nges pa yin na ni tshor ba ni chos gzhan dag gi rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen can nges pa yin na ni tshor ba ni chos gzhan dag gi rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If feeling were definitely a condition, then feeling would not be the cause, equivalent immediately antecedent condition, or object condition of other phenomena.🔽And it would contradict the sutra, which declares in detail:🔽Aversion is a negative tendency in relation to painful feeling.

original: mdo sde las sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la khong khro ba phra rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / bde ba dang ldan na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: mdo sde las sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la khong khro ba phra rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / bde ba dang ldan na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: When possessing pleasure, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: bde ba dang ldan na chos mngon par brjod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan na chos mngon par brjod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When possessing pleasure, one expresses the teachings.

original: gnyis ga nges pa yin na skyon gnyis kar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ga nges pa yin na skyon gnyis kar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If feeling were definitely both, then both errors would ensue.

original: ma nges na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma nges na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it were not definite, then the explanation would be pointless.

original: 'dir nges pa ma yin yang bshad pa don med par mi 'gyur te /🔽sred pa'i rkyen gyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du bshad @38a * //
analyzed: 'dir nges pa ma yin yang bshad pa don med par mi 'gyur te / sred pa'i rkyen gyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du bshad @38a * //
translated: Here, even though it is not definite, the explanation is not pointless,

original: pa'i phyir te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: because it teaches the specific condition of craving and because it explains it in the same way as before.

original: tshor ba ni gtso bo'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba ni gtso bo'i rkyen yin te /
translated: Feeling is the dominant condition.

original: 'di ltar bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas sred pa kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas sred pa kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For craving arises in dependence on the experience of pleasant, unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant feelings.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bshad pa las sred pa rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bshad pa las sred pa rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the analysis of craving in the explanation of dependent origination.

original: // / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba'i len pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba'i len pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is grasping, which is conditioned by craving?

original: len pa ni bzhi ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de la 'dod pa nye bar len pa nas bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: len pa ni bzhi ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de la 'dod pa nye bar len pa nas bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'i bar du yin no //
translated: Grasping is fourfold: grasping of desire, grasping of views, grasping of morality and asceticism, and grasping of the self.

original: 'dir tshig sbyar ba ni ci gzugs la mthong ba bzhin du rig par bya'am /🔽'on te gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin du yin /
analyzed: 'dir tshig sbyar ba ni ci gzugs la mthong ba bzhin du rig par bya'am / 'on te gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin du yin /
translated: Here, should grasping be understood as seeing, or as the eye?

original: de las cir 'gyur ;
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur ;
translated: What is the consequence of each of these?

original: gzugs la mthong ba bzhin du yin na ni 'dod pa la sogs pa la nye bar len pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la mthong ba bzhin du yin na ni 'dod pa la sogs pa la nye bar len pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If grasping is seeing, then grasping desire would be the four views that are included in desire realm.

original: nye bar blang ba tha dad pa'i sgo nas nye bar len pa'i rab tu dbye ba kho na bstan pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba tha dad pa'i sgo nas nye bar len pa'i rab tu dbye ba kho na bstan pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The classification of the appropriator is taught only from the perspective of the appropriated being different, not from the perspective of its own nature.

original: de la 'dod pa la sogs pa yang gang yin /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa la sogs pa yang gang yin /
translated: What are desire and so on?

original: de dag gi nye bar len pa yang gang zhig yin par bstan par bya /
analyzed: de dag gi nye bar len pa yang gang zhig yin par bstan par bya /
translated: What is their appropriation?

original: gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin no zhe na /
translated: They are like the form base.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa nyid nye bar len pa yin pas nye bar len pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang rab tu dbye ba yang bstan par byas pa yin na ni 'dod pa la sogs pa gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa nyid nye bar len pa yin pas nye bar len pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang rab tu dbye ba yang bstan par byas pa yin na ni 'dod pa la sogs pa gang zhig yin /
translated: If desire and so on are taught to be appropriation and the classification of the appropriator is taught to be its own nature, then what are desire and so on?

original: nye bar len pa yin par ji ltar bstan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa yin par ji ltar bstan par bya zhe na /
translated: How can they be taught to be appropriation?

original: gzugs la mthong ba bzhin no zhes tshig sbyar ba 'di bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la mthong ba bzhin no zhes tshig sbyar ba 'di bya'o //
translated: The sentence “They are like the form base” should be applied here.

original: rab tu dbye ba kho nas kyang kha cig gis rang gi ngo bo rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba kho nas kyang kha cig gis rang gi ngo bo rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It was previously explained that some will understand the nature of the appropriator through its classification alone.

original: de la 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga yin par 'dir dgongs so //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga yin par 'dir dgongs so //
translated: Here, desire refers to the five sense pleasures.🔽In another text, it says:

original: gzhan nas ji skad du 'dod pa can 'dod pa zhas bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po de dag gi tshig bla dags yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nas ji skad du 'dod pa can 'dod pa zhas bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po de dag gi tshig bla dags yin no //
translated: Those who are desirous are called “desirous” because of the five sense pleasures.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: gal te 'dod pa tshol byed cing //🔽'dod pa skyes pa'i lus can de //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa tshol byed cing // 'dod pa skyes pa'i lus can de //
translated: If one seeks sense pleasures,🔽then,

original: 'dod pa de dag ma 'byor na //
analyzed: 'dod pa de dag ma 'byor na //
translated: if one is born with a desire for sense pleasures,

original: zug rdu zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: zug rdu zug bzhin gnod par 'gyur //
translated: one will be harmed, like being pierced by a thorn,

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: if one does not obtain those sense pleasures.

original: lta ba'i tshig sbyor ba ni yod par lta ba dang / rnam par 'jig par lta ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i tshig sbyor ba ni yod par lta ba dang / rnam par 'jig par lta ba'o //
translated: The term view is a compound that means the view of existence and the view of annihilation.

original: de'i sgo nas lta ba gzhan du song ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas lta ba gzhan du song ba yang yin no //
translated: One goes to another view through that view.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs so //
translated: Morality and asceticism that are related to that view are morality and asceticism.

original: de la bya ba ma yin pa las ldog par dam bcas pa ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de la bya ba ma yin pa las ldog par dam bcas pa ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is a vow to abstain from what should not be done.

original: cha lugs dang / btung ba dang / bza' ba dang / khrus dang spyod pa drag po la sogs pa'i @38b khyad par dam bcas pa ni brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: cha lugs dang / btung ba dang / bza' ba dang / khrus dang spyod pa drag po la sogs pa'i @38b khyad par dam bcas pa ni brtul zhugs so //
translated: The vows are the special observances of dress, drink, food, bathing, and violent behavior.

original: bdag go zhes lta ba ni bdag tu smra ba ste /
analyzed: bdag go zhes lta ba ni bdag tu smra ba ste /
translated: The theory of self is the view of self.

original: de'i sgo nas bdag go zhes smra ba'i phyir bdag tu lta ba can ni bdag tu smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas bdag go zhes smra ba'i phyir bdag tu lta ba can ni bdag tu smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who has the view of self is the theorist of self, because he speaks of self by means of that view.

original: smra ba nyid kyis ci bstan zhe na /🔽de'i sgo nas smra ba nyi tshe byed par zad kyi dris na ni mi shes te /
analyzed: smra ba nyid kyis ci bstan zhe na / de'i sgo nas smra ba nyi tshe byed par zad kyi dris na ni mi shes te /
translated: What does the theorist of self teach?

original: bdag tu lta ba ni gzhi can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni gzhi can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He teaches only by means of that view, but he does not know when questioned, because the view of self is not a basis.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag go zhes smra zhing mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag go zhes smra zhing mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: He speaks of the five aggregates as the self and clings to them as the self.

original: gzhan dag na re bdag tu lta ba ni smra ba ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bdag tu lta ba ni smra ba ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: Others say that the view of self is not a theory.

original: mdo sde gzhan las ji skad du dge slong dag ji ltar na byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo mi mkhas pa ma rig pa'i dbang du song ba dag / nye bar len pa'i phung po 'di la bdag tu smra ba mngon par
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las ji skad du dge slong dag ji ltar na byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo mi mkhas pa ma rig pa'i dbang du song ba dag / nye bar len pa'i phung po 'di la bdag tu smra ba mngon par
translated: Monks, how do childish, ignorant, ordinary beings, who are not learned, who are under the influence of ignorance,

original: zhen pa'i phra rgyas sems la 'brel cing yongs su zhen par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zhen pa'i phra rgyas sems la 'brel cing yongs su zhen par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: cling to the appropriation of the aggregates as the self?

original: dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo dag gzugs la bdag go zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo dag gzugs la bdag go zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: Monks, childish, ignorant, ordinary beings see form as the self.

original: de la gal te bdag tu lta ba ni bdag tu smra ba yin no zhe na ni mngon par zhen pa gzhan gang zhig yin /🔽de bas ni tshig tha ma mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir bdag tu smra ba ste /
analyzed: de la gal te bdag tu lta ba ni bdag tu smra ba yin no zhe na ni mngon par zhen pa gzhan gang zhig yin / de bas ni tshig tha ma mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir bdag tu smra ba ste /
translated: If the view of the self is the assertion of the self, then what is the clinging?

original: bdag tu smra ba mngon par zhen pa yin par bstan te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba mngon par zhen pa yin par bstan te /
translated: Therefore, because the last word is not expressed, the assertion of the self is taught to be the clinging to the assertion of the self.

original: dper na tshig phyed smra bar byed pa la sogs pa la tshig phyed smra ba zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tshig phyed smra bar byed pa la sogs pa la tshig phyed smra ba zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, one who speaks half a verse is called one who speaks half a verse.

original: smra ba ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: smra ba ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: Why is speaking mentioned?

original: smra ba cam na mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: smra ba cam na mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because it teaches that one who speaks is one who conceives.

original: ji skad du dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo dag gis bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni brtags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ji skad du dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo dag gis bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni brtags pa yin gyi /
translated: As it is said, “Monks, the childish, the ignorant, the unlearned, the ordinary person conceive of self and what belongs to self.

original: bdag gir bya ba de la ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: bdag gir bya ba de la ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so ;
translated: But in reality, there is no self or what belongs to self.”

original: / gzhan dag na re 'di la bdag go zhes smra bas bdag tu smra ba yin te /
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re 'di la bdag go zhes smra bas bdag tu smra ba yin te /
translated: Others say: One who speaks of self is one who speaks of self because of the expression “this is my self.”

original: lus kyi dngos po gang la bdag go zhes brtags pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dngos po gang la bdag go zhes brtags pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: The body is the basis for the conception of self.

original: 'o na de lta na phung po nyid la bdag tu smra ba yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na phung po nyid la bdag tu smra ba yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If that is so, then the aggregates are said to be the self.

original: gang phung po de dag la bdag tu smra bar mngon par zhen pa phra rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas de ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang phung po de dag la bdag tu smra bar mngon par zhen pa phra rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas de ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how could that be correct, since it is said that the subtle proliferators are the views that the aggregates are the self?

original: der ni tshig sbyar ba gzhan du bya zhing 'dir yang gzhan du yin pas 'dir mi rung ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: der ni tshig sbyar ba gzhan du bya zhing 'dir yang gzhan du yin pas 'dir mi rung ba ci zhig yod /
translated: Here the phrase should be construed differently, and it is also construed differently in other sūtras. So what is wrong with this interpretation?

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de nye bar len pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de nye bar len pa yin te /
translated: The craving for desire realm objects and so on is the appropriation of desire realm objects and so forth.

original: ji skad du mdo sde gzhan las gang la 'dun pa @39a * //🔽dang ; 'dod chags pa de ni 'dir nye bar len pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du mdo sde gzhan las gang la 'dun pa @39a * // dang ; 'dod chags pa de ni 'dir nye bar len pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: As another sūtra declares:🔽That which is craving and attachment is appropriation.

original: de la ldan par mngon par 'dod pa ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de la ldan par mngon par 'dod pa ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: Here, aspiration is the desire to possess something.

original: de dang ldan pa de la mngon par dga' ba ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa de la mngon par dga' ba ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment is the delight in possessing it.

original: ji ltar na 'dun pa dang 'dod chags nye bar len pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dun pa dang 'dod chags nye bar len pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can aspiration and attachment be appropriation?

original: des 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag len par byed do //
analyzed: des 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag len par byed do //
translated: They appropriate desire realm objects and so on.

original: de skyes na de'i yid len pa po yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skyes na de'i yid len pa po yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, then it would be the appropriator of that mind.

original: gal te bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags yin no //
analyzed: gal te bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags yin no //
translated: If the self is the appropriator, then the self is the appropriator of craving and attachment.🔽But how could this be tenable in light of the sutra on the unattractive, which states:

original: mi sdug pa'i mdo sde las dge slong dag de la bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa rtag pa dang ther zug pa dang gzhi ma dang yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang ; yang dag pa de bzhin du gnas pa dag nye bar blangs sam zhes gang gsungs pa de dag ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i mdo sde las dge slong dag de la bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa rtag pa dang ther zug pa dang gzhi ma dang yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang ; yang dag pa de bzhin du gnas pa dag nye bar blangs sam zhes gang gsungs pa de dag ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
translated: Monks, in this regard, the self is the appropriator of the permanent, the eternal, the stable, and the immutable, and it is the self that abides forever.

original: de la bdag tu smra bas gang la bdag tu brtags pa'i dngos po gang blangs pa de bdag tu smra ba nye bar len par bstan te /
analyzed: de la bdag tu smra bas gang la bdag tu brtags pa'i dngos po gang blangs pa de bdag tu smra ba nye bar len par bstan te /
translated: In this sutra, the self is taught to be the appropriator of whatever entity is imputed to be the self.

original: gal te 'dun pa dang 'dod chags dag nye bar len pa yin na ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa'i rnam grangs sred pa nyid smras par gyur pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dun pa dang 'dod chags dag nye bar len pa yin na ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa'i rnam grangs sred pa nyid smras par gyur pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If craving and attachment are the appropriator, then craving would not be stated as a separate condition for appropriation, since craving itself would be the appropriator.

original: gal te tshor ba la sred pa ni 'dod pa la sogs pa la sred pa'i rnam grangs kyi rkyen yin par bstan na de la nyes pa ci yod /
analyzed: gal te tshor ba la sred pa ni 'dod pa la sogs pa la sred pa'i rnam grangs kyi rkyen yin par bstan na de la nyes pa ci yod /
translated: If craving for feeling is taught to be a condition for craving for desire realm objects and so on, what is wrong with that?

original: de ltar ma bstan na yang 'di ji ltar shes par byas pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar ma bstan na yang 'di ji ltar shes par byas pa yin /
translated: If it is not taught in that way, how is it understood?

original: tshor ba la sred pas ni ji ltar rigs par khams gsum pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa tshol zhing de dag la chags par byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba la sred pas ni ji ltar rigs par khams gsum pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa tshol zhing de dag la chags par byed do //
translated: Craving for feeling seeks and is attached to the causes of the feelings of pleasure and so on of the three realms, as is appropriate.

original: gzhan dag gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin du tshig sbyor bar byed pa der 'dod pa rnams ni tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: gzhan dag gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin du tshig sbyor bar byed pa der 'dod pa rnams ni tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
translated: Others apply this to the base of form, but those who assert that it is desire are like the verse that states:

original: 'jig rten dag na sna tshogs gang yin de dag 'dod pa min //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na sna tshogs gang yin de dag 'dod pa min //
translated: Whatever variety exists in the world is not desire.

original: kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags skyes bu rnams kyi 'dod pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags skyes bu rnams kyi 'dod pa yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Desire is the desire of beings born from the conception of attachment.

original: gang gis 'dod par byed pa de dag ni gcig kho nar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'dod par byed pa de dag ni gcig kho nar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Those who desire are only one.

original: gang la 'dod pa gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs dag ni 'dod chags dang bcas pas 'dod par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang la 'dod pa gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs dag ni 'dod chags dang bcas pas 'dod par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The various objects of desire, such as form, are desired by those who are attached to them,

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni ma yin pas /
translated: not by those who are free from attachment.

original: de dag gi 'dod pa ni gcig kho nar ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi 'dod pa ni gcig kho nar ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, their desires are not determined to be only one.

original: don de nyid phyed 'og mas ston par byed de /
analyzed: don de nyid phyed 'og mas ston par byed de /
translated: The second half of the verse shows the same meaning.

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs de bzhin gnas pa yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs de bzhin gnas pa yin //
translated: The world abides in various ways.

original: 'on kyang bstan rnams de la 'dun pa 'dul //
analyzed: 'on kyang bstan rnams de la 'dun pa 'dul //
translated: But the teachings tame the desire for those.

original: zhe'o // de bas na kun du rtog @39b pa'i 'dod chags nyid 'dir 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: zhe'o // de bas na kun du rtog @39b pa'i 'dod chags nyid 'dir 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the desire that is imagined here is desire,

original: de nyid nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: and that itself is appropriation.

original: lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang bdag tu smra ba yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang bdag tu smra ba yang de bzhin te /
translated: The same applies to views, morality and spiritual disciplines, and the claim of self.

original: dang po ji ltar bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dang po ji ltar bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: The first is as taught.

original: de dag nyid len pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid len pa yin no //
translated: Those themselves are appropriation.

original: 'dod pa yul la yin par 'dod pa rnams kyi nye bar len pa gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa yul la yin par 'dod pa rnams kyi nye bar len pa gang zhig yin /
translated: What is the appropriation of those who desire the objects of desire?

original: thams cad kyis kyang yang srid do //
analyzed: thams cad kyis kyang yang srid do //
translated: All of them are for the sake of rebirth.

original: de dag gis ji ltar yang srid pa len par byed ce na /
analyzed: de dag gis ji ltar yang srid pa len par byed ce na /
translated: How do they appropriate existence?

original: de tha dad pas yang srid par 'gyur ba'i las rnams srid par 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tha dad pas yang srid par 'gyur ba'i las rnams srid par 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they cause the karma that will lead to rebirth to come into existence.

original: yang na 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag nyid tshor ba la sred pa rnams kyis de dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis len pas na len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag nyid tshor ba la sred pa rnams kyis de dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis len pas na len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, they appropriate existence by the method of manifest clinging to those desires, etc. as the reasons for possessing them through craving for feelings.

original: dper na sbyin pa'i sbyin pa po yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir gang sbyin pa de sbyin pa zhes ston pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sbyin pa'i sbyin pa po yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir gang sbyin pa de sbyin pa zhes ston pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, in the statement “He is the giver of gifts,” the one who gives is called the giver.

original: rab tu byed pa dag 'don pa na 'dod pa nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dag 'don pa na 'dod pa nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
translated: In the Abhidharma, the question “What is the appropriation of desire?”

original: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs ma gtogs pa gang de las gzhan pa 'dod pa dang / rab tu ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang /🔽kun nas dkris pa dang / 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs ma gtogs pa gang de las gzhan pa 'dod pa dang / rab tu ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and entanglements associated with desire, except for the views associated with desire.

original: lta ba bzhi ni lta ba'i nye bar len pa ste ;
analyzed: lta ba bzhi ni lta ba'i nye bar len pa ste ;
translated: The attachment to views is the four views,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba nas lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba nas lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i bar du yin no //
translated: from the view of the transitory collection up to the view of holding to a rule and ritual as paramount.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attachment to morality and asceticism?🔽Some, in various ways, hold morality to be paramount and believe that through morality one becomes pure, liberated,

original: ji ltar yang de dag kha cig ni tshul khrims la mchog tu 'dzin cing tshul khrims kyis dag pa dang grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yang de dag kha cig ni tshul khrims la mchog tu 'dzin cing tshul khrims kyis dag pa dang grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that morality leads to emancipation and the transcendence of happiness and suffering.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains liberation from pleasure and pain.

original: brtul zhugs la mchog tu 'dzin cing brtul zhugs kyis dag pa dang grol ba dang / nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brtul zhugs la mchog tu 'dzin cing brtul zhugs kyis dag pa dang grol ba dang / nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: One holds that observances are supreme, and that through observances one will be purified, liberated, and attain deliverance.

original: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs gnyis ka la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs de gnyis kas dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs gnyis ka la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs de gnyis kas dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: One holds both morality and observances to be supreme, and that through both morality and observances one will be purified.

original: de ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the appropriation of morality and observances.

original: bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the appropriation of the belief in a self?

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang / rab tu ldan pa'i lta @40a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang / rab tu ldan pa'i lta @40a * //
translated: It is the view associated with the realms of form and the formless.

original: ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs ma gtogs par gang de las gzhan pa gzugs dang gzugs mad pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas dkris pa rnams te /🔽'di ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs ma gtogs par gang de las gzhan pa gzugs dang gzugs mad pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas dkris pa rnams te / 'di ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.

original: de la 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nye bar len pa ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa zhes bya ste /🔽gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin du tshig sbyar ba 'grub par 'gyur te /🔽tshig bar ma mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir 'bru mar gyi stobs bzhin no //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nye bar len pa ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa zhes bya ste / gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin du tshig sbyar ba 'grub par 'gyur te / tshig bar ma mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir 'bru mar gyi stobs bzhin no //
translated: The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.

original: rab tu ldan pa ni rab tu 'brel zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu ldan pa ni rab tu 'brel zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.

original: lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa ni lta ba dang tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs de dag nyid yin na /
analyzed: lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa ni lta ba dang tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs de dag nyid yin na /
translated: The appropriator of the view of the transitory collection is the appropriator of the view of the transitory collection.🔽The appropriator of the view

original: bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa go mi shes na ci gzugs dang gzugs med pa nyid bdag tu smra ba yin nam /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa go mi shes na ci gzugs dang gzugs med pa nyid bdag tu smra ba yin nam /
translated: If you do not understand the term “the propounders of self and appropriation,” are you propounding form and formlessness to be the self?

original: de dang rab tu ldan pa'i nye bar len pa rnams bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa yin nam ;
analyzed: de dang rab tu ldan pa'i nye bar len pa rnams bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa yin nam ;
translated: Or are you propounding the appropriated aggregates that are associated with them to be the self?

original: 'on te gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pa de dag yin te bdag tu smra ba yang yin la nye bar len pa yang yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pa de dag yin te bdag tu smra ba yang yin la nye bar len pa yang yin nam /
translated: Or are you propounding the fetters and so on that are associated with form and formlessness to be the self and appropriation?

original: ji ltar de dang de dag la bdag tu smra ba zhes bya /
analyzed: ji ltar de dang de dag la bdag tu smra ba zhes bya /
translated: How are they called the propounders of the self?

original: ci de las gzhan ma ming bdag tu smra ba zhes brjod pa zhig yin par khyed kyis brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: ci de las gzhan ma ming bdag tu smra ba zhes brjod pa zhig yin par khyed kyis brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: You must explain whether something other than those is called the propounders of the self.🔽The Bhagavān himself states in another sūtra:

original: sbyor ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mdo sde gzhan las 'dod pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mdo sde gzhan las 'dod pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the application of desire?

original: dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi 'dod pa ni kun 'byung ba yang yin /
analyzed: dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi 'dod pa ni kun 'byung ba yang yin /
translated: Bhikṣus, the desire of foolish, untrained, ordinary beings is the origin of suffering.

original: nub pa yang yin no zhes rgyas par byas nas /
analyzed: nub pa yang yin no zhes rgyas par byas nas /
translated: and also is extinguished.

original: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang 'dod pa'i dga' ba'i bar du 'di'i 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang 'dod pa'i dga' ba'i bar du 'di'i 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The desire for sensual pleasures and the joy in sensual pleasures arise in him.

original: 'dod pa'i lhag par zhen pa'i bar du 'di'i sems mthar thug par gnas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lhag par zhen pa'i bar du 'di'i sems mthar thug par gnas te /
translated: His mind is fixed on the extreme of attachment to sensual pleasures.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the fetter of sensual pleasures.

original: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba ji lta bar srid pa'i sbyor ba dang lta ba'i sbyor ba yang de bzhin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba ji lta bar srid pa'i sbyor ba dang lta ba'i sbyor ba yang de bzhin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The fetters of existence and false views should be explained in the same way as the fetter of sensual pleasures.

original: rab tu byed pa bdag de la sgro 'dogs par byed pa 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i lta ba dang / ma rig pa ma gtogs par gang de las gzhan pa 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang phra rgyas dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bdag de la sgro 'dogs par byed pa 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i lta ba dang / ma rig pa ma gtogs par gang de las gzhan pa 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang phra rgyas dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: In this regard, the fetter of sensual pleasures is the ten proclivities that are abandoned by the path of cultivation, with the exception of the two views and ignorance.

original: kun nas dkris pa 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the fetter of sensual pleasures.

original: gzugs dang @40b gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i lta ba dang / ma rig pa ma gtogs par gang de las gzhan pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas la sogs pa 'di ni srid pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang @40b gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i lta ba dang / ma rig pa ma gtogs par gang de las gzhan pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas la sogs pa 'di ni srid pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The other fetters, bonds, latent afflictions, etc., associated with the realms of form and the formless, except for ignorance, are the fetter of existence.

original: lta ba lnga ni lta ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba lnga ni lta ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The five views are the fetter of views.

original: ma rig pa'i sbyor ba ni khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sbyor ba ni khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa'o zhe'o //
translated: The fetter of ignorance is the non-understanding of the three realms.

original: de bas na nye bar len pa la yang sgro btags pa byas par srid pa yin no //🔽nye bar len pa rnams dang por ji ltar bstan pa de ltar ni sgro btags pa yang ma yin la gang 'dir 'dun pa dang 'dod chags 'di ni 'dir nye bar len pa yin no zhes bya ba'i nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni mdo sde gzhan
analyzed: de bas na nye bar len pa la yang sgro btags pa byas par srid pa yin no // nye bar len pa rnams dang por ji ltar bstan pa de ltar ni sgro btags pa yang ma yin la gang 'dir 'dun pa dang 'dod chags 'di ni 'dir nye bar len pa yin no zhes bya ba'i nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni mdo sde gzhan
translated: Thus, existence is also a superimposition on the appropriating aggregates.🔽The appropriating aggregates are not a superimposition in the way that they are presented here.

original: dang yang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: dang yang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: The characteristic of the appropriating aggregates is in accordance with other sutras, namely, the desire and craving that exist here are the appropriating aggregates here.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa dang shin tu mthun par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa dang shin tu mthun par byas pa yin no //
translated: The practice of desire and so on is also very much in accord with the appropriation of desire and so on.

original: 'di yang ye shes la 'jug pa las 'byung ba dang shin tu mthun par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang ye shes la 'jug pa las 'byung ba dang shin tu mthun par byas pa yin no //
translated: This is also very much in accord with what appears in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang kun du rgyu ba dag 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs nye bar len pa'i spong ba dang yongs su shes pa 'chad par byed kyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang kun du rgyu ba dag 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs nye bar len pa'i spong ba dang yongs su shes pa 'chad par byed kyi /
translated: Why do the non-Buddhist practitioners and parivrajakas explain the abandonment and full understanding of the appropriation of desire, the appropriation of views, and the appropriation of morality and asceticism,

original: bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: but not the abandonment and full understanding of the appropriation of the doctrine of self?

original: smras pa gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang kun tu rgyu ba dag yun ring por bdag tu mngon par zhen cing sems can dang 'gro ba po dang / gso ba po dang / gang zag tu mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: smras pa gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang kun tu rgyu ba dag yun ring por bdag tu mngon par zhen cing sems can dang 'gro ba po dang / gso ba po dang / gang zag tu mngon par zhen te /
translated: They say that the non-Buddhist practitioners and parivrajakas have long been attached to the self, and are attached to the sentient being, the one who goes, the one who is nourished, and the person.

original: de dag bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang sems can dang srog dang 'gro ba po dang / gso ba po dang gang zag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba ma yin no /
analyzed: de dag bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang sems can dang srog dang 'gro ba po dang / gso ba po dang gang zag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba ma yin no /
translated: They are not free from the manifest clinging to a self, to a sentient being, to a life-force, to a nourisher, to a person, etc.

original: brda sprod pa pa dag ni bdag gi bdag gang yin pa ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: brda sprod pa pa dag ni bdag gi bdag gang yin pa ni yod pa yin te /
translated: The grammarians say: “The self of the self exists,

original: de'i spong pa dang / yongs su shes pa bshad par bya'o zhe'o //🔽gzhung de dag ni bdag tu smra ba la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di dang shin tu mthun pa yin gyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab
analyzed: de'i spong pa dang / yongs su shes pa bshad par bya'o zhe'o // gzhung de dag ni bdag tu smra ba la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di dang shin tu mthun pa yin gyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab
translated: because its abandonment and its complete understanding are taught.”

original: tu ldan pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tu ldan pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa dang ni ma yin no //
translated: These texts are in complete agreement with the meaning of the statement: “The aspiration and attachment to the doctrine of a self is the appropriation of the doctrine of a self and the manifest clinging to a self,” and not with the manifest clinging to the fetters, etc., associated with the form and formless realms.

original: ci'i phyir len pa rnam pa bzhir gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir len pa rnam pa bzhir gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the appropriators established as four?

original: khyim pa'i phyogs dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs las brtsams te /
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs las brtsams te /
translated: In terms of the householder’s side and the renunciant’s side.

original: khyim pa rnams ni phal cher 'dod pa nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams ni phal cher 'dod pa nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: The householders are generally attached to the desire realm.

original: rab tu byung ba 'di las phyi rol pa /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'di las phyi rol pa /
translated: The non-Buddhists who have gone forth from the home life

original: @41a * // phal cher ni de las gzhan pa ste /🔽'di lta ste de dag 'dod pa rnams spangs nas rab tu 'byung ste ma 'ongs pa na /
analyzed: @41a * // phal cher ni de las gzhan pa ste / 'di lta ste de dag 'dod pa rnams spangs nas rab tu 'byung ste ma 'ongs pa na /
translated: are generally attached to the other two realms.🔽For, having renounced the desires, they go forth from the home life in order to experience the desirable and to avoid the undesirable in the future.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa myong ba rnams ldan pa dang bral bar 'dod pas yod par bya ba'i phyir ram med par bya ba'i phyir rab tu 'byung ngo //🔽rab tu byung nas kyang bsam gtan dang / rtogs pa'i bye brag la brten nas rtag par lta ba'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa myong ba rnams ldan pa dang bral bar 'dod pas yod par bya ba'i phyir ram med par bya ba'i phyir rab tu 'byung ngo // rab tu byung nas kyang bsam gtan dang / rtogs pa'i bye brag la brten nas rtag par lta ba'am /
translated: They go forth in order to obtain or to avoid something.🔽Having gone forth, they fall into the view of eternalism or

original: chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: annihilationism, based on the distinctions of meditative concentration and realization.

original: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du yod par lta ba la brten pa'am /
analyzed: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du yod par lta ba la brten pa'am /
translated: These views are based, respectively, on the view of existence or

original: med par lta ba la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: med par lta ba la brten pa yin no //
translated: the view of nonexistence.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyang de dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyang de dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Morality and observances are related to these views.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten so so'i lta ba la brten pa gang yang rung ba de dag thams cad lta ba gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten so so'i lta ba la brten pa gang yang rung ba de dag thams cad lta ba gnyis pa ste /
translated: As the Bhagavån has said, “Any view whatsoever that is based on the world is twofold:

original: yod par lta ba dang med par lta ba yin no //🔽bdag tu smra ba yang gnyis la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: yod par lta ba dang med par lta ba yin no // bdag tu smra ba yang gnyis la brten pa yin te /
translated: the view of existence and the view of nonexistence.

original: ma 'ongs pa na bdag yod pa dang med par yongs su rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na bdag yod pa dang med par yongs su rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The theory of self is also based on the two, because one speculates that the self exists or does not exist in the future.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag tu lta ba ni lta ba nye bar len pa'i nang du 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag tu lta ba ni lta ba nye bar len pa'i nang du 'dus pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the view of self is included in the appropriation of views,

original: 'di las phyi rol pa thams cad kyis de nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa thams cad kyis de nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all non-Buddhists appropriate it.

original: lta ba gzhan ni thams cad kyi nang nas 'ga' tsam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba gzhan ni thams cad kyi nang nas 'ga' tsam yang ma yin no //
translated: No other view is included in any of the others.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong ngam /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavån said, “Monks,

original: bram ze gang dag 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa'i spang ba dang yongs su shes pa 'chad pa ni 'ga' tsam yod kyi bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bram ze gang dag 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa'i spang ba dang yongs su shes pa 'chad pa ni 'ga' tsam yod kyi bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There are some Brahmins who explain the abandonment and knowledge of the abandonment of the appropriation of desire, the appropriation of views, and the appropriation of morality and asceticism, but not the appropriation of the doctrine of the self.

original: sred pa ni gsum du bstan la nye bar len pa ni bzhi yin na gang zhig gang gi rkyen gyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: sred pa ni gsum du bstan la nye bar len pa ni bzhi yin na gang zhig gang gi rkyen gyis yin zhe na /
translated: Craving is taught to be threefold, and appropriation is fourfold. What is the condition of what?

original: 'dod pa'i sred pa'i rkyen gyis 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sred pa'i rkyen gyis 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa yin te /
translated: The appropriation of desire is the condition of the craving for desire.

original: mthong ba'i chos kho na la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams kyi ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pa gang yin pa de la brten nas de 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kho na la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams kyi ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pa gang yin pa de la brten nas de 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Those who desire to be endowed with pleasure and to be separated from suffering in this very life, on the basis of the craving for desire that occurs in the desire realm, that is its arising.
